ownerResponse/text:
Dear Rashmi

I am sorry that you thought the pool very small. It is a plunge pool and that is what we state on our website etc, so we have never promised an Olympic sized pool!

You appeared from your room at midday asking for breakfast, whereas  in fact that was the time you were due to have checked out by. You were offered King coconut, which you declined. Meal times are clearly set out int the welcome letter in the rooms, and breakfast finishes at 10.30.

Like many other hotels in Sri Lanka, we do not offer driver's accommodation, and for some very good reasons. When you checked in, the Hotel manager gave you details of a guest house for your driver which is very close to the hotel, so I fail to see what the problem is. Maybe you were simply expecting us to provide free accommodation for your driver?

This is all very sad, considering the staff made a special effort for you dinner the night before for your anniversary, with a set up in the garden, flowers etc, none of which we charged for.  

Yours sincerely,

George Cooper
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: In suite rooms The pool is very very small . Not upto the mark
text: We had booked a suite room with a pool .. the pool is very very small . The room is big and good. The staff were friendly.  We missed Breakfast and requested if they could arrange any food they denied which is not so welcoming for any tourist.  Also there is no driver room which is very sad.. as drivers should stay far and tourist finds difficult to go out on time also . Few things if addressed then other things are OK
title: Accommodation

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Devit,

I am sorry that you thought the food was so disappointing. Generally we get very good reviews for the food so this is bit of a mystery. I have spoken to our Executive Chef and he was perplexed by your comments as well. However we will try to ensure that this does not happen again.

Thank you for coming to The Villa, and again, I am sorry that you found the food not to your liking.

With best wishes,

George Cooper
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: Food was totally a mess . It wasn’t tasty at all . If you need a chef to cook such horrible or tasteless food , whats the point ? Lack of every tasty ingredients , I don’t know how people eat them , surely it was only few people were in restaurant explain the situation. we surely have enjoyed the way better taste from simple place than this.I’m not sure whether they have a good chef or not. if doesn’t have they need to recruit someone immediately because they need lots of improvements. apart from that other everything was good we had very good and quick check-in experience and gave a free upgrade to the suite Room we appreciate it .The room was lovely with a great view out to garden. Bar staff and restaurant staff were good.
title: Mixed Experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for reviewing Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

It is quite unfortunate that your recent stay with us did not meet your expectations. We have well noted your detailed feedback about your experience at the Villa Bentota about our staff and service. While we assure you that our team is committed to ensure our guests are treated to a unique experience we shall further investigate your claims in order to understand and to take corrective measures if any so that similar situations do not occur. Thank you for your review.

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
I stayed there for my last 2 nights of my holiday and even though I was quite charmed by the premises and stylish decor, I was also very upset about the arrogance and ignorance from reception staff when I complained about my room which was so small, I could not fit in the door with my beach bag on my shoulder. There was no space to leave or put my suitcase as I didn’t want to unpack the huge suitcase for my last 2 days. No chair in the room, the table Next to the bed so small, I could not leave a book or anything there, phone and plugs so dirty, the bathroom also very run down and dirty. 
As a reply to my complaint, that the room is really a joke and not worth the money, I was offered to leave the hotel and find somewhere else to stay. Since I didn’t want to spend the last days searching the web or surroundings for alternative hotels and since I liked the decor and premises of the hotel, I asked for a free Upgrade... which of course was denied and again, the arrogance of the hotel manager was quite something, when he again offered me to happily leave the hotel. 
I didn’t want to spoil my last holiday days and stayed there in the end but was very, very unhappy about the whole situation and ignorance. 
The room was also dirty and would need a serious clean and renovation. Even then, they should consider renting this room as the size of the room is in total pretty much the size of 2 single mattresses. This is not a design or luxurious hotel considering the attitude and state of bath and bedroom
title: Nice and stylish hotel, room (single) the size of a shoebox and staff at reception, that was quite arrogant

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for reviewing Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

We are pleased that you enjoyed your recent stay with us. Every aspect of the hotel has been designed with much thought and care to ensure that all our guests are treated to a unique experience. Our team is committed to serve our guests to the fullest capacity but in the event of the hotel being at 100% occupancy room changes can be extremely limited. 

As we are a unique private hotel with a small inventory of rooms the hotel is not crowded as you may witness in larger hotels. Guests who stay in private hotels generally seek privacy and prefer a calm and quiet environment for which we cater well. We can assure you that the pricing in our menus are in par with similar establishments. The passing train certainly does add to the whole charm and experience.

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: One with a view
text: We stayed at this hotel in January a stop off between Galle & Colombo we were showed to our room with its own private plunge pool which was very nice unfortunately it was quite dark & no views as the only window was looking out to the plunge pool & a wall. We asked if we could have another room but were told there weren’t any available. The food in the restaurant was quite nice but there were only 4 or 6 people in each time we ate there breakfast & dinner. The bar area was always empty as it was quite expensive & there was no atmosphere in there. The swimming pool area was quite nice but again very few people seemed to use it. The beach is about 200m away & to access it you have to cross the railway line which we found to be a novelty. The beach is beautiful & very private as again there were very few people.
title: Vacation

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for reviewing Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

We appreciate your feedback about your recent stay at our hotel. While we thank you for your comments about staff service and food it is quite unfortunate that you were not able to spend all three days at The Villa as planned. 

The interior of the hotel has been designed with much thought and care to ensure that our guests are treated to a unique experience. The rooms are of certain dark tones which is part of the total design. We can assure you that our guests who stay at The Villa are quite attracted to its design, antiques and art on display. The whole property is an artistic expression which is much appreciated by many. 

We have noted your comments about the room upgrade. While it is a management decision to offer a free upgrade, an upgrade fee is imposed in any hotel in the country for any guest who wishes to be accommodated in higher room category. This is a common practice in hotels in Sri Lanka. The railway tracks certainly does add to the whole charm of the property and it runs along the coast in most parts in the south neighboring most of the beach resorts.

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
We planned to stay here for 3 nights but ended up only staying one. It is a nice hotel but let me explain why we decided to go:

- we arrived and were put in a very small room, yes, it was very cheap so fair enough. However, I found it very dark and depressing. This may well have been due to the fact that the weather was awful but none the less not a room that I wanted to spend time in. 
- The bathroom was tiny and in need of a revamp. 
- I asked the front desk if they had any larger rooms available. I very much expected them to say yes seeing as the hotel was virtually empty. However, they said that they had no more standard rooms left and I would have to pay 50 USD a night to upgrade, this was then lowered to 40. To be honest I wasn't willing to pay extra for a room when it was still gloomy. 
- as I've said above the place was so empty, to the extent that it felt odd. Eating dinner with one other couple is a weird atmosphere.
- little to do in surrounding area.
- train woke me up in the night. Yes it is charming but equally not ideal! 

There were positives:

- food was delicious and the included breakfast was very nice.
- staff were great from the start - when we said we were leaving they were extremely apologetic and offered an upgrade. 
- decor is nice but not to my taste as I've said I found it dark and gloomy.
- nice pool and right by the beach.

We booked to have a quiet 3 nights at the end of our trip but unfortunately it was a little too quiet for us. It does look like the best hotel in the area though after looking at others. 

Must add again that the staff and food were brilliant.
title: Not sure!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for reviewing Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

Every aspect of the hotel has been designed with much thought and care which makes this a unique property. You may not find such taste in design in any establishment except at Paradise Road Tintagel Colombo. 

Paradise Road Hotels are known to its impeccable design, food & beverage and service that is offered to all guests who patronize our establishments. Our pricing is in par with other private hotels in the country. 

The rail tracks run along the coastal line in the south of Sri Lanka and most beach front properties face a similar situation although most guests find it charming and an added experience to their stay.

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
Pro's. A special ambiente with wonderful garden, nice but tired décor. WiFi and pool boy good. Have to cross train tracks to reach the beach. No beach amenities provided by hotel and currents are quite strong with turbid surf.

Con's. Horrid restaurant. Dreadful breakfast. Wildly overpriced and mediocre evening meals. (Eat anywhere else). Simply too pricey -- bad value for money.

 Train blasts through property at least hourly (including all night) and shakes the foundations. Some find the ritual of the locals squeezed on a grotty old train eyeballing the fat white folk charming (and vice versa). Escapes me.

We inspected the club Villa next door and it seems to be much better kept.
title: Fading charm and crazy prices

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review of Paradise Road The Villa Bentota!

We are so grateful that you have taken the time to share your experience and appreciate your positive feedback on your stay with us.

We are sorry that you had to undergo a discomfort due to the malfunction of the cooling unit. Unfortunately, as you know this is one of the warmest seasons of the year where the sun comes direct on top of Sri Lanka and we are currently experiencing the worst heat in our countries history. Unfortunately the room you were in the compressor was overloaded during this time and had created an air block which interrupt the cooling process. 

We pride ourselves on the style and concept of our brand and we continue to offer some of the most competitive rates for a boutique hotel in the south with an intimate setting amongst only 16 other rooms and a unique  food menu similar to our award winning restaurant in the city. We do hope you will return, perhaps during the cooler months, so we can improve your review!

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
This is a lovely place, but feel that its not worth the price you pay for it.

Architecture is lovely, and interior decorating is in the "Paradise Road" style.
Staff are absolutely friendly, cheerful, helpful and attentive. The food is great also.
The gardens are ample in size and there are two swimming pools you can enjoy (one is a 'baby' pool).

However, our group had several air conditioning issues - in short, 3 rooms that we were staying in had air conditioners that weren't working properly, which was not ideal given the awful heatwave. Luckily we were quickly given new rooms to stay in, but it was rather inconvenient moving from room to room.

Some rooms had fantastic bathrooms, others had bathrooms that needed updating. However, they were all clean.

Mixed feelings - but I feel you may be able to find a better place for the same price.
title: Mixed experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear ChinaFanNYC,

Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the architecture of Paradise Road The Villa Bentota and our breakfast. 

Our outdoor spaces for Suites without garden views unfortunately cannot be air conditioned and mosquitoes are an unavoidable circumstance of our climate. The small staircase to reach your room is part of the original architecture of the Villa Mohotti which remains untouched, and while in some cases seems inconvenient, in others adds to the charm of the original villa built by Geoffrey Bawa. 

In regards to your unsatisfactory tandoori meal we will discuss this with the chef. We don't serve fine dining and therefore aim to ensure all our portions are of generous sizes and apologise for yours being smaller than you had hoped for. 

In response to your complaint about the cancellation fee through agoda we request that you take this up with the booking agent directly. The no cancellation policy and fee takes place from their end as the booking was made through them and we cannot refund the amount to you from our offices.

We do hope you enjoyed your stay in Sri Lanka and we hope you will visit our island again soon!

Best wishes,

Saskia Fernando Hammoud
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
Because: this property is magnificent. The Geoffrey Bawa architecture is stunning, and the whole complex is gorgeous. Breakfast was wonderful.
However:
- We had a tiny "Room with No View." There was indeed a small sitting area, but it was not air conditioned and there were plenty of mosquitoes. It was up a steep and narrow staircase. 
- Dinner was mediocre. Very small portions of inauthentic tandoori chicken.
- Here's the real rub:  Service overall was friendly and professional. Due to a misunderstanding (we booked and paid for our room through our travel agent), the original booking made directly with Agoda was never properly canceled. We found this out five days prior to our arrival, and quickly canceled the Agoda reservation, resulting in a $280 cancellation fee - for ONE night! I was in the travel industry for 40 years, and I understand - rules are rules. (We did not no-show; the hotel was full that night.) When I spoke to the manager, he was a total blank: everything about his body language said NO. So be it - but his customer service skills were zero. There are many ways of saying no without the supercilious attitude he displayed. He could learn a lot from his staff.
title: This should be a 5-star review

ownerResponse/text:
Dear G B,

Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We are glad that you enjoyed the hotel, the rooms and the facilities available at Paradise Road The Villa Bentota. 

On occasions the rentable villa neighbouring the property does throw a late party, but this is quite seldom and we do regret that this disturbed you during your stay. The train however is unavoidable and while enjoyed by some of our guests when they eat their breakfast and wave to the travellers, it can be bothersome for others. 

We do hope you will visit us again and that you enjoyed your stay in Sri Lanka!

Best wishes,

Saskia
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: The hotel is very nice, beautiful rooms, swimming pool. Close to beach. Staff in general very friendly. However we found it too noisy. Mainly because of the train (until 1am and starting at 4:30am), but also due to the neighbours
title: Very nice hotel. However very noisy due to train (also at night) and neighbourgs

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: Rooms above the reception are a little dark so opt for the garden rooms
text:
Villa Bentota is everything you would ask for in a boutique property. Its beautifully done, the rooms are lovely & always smell good, there is a quaint cafe, lots of sit outs, beautiful pools...Its a feast for the eyes. The red train passing by just adds to the charm. Beach is gorgeous, and so are the wild pineapple trees before the beach. There is a small store from where you can buy a souvenir for friends back home. We enjoyed sitting in the bar area & watching the rains...
The cons: food is limited & very expensive by local standards, there is no breakfast spread - you can choose between american or sri lankan breakfast that is served at your table. For eg - at breakfast orange juice was to be paid for, but not watermelon or pineapple juice. I did not understand the logic behind that. Secondly, and most appalling, when we asked for a couple of bananas for our son, they billed it as a banana milkshake & charged a fortune for that! Even though we paid for it & gave a feedback, no one bothered to explain or justify the same. A real shame!
title: Beautiful property

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Madam,

Thank you for posting your review on your recent experience at Paradise Road The Villa Bentota! We value our guests' comments and use them constructively to allow us to continually improve our services. 

As with all reviews received, we do an internal check with all staff concerned. Daham confirmed that you had booked a Villa Room for your stay and were allocated Superior Room 7 which features a large shared balcony and one of the largest bathrooms in the category with a separate bathtub and shower. 
Shutters are present only in the bathroom, whilst Roman blinds feature on the bedroom french doors. 

We sincerely apologise for the unexpected malfunction in the air conditioning and understand that staff attended to it before you alerted them as they heard the noise and thought it was resolved within 20min. However, we understand that the air conditioner did not cool thereafter. We sincerely wish you had alerted us, but understand that with a small child, moving rooms at that time despite the heat may have been more difficult for you. 
We are pleased you enjoyed the features of the Superior Suite you were upgraded to due to the inconvenience experienced. 

We are terribly sorry for the poor massage treatment you experienced and all points mentioned are not acceptable and will be attended to to ensure they are not repeated. We do apologize for the mosquitoes and will ensure next time that more is done to repel them in advance of guests' massages. Mosquitoes are a battle throughout our tropical island.

The train track is a feature of our property and enjoyed by many. There are a few who find it a hindrance and we do understand that. We and neighbouring properties have alerted the authorities about the 'horn' of the train which can be loud, we are yet to see action taken. Again, it is a feature which is not appreciated by everyone and we are sorry that it inconvenienced you. 

September / October are the quietest months of the year at hotels on the South Coast and therefore why you would have enjoyed more privacy than perhaps wanted! December, January through till April are the best months to visit the coast and therefore are a lot busier. However, we do find many guests who enjoy the quiet of the hotel during this season and don't wish to venture to the beach which is not pleasant at this time of year.

Our property has complimentary wi-fi in all public areas. We do not offer it in all the rooms, although we do in our Colombo hotel which is frequented by business travellers. 

We hope to welcome you again to The Villa Bentota!

Yours in Service,

The Management
Paradise Road The Villa Bentota
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: Suite 4 is the best....
text:
My husband and I recently spent 2 nights at the Villa Bentota. The first night was awful. We were given a standard room. It looked like a pretty box. There were shutters instead of blinds and we felt really claustrophobic and depressed in the room. Even the bathroom was grey and dingy. To make matters worse, during the night, the power on our ac packed up with a loud noise.  It was so loud that we thought there was a train going through our room! It woke our little baby up and then we were up all night with no ac. 

The manager, Daham, was very courteous, helpful and competent. He arranged for us to be upgraded to a suite. The suite was beautiful, light and airy. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our second night at the Villa. If only, the first night was as pleasant. The manager also arranged massages. My husbands massage was great but unfortunately mine was not so good. The masseuse was unprofessional. It seemed like she couldn't really be bothered to give a massage and was just rubbing oil on me. She also placed her mobile on the bed which kept vibrating near my legs which was irritating. The room again was like a box and Mosquitos flying around everywhere. 

We found it really odd that there was a train track right behind the pool.  Even though the beach was close, it felt wrong carrying our baby over the train track to get to the beach! I also felt the train was really loud. 

The food in the restaurant was the best we had in Sri Lanka. The curries were so sumptuous. My only criticism was that it was expensive by Sri Lankan standards. 

Even though the service was lovely and the boutique hotel beautiful, it had no buzz whatsoever. There were only 2 other guests and it felt like a ghost town. Both times at breakfast, my husband and I were the only ones in the restaurant. The bar area was always empty, and no bar men serving either. Perhaps this was due to it being low season so I guess it shouldn't be a problem during the peak season. 

By the way, there is no wi-fi in the rooms. Something they should look into....
title: Tasteful interiors and lovely food but deserted hotel

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: We stayed 2 nights there.  The Villa is indeed beautiful and the food great.  Although you need to know that the railway passes through the hotel land and yes, you can hear it.  For a five star hotel, no WiFi in the room, sheets smelled funny, no computers.  No facilities either.  Basically I don't think you get your money's worth.
title: Beautiful but overrated: on the railway!

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
Great hotel, great staff, but beware of the very dangerous riptide.  I stayed here in 2011 and was swept out to sea with my 11-year old son from the beach.  We were standing in the breaking waves and before we knew what was happening, we were pulled out to sea.  The speed of the riptide was breathtaking.  We were 400 meters out to sea, and there were no rescue facilities at all.  We were drifting for a full hour before a couple of locals came to save us by paddling out with kick-boards.

There are no signs warning of the dangerous rip-tide, despite management knowing about this.   Be careful with kids.
title: Beware of the rip tide!

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: The rooms are really what they promise to be from their website. So check the site if you want to see the room before you book.
text:
The hotel itself is magnificent. It’s a designer’s dream! It has an authentic charm and you can keep making pictures everywhere because everything looks so beautiful. It is really ‘out of a magazine’ like some previous review says.
Unfortunately, we have to agree with Julie S (see her review) that once the initial high is over, you cannot help feeling disappointed about the service and the staff. 
We arrived quite late. It was already dark. Our driver (who was supposed to stay with us for 5 days) was rudely turned down, since there is no driver accommodation at the hotel. He had to go out and look for a place to sleep himself. Now, this is also a fault of his company, they had to check it before arrival, but we sure felt embarrassed by the way the reception staff treated the man.
After they showed us our room (which was indeed beautiful, just as the pictures on the website promised) we went for dinner. Bentota was our last stop on our journey and we had experienced a lot of genuine kindness from the staff at our previous hotels. At The Villa we were unpleasantly surprised by the restaurant staff’s attitude. They were almost rude. No smiles, no kindness, … They kept that attitude until the day we checked out. Then suddenly the smiles appeared (as if they were happy we left).
Next day we had the chance to see the resort in all its glory and indeed it is wonderful. But like the previous review mentioned, after a few hours the poolside looks like a mess. When people leave, no one cleans up. Used towels, glasses, clothes  … everything stays where it is and you have to search for a clean place yourself.
Since this hotel presents itself as boutique luxury (and so are the prices!)we surely expected a little more. We are happy to have stayed here, because of the beauty of the premises, but we would definitely choose another hotel the next time. I think there are a lot of alternatives that are as beautiful and with the same authentic character, but with better service!
title: Mixed feelings...

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: Suite 2 and 3 are the best. Avoid any ground floor if at all possible.
text:
We booked 2 nights in a superior suite, paid quite a lot and therefore had quite high expectations. When we were showed to our suite, we were immediately disappointed - the room was dark, scruffy and damp. It certainly didn't feel like a suite! We immediately asked to change rooms and were thankfully moved to a suite on the first floor which was lighter and drier. The hotel had supposedly undergone a refurb - it was a bad refurb. There were stains, scratches, dirt - and a general lack of attention to detail. 

On the plus side the outdoor and public areas were great - great pool, sun loungers, close to the beach and nice bar area. The staff were friendly and helpful. The beach is across the rail tracks so be prepared to see and hear a few trains go by. 

The food was nice however we ate dinner out. Top tip - go to Malli's and avoid Amal restaurant at all costs!

Overall we felt disappointed because of the bad standard of the suites and we felt like we didn't get value for money.
title: Beautiful surroundings but the suites leave a lot to be desired - disappointing

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
If u like to be spoiled with food this is the place to be, chef Nishantha was very helpful in meeting all out request, super Srilankan delicacies upon request.
The accolades end here.
Rooms, god knows Wht the owners r trying to prove as I feel they point blank cheat u. I.e. I had instects and cockroaches in plenty and I had no water for couple of hours, locks broken, shower cubicle stained, just to say a few.
My advice try Adithya or saman villas as they will let you hav a holiday rather than a pressure check.
title: Food: WOW.   Rooms: ordinary

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
We're speaking of a 5 stars boutique hotel, were we paid  $310,00, per night , so we hope to receive a really 5 stars suite, and it wasn't. We have given a mold suite at ground floor, we asked for a another one, but was the same. I do not consider a 5 star suite, were i find a concrete white painted floor, old and consumed sheets,, dirty tiles on the terrace, old windows not really weel maintened.
If we had paid up to $ 200 was fine, but at $ 310 night we expected much more, as we find in other boutique hotels in Sri Lanka.
By other side, the decoration  and the location is very nice, the outdoor shared area are really well maintened and with high maintenance, the train was a some funny not absolutely disturbing, we saw it just 3 times on our two nights stay.  
The restaurant was really really expensive, large part of the guest use to get to the neighborn' Restaurant Club Villa, same quality and half price!
title: Very nice decoration, but low maintenance in the suites

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: We had a great time and villa bentota and the only real complaint we had was the way one of the managers dealt with our room situation.  Villa bentota resort is soo peaceful and a great place to relax.  We arrived and were taken to suite 2, it's a great big room with a nice outside space, however the room was damp, the mould was all up the wall and on the ceiling and the sheets were a little damp, for 400usd per night you do not expect this.  We decided not to say anything as we were only in the room for 2 nights (I booked late and was told we would have to move to room 2 for our 3rd night) When it was time for us to check into our new room we checked with the on duty manager at the time and he explained that he would try to keep us in the same room, we said that would be ok but we did not want to pay that rate as the room was damp, he gave us a surprised look and said he would check it out and let us know later. We waited around the pool until nearly midday and left for lunch, in our return the staff seemed a little relived to see us as we needed to move rooms immediately so new guests could move into suite 2.  The manager who was dealing with it never spoke with us again, I assume he didn't think our complaint was valid and it was easier for us to move to room 2, this was a fine room but the bathroom did smell, I had seen this complaint on here before.  That room was 300usd a night, definatley overpriced.  Overall it's a lovely place with a peaceful feel and good food.  The rooms in the condition they are in are overpriced though!
title: Let down by hotel manager

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: Epic location, lovely building, beautifully decor, comfortable well decorated rooms. The food was good if a bit overpriced. My main issue with the hotel was the atmosphere, to be fair it was early season but a lot of the communal rooms while beautiful to look at were not welcoming to spend time in, they felt like a showroom/photo shoot for Paradise road furniture. I would have the bar more central to the hotel to give the beautiful rooms more purpose and focus the atmosphere. On several nights we went to the bar for pre drinks and not only was it empty of guests there was no barman. I am not sure people even knew there was a bar. The service was excellent if a little too excellent, I am sure some people want to be served on hand and foot but it makes me feel like an invalid/uncomfortable if I am already pouring a beer/wine I don't want someone to come and take it from me and continue pouring it just let me finish. I don't want to make it sound like this is a bad hotel it is not it is very good and in a stunning location it just needs that little something extra.
title: Good hotel missing that special something

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: The location, decor, buildings and rooms are fantastic - let me start on a positive note! A lovely old walauwa, beautifully renovated, and really stylishly done out. Lots of space to sit and mellow out, a gorgeous pool and gardens. But the service was a huge let down - it just didn't match up to what the place purports to be: a small, luxury hotel for the discerning traveller. Basically, 2 star service in 5 star surroundings - no class, no quality, no style. The first greeting statement when we arrived was "give us your credit cards now", and that was pretty much a continuing theme. Which leaves a bit of a nasty taste, as all that beauty is undermined by a persistent feeling that money, money, money is what is driving the place. We found that orders for food and drink were consistently wrongly taken, took ages to arrive, and also that staff (with the exception of the wonderful pool staff) had no real wish to serve pleasantly, promptly or politely. As it as one of my guest's birthday, we requested dinner at a special table outside (as advertised on the website) - and were tole "no, it's too much trouble for us to do that". Finally the front desk staff grudgingly agreed ... and when dinner-time arrived ... nothing! "Oh, we forgot, and there are alot of mosquitoes" we were told, as we eventually sat down in the restaurant to a rather average meal. the maintenance is also quite poor - the balcony doors came off their hinges, the bathroom was moldy and stank horribly of urine all around the toilet area, and the sheets also smelt pretty rank. So overall - Paradise Road, you've got the location beautifully right, but the service just doesn't match. Not even close.
title: Rather disappointing - poor service in a great location

text: On a recent family trip to Sri Lanka we stayed in a number of hotels including the Avani Kalutara. We were expecting a 4* and were unfortunately left underwhelmed. The hotel is tired, pool timber decking is in terrible condition, room air con is noisy and not particularly efficient, drains in one of the rooms  smelled, SUP rentals were really old etc. Generally the hotel is clean, the staff are polite and attentive so the 3 star review is based really on expectations of the website photos and room rate compared to the reality. If you get offered what you feel is a 3* room rate it’s a hotel worth considering - if not I would look at alternatives. Reached out to Minor Hotels for comment - no response which says it all in this day and age!

text:
I had high expectations for Avani Kalutara, but unfortunately, it was a letdown.
The food selection was extremely limited. I practically survived on just rice because nothing else was appealing. For a hotel of this standard, I expected way better variety and quality.
The reception staff was superficial and misleading(except one guy named Praneeth, who was very genuine) . When we inquired about a day-use room or late check-out, they first acted like they would “do their best” to arrange something. I never expected it to be free, yet they lied, claiming the hotel was fully booked—even though Booking.com clearly showed available rooms. A few days later, their manager suddenly offered a room but at an high price—way above the actual rate. When we showed him the Booking.com price and said we’d just book it ourselves, his attitude completely changed. To make things worse, on our last night, I had booked a room without dinner, but I mistakenly thought it was included. We had dinner, and instead of handling it professionally, the restaurant staff literally ran after us as we were leaving, demanding payment. It was confusing, and they escorted us to their manager like we were trying to steal food or avoid paying. Seriously? Just add it to the room bill or find a more respectful way to handle it. The whole situation was embarrassing and completely unnecessary.
On a positive note, the cleaning staff were extremely friendly and nice. They were always polite and ready to assist with a smile, which was a refreshing contrast to the reception staff..
title: Disappointed

text:
Очень пожалели,что выбрали этот отель.Многие как и мы просто ночевали здесь и всё,скучный никаких мероприятий или анимации нет вообще.Далеко от нормальных пляжей
Пляж :Пляжа нет он размыт и сразу глубина,спасателей я не видела,но мы это знали и ездили 30 мин в Бентота на красивый пляж.Вода темная из за реки (рядом)и песка.Отель должен предоставлять трансфер на нормальный пляж.Больные собаки с торчащими рёбрами,сразу бегущие вам под лежак,если вы захотите покайфовать на пляже размытом.А кормить мне их запретили!Вы нормальные вообще?!Или лечите и кормите собак или отвезите их в приют,клинику!Что за отношение к животным,настроение было испорчено и я просто не ходила на этот пляж даже просто погулять.Я нигде больше не встречала на пляжах таких больных и голодных животных.Бассецн маленький мутный ,я не рискнула купаться

Номер
Слегка ушатанный,ржавый грязный холодильник,который потёк один раз у нас,грязный вентилятор над кроватью весь в пыли,грязный старый фен..фу

Клининг :два раза в день,очень вежливо подметут и заправят кровати и меняют полотенца,здесь без претензий-молодцы.Но почему не моют холодильник ..
Дверь (фото прилагаю)между номерами.Старая деревянная.Так вот я слышала все что происходит в соседнем номере)))Такое ощущение что просто шторка висела,а соседи у нас были громкие иностранцы.
Питание:норм ,но на ужин вам предложат только воду из графина,а она из под крана,прям хлоркой воняла.Вы серьёзно?Остальные напитки и вода платные!А я брала завтрак и ужин!Все жаловались на это,это прям дно ребята.Мы носили свою воду из номера в бутылке!Позор
Не посоветую

text:
Not a 5 star, maybe 4 star!

Had disappointing stay.

Beautiful place but not as beautiful and big as the pictures, clean rooms, very kind housekeepers but the staff were not so friendly and tried not help, specially females! we were 2 ladies and asked for ladies pad but they gave us just 1 pad after 2 days and said they don't have any ladies pad in the hotel! how is that possible? even in every public washrooms there is ladies pad too but in a 5 star hotel.. very disappointing. the location is not closed to any pharmacy or supermarket so we couldn't buy it by ourselves and they didn't help us!

As a 5 star beach resort no seafood on the menu and also no international food. just local food full of spice and we actually didn't eat any food for 4 days!

to everything we ordered, added 30% tax and service charge. what does it mean "service charge" for a 5 star hotel to bring our order just to our table not even to our room?????!!!!!!

also not possible to use the beach because it was very dangerous and there was just 1 man looked at us and didn't seem to rescue us if anything happened! and just 4 unclean plastic sunbeds on the beach, so many dogs slept under them!

many many crows were all over the hotel and stole our foods and very scary but everyone just watched and didn't do anything! when we told the manager he just said we can't do anything, watch out your things!!!!

no entertainment, no music just some entertainment plans that costs a lot plus 30%!!

overall its not worth it to book this hotel. we heard there are many better hotels in the area.
title: not a 5 star, very disappointing

text:
Our recent stay at this hotel left us with mixed feelings, as there were both positive and negative aspects to our experience. While some aspects of our stay were enjoyable, several issues arose that we believe future guests should be aware of.

One of the most frustrating issues we encountered was the malfunctioning TV remote. We had to complain twice before it was addressed, which was a minor inconvenience but still an annoyance that could have been avoided.

The most significant problem, however, was the absence of a lift in the hotel. This was a major oversight on the hotel's part, as they failed to inform us of this prior to our booking. Imagine if we had an elderly family member with us who was physically unable to climb stairs; it would have been a major problem. This information should have been communicated clearly during the booking process so that guests can make informed decisions.

Furthermore, we were disappointed that the hotel only mentioned the possibility of a room upgrade once we had already checked in. This offer was not mentioned during our initial phone reservation, which left us feeling as though we were not given all the available options when booking.

On a positive note, the room service was commendable. The staff responsible for room service were prompt, efficient, and courteous. They helped to alleviate some of the frustration caused by the aforementioned issues.

We must also commend the hotel staff for their friendly and welcoming demeanor. Despite the shortcomings of our stay, the staff's attitude was a bright spot in our overall experience.
title: A Mixed Bag

text:
My previous experience staying at Avani Seminyak Resort was a memorable one, hence I chose Avani Kalutara for my trip to Sri Lanka. 

I was rather disappointed though - the Rooms were spacious, but the AC was not very cold. Facilities are good - great pool, by the beach (though the water is very choppy at this time of the year), and Avani guests can also use the facilities offered by Anantara. 

Front office is generally Ok, except for the room key that didnt work (arrived at the hotel at 1.45AM) & mishaps with the packed breakfasts (despite multiple reminder of the requests, they had somehow forgot and the FO on duty was clueless (despite having taken the request the day before). Both incidents involved the same FO staff. Anyway, the incident was reported to the FO Manager & i hope he will follow up accordingly (i.e. more training/ coaching & there should be standard operating procedures on packed breakfasts - afterwall, very early morning tour is common in Sri Lanka).   Honestly, showing guests they matter doesn’t require a big budget, just some good old-fashioned hospitality. Simple efforts to make guests feel welcome. h

Shout out to Manoj (from the Restaurant) and Nishant (from the Pool) for going the extra mile - its the little things that count, they get to know the guests and pay attention to guests preferences e.g., on day 3, Manoj remember my breakfast preferences (despite having eaten on site on day 1).  and Nishant is always greeting guests (& find out on the planned activities for the day & if it involves the pool area, he will set up the pool deck chairs. 

The restaurant a la carte menu was ok, good range of selection & includes local Sri Lankan food. 
 
Thank you
title: Room for improvements (esp for a 4.5 star resort)

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Rooms are very modern very clean. Staff members are very helpful. Best location in Sri lanka. Very good sea view from the room. wifi is very fast working. Swimming Pool is very huge & very clean. All are satisfied but meals are not satisfied. They have only set menus, They don't have different types of foods their set menus. Main thing is we have waiting more time for our foods.
Thank you.
title: Location & Rooms are very Good, But Meals are not good.

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text: we made the reservation 2 month prior and for 5 rooms , we are one family with kids , we were offered 5 scattered rooms , manager tried to talk us through to stay in differant locations since he was lazy to check the system , ultimately we decided not to stay and was offered rooms in a better way , poor management by the manager
title: bad room allocation

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Best views
text:
Stayed for two nights, Location is exceptional and easy to access, food are tasty, and rooms are small but cozy and excellent room service. 

Unfortunately, service of the front desk and restaurant were worst, no plan at restaurant, some are waiting hours to take a table, restaurant open 7am for breakfast, but even at 8am still arranging. Same for lunch and dinner.

My stay was FB basis (from 17th to 19th December, room no 315), but they have added extra dinner charge to my final bill, I have to explain reasons while having the lunch before departure.

Finally, they apologies and said, it is someone else bill and accidently added to me. Very disappointed, unpleasant experience.
title: Two nights with Avani

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Cuidado con Google maps si vas con coche propio. Te mete en calles de las que no podrás salir…
text:
Se trata de una antiguo palacio reconvertido. Accesos difíciles, cuidado con Google Maps porque te lleva “Al huerto”. 
Habitaciones inmensas con muebles de época. Agua caliente, AC, caja fuerte, minibar (vacío) funcionan OK. Wifi solo desde recepción. Olor intenso a especias en la habitación que puede llegar a molestar.
Piscina rodeada de la jungla (monos, lagartos, pavos reales…alrededor tuyo) con escasas hamacas y toallas viejas y sucias.
Personal frío en la llegada, pero colabora durante la estancia.
Desayuno sin buffet. A escoger Western o SriLankan breakfast. Lentísimos!
He de decir que de 5 estrellas solo tiene el hecho de estar en un antiguo palacio. Ni el personal, ni el estado de las instalaciones, ni el desayuno están a la altura. Hemos estado en hoteles de estrellas mucho mejores en Sri Lanka.
title: No esperes un cinco estrellas. No lo es!

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We were there for 1 night in the Admiral Suite ( which is their largest) and we loved our accommodation. All of which we enjoyed a lot. Our room had been maintained to resemble the era it was built in. It was quite spacious. The windows looked down onto the courtyard. We shared a large verandah-like balcony with the Captain Suite (our only neighbour). 

While it is true that the roof of the bathroom and the outer areas could do with some maintenance, we loved the food. The portion sizes were perfect. Even though I'm a vegetarian,  they were nice enough to adjust to my needs. Out of all the hotels we have been to, they had the most variety for breakfast. In spite of the fact it was a set menu. Jeevan made our stay most hospitable. There were several others who inquired after our stay however, we do not know their names. The only setback was, it looked deserted when we entered and for a few minutes I wondered whether we made a good choice of our stay. I was proved wrong in the evening. It was a nice stay but its better if staff awaits to welcome us when we arrive :)
title: A quiet spot

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Beachbum364, 

Thank you for your feedback on your stay at The Tamarind Hill, Galle.

Asia Leisure Team
placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Me and my husband checked in in the 11th Dec. We arrived around 1.pm on a Saturday and waited awkwardly a lobby. We were met by a person who gave us our room and a quick refreshment. While the overall service was quick and efficient, there was none of the warmth that I have been looking for (which was mentioned by many of its previous customers!) There wasn't a hint of a smile or warmth here. However a kindly gentleman who took our bags more than made up for it. (Pardon me but forget their names). 

However a special note must be made for their housekeeping manager Jeewan who went out of his way to make us feel welcome. (Maybe he can greet guests at the front office?) 

Come lunch the food was tasty but the portion size was ridiculous. My husband who is a hearty eater had to go looking for snacks in the Galle town around 4 as the meal barely met the need. 
Our dinner was also delicious and the portion was also not too bad. Only issue was that in a seafood grill dish the prawn was mushy and clearly spoiled. Being 4 months pregnant this could have ended quite badly for me if not for my crazy sensitive senses! We made a note on this and the chef himself was gracious enough to apologise and try to take care of us. This doesn't however excuse the fact that a child could have unknowingly eaten this and gotten very sick. 

Now to the good part. The property it self was breathtaking and has an old colonial charm to it. It was definitely quiet & peaceful so a big plus for this. Our room was quite specious and comfortable. We also had a small patio to ourselves. Pool maintenance definitely hasn't happened recently as the water had a slightly green tinge to it. So a word of caution before you take a dip.

Overall not too bad. But can definitely do better in terms of professionalism and a bit of kindness here and there. After all that's what sri lankan hospitality is all about yes?
title: Not bad. But has definitely lost some of its charm.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear nadia_izzy,

Greetings from Asia Leisure!

Thank you for choosing Asia Leisure hotels and we really appreciate your wonderful remarks about our hotel.

It is exciting to hear your comments about the hospitality, food and facilities at Tamarind Hill, Galle. It was our pleasure in accommodating you at our hotel and hope we succeeded in serving you. We have noted all the negative comments for better improvements. 

Your reviews and comments have been shared with our team who continually strive to create seamless and positive experiences for our guests.

We look forward to welcoming you back. Hope you visit us soon!
placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I loved my stay here back in January 2020 so I decided to return once again this month. (March 2021). Let me start with the pros
- We arrived at 1 pm and the team was kind enough to offer a late check out the next day, free of charge. 
- You cannot fault the Sri Lankan breakfast. The hoppers, roti, string hoppers - they were all excellent. 
- The pool is large and it’s the perfect setting that gives you privacy and if you’re lucky you can catch a peacock wandering around along with some monkeys. 
- they did not inform us that there would be no alcohol as their license was not renewed but they made an effort to find a tuk guy who purchased a few beers for us. 
Cons 
- The place looked run down in comparison to last year which was very sad to see. The bar area - which was shut was not at all clean with stains on their lovely white seating. It leads down to the pool so even with the bar shut it’s a nice area to enjoy a cup of tea or a game of cards. 
- It was near impossible to get someone from the team to assist. They were almost invisible during our stay. We had to walk into their office to ask someone to come and take an order. This slowly turned out to be quite irritating since none of the staff were in sight. 
- Last year their menu was great. Unfortunately this time, they barely had any of their items. None of their pizzas were available, no burgers etc. We were on full board (and the set menu was not too great) but we had no problem paying and ordering via the ala carte menu. We decided to skip dinner and head to the fort. 
- The desserts were actually rather bad and the bread buns were stale. 
All in all, I understand due to the pandemic they might be cost cutting / staff not turning up to work etc but it was quite sad to notice such a drastic change within that year. Hope it picks up!
title: Beautiful property - A few hiccups

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Torn over my review of Tamarind Hill Galle. This Colonial style boutique hotel (only 13 rooms) is a throwback to yesteryear. Rooms are huge with high ceilings. Beds are comfortable.  The bathrooms feature open air showers. Most rooms are ground floor, accessible from a beautifully manicured common courtyard. There is AC, but it is not effective unless the fan is on high due to the cathedral ceilings.  The property IS picture perfect and it is close to the massive and well preserved (former) Dutch fort that dominates Galle Old Town.  Looks, sadly, are where the impressive nature of this hotel stops.  Service is atrocious: plan on extra time at breakfast just for the staff to figure out your order. The food is mediocre at best.  Checkout is a disaster. If you need questions answered, forget about finding reliable assistance. If you are looking for long term comfort and convenience, this should not be your stay. Want to try a night awash in Colonial elegance?  Try it...at your own risk.
title: Colonial Elegance Spoiled by Atrocious Service

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The location is quiet and the rooms are great. Staff were courteous, although we sometimes wondered who was the boss, there did not seem to be a manager around that we could converse with.
Food was mediocre, so we only ate breakfast, which was included. And a lunch when we arrived, which was very bland and tasteless. So much better food in Galle.
Another point for which the hotels loses a star is that on arrival, we were having lunch and somebody decided to burn trash just outside of the hotel, filling the hotel with horrible smoke in the middle of the day… This pile of trash burned until the next day making the air unpleasant for such a supposedly relaxing place. The staff did nothing to contain the smoke. I understand burning trash is common in Sri Lanka, but when you are paying $300+ a night, the staff should make sure your stay is pleasant.
I probably won’t stay here again as the accommodation situation in Galle is improving rapidly.
title: Beautiful place, marred by inexperienced management.

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This converted colonial home makes for a beautiful boutique hotel. The rooms were most special feature. They are generous in proportion and well appointed. The pool is also perfect. However, given the price you pay there is certainly room for improvement. It is outside the Galle Fort, the main tourist area, so it is not in a prime location. The breakfasts are wonderful but costly. The dinners, particularly the Western food, was not up to the standard we had at other hotels. The service was good but not great. The spa was absolutely terrible. I was not expecting the worst massage I have ever had from a masseuse who is clearly an untrained masseuse. I was terribly disappointed in their lack of driver accommodation. Most hotels of this price will include driver accomodation but we were required to pay an additional fee for him to stay offsite and there were restrictions on the times when he could have his meals. I appreciate what this hotel is trying to achieve, but it is certainly overpriced for what it offers.
title: An overpriced beauty

ownerResponse/text:

Regards,
Tamarind Hill Team
placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't eat here - go out for lunch and dinner
text:
Tamarind Hill has so much potential but fails in so many small ways that you end up being slightly disappointed. Firstly, these comments are made in light of the fact that this is not a cheap place to stay in February with prices around US$300 per night by the time service charges and taxes are taken into account. To put this in context there are some fantastic hotels in Sydney, London, Paris New York etc etc where for this amount of money you can stay in a fabulous hotel.

The positives are the buildings, the pool area, the rooms and the generally relaxing nature of the place. With abundant wildlife in the immediate surrounds you can enjoy breakfast with wild peacocks, monkeys, squirrels and all sorts of bird life. There are numerous staff and they do their best to help. 

Herein lies the issue – no amount of staff make up for a lack of training and none of the staff appear to have any idea about the food and drinks they are serving to their customers nor the expectations the guests might expect - this is where Tamarind Hill misses the point. Some examples to explain
•	At our first breakfast we were presented with the breakfast menu. My wife went to order the Sri Lankan breakfast only to be told that she couldn’t have this because she hadn’t ordered it the night before. We told the waiter that no one had explained this when we checked in the day before but there was nothing to be done and no Sri Lankan breakfast was available and he said very sorry but not his fault……….. There was no note in the room or the guest info book to advise you of this either.
•	The western breakfast offers a pastry basket – management needs to look up in a dictionary the definition of “a pastry basket” as clearly they have no idea. A few slices of untoasted white sliced bread with some strange bits of puff pastry 
•	On our first night we ordered a gin and tonic at the bar. The local tonic was woeful – more like mouthwash than tonic – I asked if they had other tonics like schweppes tonic and the bar man said no. We were therefore somewhat surprised to find that in our mini bar there were 2 cans of schweppes tonic so the next day I questioned the bar man on this and his response was that there were 2 different companies involved and he could not sell Schweppes tonic regardless of the fact that the tonic he did serve ruined the drink it was designed to go with. Management have got a serious problem with this sort of thinking…
•	The amenities in the rooms were great and shower gel and shampoo came in quaint triangular shaped porcelain bottles. However if you don’t replace / refill the bottles then they run out. Surely this is a basic task for the room service crew every day – but not at Tamarind Hill
•	The towels in the rooms were once white. They are now an off white / grey colour. Ours always appeared to look like they needed to be washed again. I get that keeping towels white may be difficult but wouldn’t it make sense to use a different colour and create the appearance at least of the rooms having nice clean fresh towels – it’s the little things that leave a lasting impression – Again one day they cleaned the room and only replaced one bath towel. It’s just not that hard to replace two bath towels and two hand towels every day and make sure this happens – but it is apparently at Tamarind Hill 
•	Likewise the table cloths which had seen too many red wine spills and needed to be replaced
Tamarind Hill seems unsure of its target market. The lunch / dinner / room service menu is really disappointing and as a result other than for breakfast, the only time we ate there was on our last night before heading to the airport. We found it strange that there were more Thai items on the menu than Sri Lankan food. The menu had pasta, pizza, burgers that I just don’t understand why you would serve up such fare when the local food is so abundantly available and more pleasant. By all means have a few western sidelines but at least have a core local menu. The chicken burger came with a processed pattie – why oh why would you do that when chicken is abundantly and cheaply available? If you wanted a red wine, I’m not sure of how all of the wines were cellared however it always concerns me in hot countries to see bottles of red wine standing around in displays on shelves – just how off will these be by the time they get to the glass?
Tamarind Hill should send someone over to the Sun House in Galle to have a look at what they could achieve and how they could present a menu. The food there was magnificent as was the service and they wisely offered two options when it came to tonic – the local version or with schweppes at a premium price. The bar man told me that he didn’t sell much local toinc. No surprises there. 

Tamarind Hill is a fabulous place ruined by the lack of investment by management in staff training and in presenting fare that is worthy of the price tag of the hotel. Given the abundance of alternatives available you would do well to check out other places than be underwhelmed by the overall offering available here. If you stay here go out for your meals and bring your own tonic. The Sun House in Galle has a similar ambiance, facilities, is around the same price but knows what it is doing.
We get that none of the staff have likely ever drunk a gin and tonic, drink red wine, eaten much western food and therefore they have little or no idea about what they are serving. Having said that there was never anyone from management or who appeared to be from management to oversee the staff, to coach, mentor and train the staff. What the place needs is a good hotel/restaurant consultant to do a Tamarind Hill make over and turn it into what it could so easily be, which is a fabulous place to stay with a great menu and drinks list.
title: A jem in Galle - Slightly flawed though

The rooms are okay, but could just be so much more, the tiles they have used in the bathroom reminds you of the white ones used in a butchery and the cleaning is so so. placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our most expensive hotel out of 4 on a recent trip to sri lanka so had high expectations.
On arrival there appeared to be a wedding going on but it turned out it was a photo shoot. The whole experience of check in and then lunch was spoilt by a crew of photographers/models. It is such a small hotel you couldnt miss them and first impressions count.

Hotel itself is very pretty with large rooms that could do with a little bit of a tidy up. It was clean but silly things like curtain hold back was hanging off, weeds in little outdoor area. 
Food was ok . Another thing that needs to be addressed which was mentioned by other guests is the lack of service at the outside bar area. You could wait 30 minutes just to be served , in the end we found it best to go and find them. Two nights we were there we had very loud music coming from what i assume is the neighbouring area which i know is out of the hotels control but be aware you are right next to a local village.
Pool area is small but very nice with wildlife all around. Peacocks, monkeys and rabbits were frequent visitors.
Short tuk tuk drive into galle which is well worth a few trips day and night. Lots of places to eat and shop. 
River trip from the back of the hotel was very good. Guide was very knowledgeable.
title: Ok

title: Relaxing

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed two nights at the beautiful Tamarind Hill hotel. 

Good: Nice greeting with towel and spice tea. The best informative check-in we had at any hotel. You'll find cute bunny rabbits all over the place. The hotel is beautiful and small - only 12 rooms so quite intimate. The pool was pretty, long and narrow. 

The room was huge and very nicely furnished. There were mandarin oranges on the table and later they brought us delicious coconut macaroons. There was AC, ceiling fan, TV, kettle, water, coffee & tea station. Room 3 had a gorgeous comfortable king bed and a small single bed to one side. The bathroom was very big and comfortable. There are decorative vents over each of the two windows that could not be closed off which lets in 'the weather'. There was a ceiling fan, nice toiletries, hair dryer, towel rack. It's one of the better 'outdoor' bathrooms we've had as there at least was a ceiling fan to move the heavy, humid air. 

There was a small onsite spa where I had a very good pedicure the afternoon we arrived. 

We found the al la carte dinner menu a bit pricey but the food and service were good. The included breakfast was served al la carte and was very nice with very good service. 

Two front desk people came by to inquire during our stay so we had opportunity to complain about the noise and AC (see below).               

Poor: We were woken up at 2am by men talking loudly - thought it was coming through the bathroom window from behind the property but was actually coming from the hotel courtyard. When I opened the door there were a dozen casually dressed young men sitting in the open bar area right in-front of room 4 next door. When I asked if they were guests here (as at dinner time there were only 3 foreign couples including us) one of the men came over - and I saw it was one of the dinner waiters - and said they were having a birthday party for someone that checked in late!  With his reassurance that they would be quiet, the noise continued with talking and dishes and cutlery clanging about until 3am. That's not a 5 * experience in my book. There are at least three other areas where they could have sat and not disturbed us in the middle of the night - why sit in-front of occupied rooms? 

Other not so nice things: Some of the bed linens and towels were worn or frayed with holes. Directly behind room 3's private courtyard was a huge cell phone tower which ruined the pretty atmosphere. The room was very dark as the only natural light is from the french doors that open to the small private high-walled courtyard in the back. The room lighting was very low while ironically there is an opaque window design above the front door that let in early morning light just when you didn't need or want it. We found the area around the pool quite messy even with dog poo on a tile between the pool and the shower. The in-room wifi was weak. The AC unit didn't work very well - it blew air but didn't cool very good. On the second day (by our request) someone came in and fixed the AC unit and afterwards it functioned well. At checkout when paying by credit card  an additional 5.3% is collected by the 'merchant's service provider' which is ridiculous - if charged at all is usually 2.2%.
title: Good but not great

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel, although extremely beautiful and rich in history, did not meet our expectations. 

We stayed here on our last night in Sri Lanka, so had become quite accustomed to superior service. The staff were not friendly, they were by no means rude, but simply don't greet you with a smile or offer any help. You have to ask.  

We felt the hotel had such potential, it really needs some love. 
The pool furniture (cushions and towels) are old and need replacing. The pool is exqisuite though, leading into the jungle where you can swim and watch monkeys in the trees. 

The 12 rooms are lovely, with a large bathroom and doors leading into your own private garden. The courtyard is beautiful but again, felt almost eerie, and abandoned. There was a large pot plant in the centre filled with empty wine bottles, used as a dustbin. 

All in all, if the hotel management focus on getting the atmosphere right and give this little gem some love, it would have been a different experience. It's in a great location, a short 2 minute tuk tuk to the fort.
title: Expectations not met!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest

Thank you very much for your review and we are very sorry that you did not enjoy your stay. 

We are looking into the issue of pests in the hotel and we have already rectified the issue by getting our pest control company to visit the hotel more often. 

Thank you for this feedback.
placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Do not stay in Room 1, it is next to the kitchen so it is noisy at times.  Lots of flies in the room and ants on the floor :(
text:
We stayed at the Tamarind Hill Hotel for three nights while in Galle based on previous trip advisor reviews and overall I would say this hotel was in a three star category.  The property itself was very gorgeous, quaint, lovely and had a lot of potential to be great but lacked tremendously in character and service.  Our children loved the pool, fish pond and the rabbits on the property so that kept them entertained during our stay.  The food at the restaurant was very good, especially the traditional Sri Lankan food.  

The main thing that was bothersome and irritating were the number of flies on the property, restaurant and in our room.  It took away from any charm or comfort that we had hoped for.....  In my opinion, the property was lacking good management.  During our entire stay, it appeared as though staff were around but were doing their own thing and we were left to do our own thing so it felt as if we were neglected.  The whole property and experience felt too quiet, lonely and deserted.  If you are looking for a hideaway retreat and not to be bothered by anyone type of experience, then this is the place for you.  If you are looking for a little pampering, liveliness and character, I would consider other options.  If management would be interested, I would gladly give my feedback on how this property could be on par with 4 and 5 star hotels.  This place has so much potential!!!!!!
title: Great potential but disappointing......

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Warmest greetings from all of us at Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

We thank you for your feedback and thank you for taking the time to discuss this matter over the phone with me the other day. Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused during your recent stay.  

As discussed on the phone with you, I have instructed my Reservations team to inform the Chef to have String hoppers made for you specially every time you stay with us. We take that extra step to customize and personalize guests’ requests every time but, on this occasion, we have failed, and I have advised the team to ensure this is available every time you stay with us. I have also mentioned to the roof top Ward7 retro-bar team, if food is ordered from the ground floor 57 restaurant to the roof top ward 7 retro-bar, to indicate how long it will take to the guest due to logistical reasons. I have also discussed with the F&B Manager looking at the design of serving dishes when food is ordered from the ground floor restaurant to the roof top retro-bar. 

Due to our sustainable practices, we do only serve Sri Lankan fruits, and I have also shared your concern and ensured that we have a minimum of 5 varieties of fruits available at the breakfast buffet. 

As we spoke, I hope this one-time incident will not keep you away, we look forward to welcoming you back to Jetwing Colombo Seven again.

placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Since 5 years it was my favorite Hotel in Colombo. I stayed there lot of time and was every time impressed about the owner's strategy and the personal service to make guests satisfied.
But the development of kitchen and food as well as the mastermind behind destroyed the overall good experience there.
You wait more than an hour for your dinner on the roof top. The design of the food makes it impossible to eat it comfortable. ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Warmest greetings from all of us at Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

We thank you for your feedback and thank you for selecting Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

Thank you for your wonderful comments about the location, quality of food and the professionalism of staff. 

We also thank you for your wonderful comments about Ishini and the team. I will be sure to let them know. 

As per the tele-conversation we had a while ago and as explained, unfortunately we don't let any food out of the hotel after events due to food safety measures and procedures. Our hotel is approved by the ISO 22000 food safety management standards and as per ISO 22000, we have strict guidelines to follow to ensure the food we served is to its highest standards. Further as we are HACCP (Hazard analysis and critical control point) certified there are certain strict guidelines, to be followed with regard to food safety procedures. I would also like to thank you for understanding the above factors during our call.  

Once again we look forward to welcoming you back again to Jetwing Colombo Seven.

Ayubowan (May you live long)!

placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Good food and good staff
text:
We recently held our company's Annual General Meeting at this venue and were thoroughly impressed with the location, quality of the food, and the professionalism of the staff. From the outset, the banquet office managed our reservation seamlessly. A special thanks to Ishini Maharage for personally attending to all our requirements, ensuring everything ran smoothly. We also extend our gratitude to the team present on the day of the event for their prompt and courteous service.

However, we were disappointed with the hotel’s response when we requested take-away packs for the unconsumed food. We were informed that this was against hotel policy, which we found surprising, especially given Jetwing Group’s commitment to sustainability. Jetwing has established itself as an industry leader in community service, sustainability, waste reduction, and ethical practices, with Mr. Hiran Cooray setting a notable example in these areas. In this context, the stance taken by the hotel, particularly by Mr. Suni, who appeared indifferent to our suggestion, was unexpected and somewhat disappointing.
title: Good hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Warmest greetings from all of us at Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

We thank you for writing a review and giving us much feedback. 

Thank you for selecting Jetwing Colombo Seven for your stay and for your celebrations. 

We thank you for your loyalty and support during the last years.

General Manager
placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you expect tranquility at JWC7 this is not the best time.
text:
Jet Wing Colombo Seven boasts of an expanding numbers of utterly loyal, longstanding clients not only from Sri Lanka but from many countries across the globe. I am confident, there are many overseas guests visiting Sri Lanka in seasons and off seasons exclusively to stay at Jet Wing Colombo Seven. There should be numerous local clients who use every negative and positive experience in demanding daily lives to rush to JWC7 purchasing its services from Cafe 57, checking in regularly over the past many years, purchasing customized cakes for various occasions, giving gifts of honey-moon packages and what not.
 JWC7 roof top is very popular among local and foreign guests due to the amazing panoramic view. Whenever, I got to deliver a zoom lecture, I came to JWC7 because of the tranquility it offered.
I have been with JWC7 since 2021 when the country was grappling with the  Covid-19 pandemic and lock-downs. I fondly remember the date of 23rd June 2021, at the roof top of JWC7 seated near the pool on my own at midnight (none at all in the vicinity) after celebrating the unexpected failure of my trainee with a bottle of wine. I stayed at JWC7 continuously since then to guide my trainee for success, now she is receiving overseas training in Canada. My trainee became a winner amidst all odds.
Mr Ajantha Perera was very helpful and provided a valuable, customized service for me at that time. I guess he is overburdened with providing such services and now he is fed up
On the 10th of December 2023 a heavenly event was held at Barnes, JWC7 to felicitate my long-term buddy Dr Poojitha Wickramaratne, Consultant in Restorative Dentistry. I have had a bottle of sparkling wine from the hotel and danced for 3-hours at a stretch as I did consider JWC7 as 'My better home'. I stayed in 1106 but got to leave at 8 am to attend to my responsibilities and duties.
My recent encounter with JWC7 was hosting a lunch at Cafe 57 for a senior Nursing Officer, few Health Assistants and two children of one of them. This was the 4th Visit to JWC7 by my Health Assistant Mrs. Manjula Senani. She was delighted to accompany her 2 young sons for the lunch. I settled the invoice in full 5-days before the event and I am sure, JWC7 has more faithful clients than me. Cafe 57 was full of highly satisfied overseas guests and some of them of were Sri Lankan origin.
title: Walking Down the Memory Lane with JWC7

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Warmest greetings from all of us at Jetwing Colombo Seven. We thank you for taking the time to write an review.

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused at your early arrival. The hotel operates on international standards of check in and check out times. Hence the check in time is 1400hrs. 

On that day the hotel was running full occupancy the previous night. Due to this factor rooms were not available at your time of arrival. We always encourage our guests to book from the previous night if you have an early arrival flight. This way  you will have the room as soon as you arrive to the hotel.
 
Due to the increase in occupancy in Colombo and hotels running nearly full all the time it is always advisable to book from the previous night specially if you are having a long flight and arriving early. Also since most guests departing flights are in the evening or late evening our guests check out at the intranational standard check out time which is 1200 noon. 

Once again our sincere apologies for the inconvenience and looking forward to welcoming you to Jetwing Colombo Seven again.

Ayubowan (May you live long)!
