Dear Guest,

Warmest greetings from all of us at Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

We thank you for your feedback and thank you for selecting Jetwing Colombo Seven for your stay. 

We are delighted to learn that the cleaner was efficient and super friendly. We are also happy to note that you enjoyed the roof top bar and its food. 

With regard to WIFI, we do provide a complimentary unlimited service. in certain times specially at night, it can get slow due to guests watching Netflix, as this is a service provided in the rooms complimentary if you have a Netflix account. 

However we also have faster WIFI through an individual router, which can be obtain at the reception at a cost. We suggest this to business travelers if you require very fast WIFI in the night time. 

With regard to the pool we have followed all safety standard measures. There is a step below which is not visible, as a precaution which is a safety standard for such pools. We have a procedure that children must always be accompanies by an adult. Further we have pool attendants at all times to ensure safety of all guests. 

 I have immediately spoken with the housekeeping team, to ensure that all glasses in elevator landing areas to be cleaned. 

Thank you again for your feedback and only by such feedback that we can focus on areas for improvement.  

Looking forward to welcoming you back again to Jetwing Colombo Seven again.

Ayubowan (May you live long)!

General Manager
placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Basement parking available 
Use uber for getting around its superb and cheap.
text:
Stayed here on a recent visit and wasn’t overly impressed. 
We arrived very late and were checked in efficiently but was asked by other guests if the WiFi was working, this was an indicator as to how poor the internet service was .! 
Apparently, due to connections, we had been given a free upgrade for our room, I wouldn’t like to see a lesser room if that’s the case. No balcony and no opening window. The Aircon is constantly on even when card for power is removed. 
Don’t get me wrong the room was fine, but rather bland in decoration. Bathroom was good size and well equipped. The cleaner was super efficient and very friendly. 
I just think the whole place could do with a deep clean and a re paint in places. The windows hadn’t seen a cleaner for quite some time. Grime had gathered in the corners on the communal landing carpet.
I complained on a few occasions about the WiFi service, it is very poor and I tried to explain that business users would be very annoyed at the speeds.. throughout our stay the best we got was 6mbps which in todays standards is appalling. 

Now to the pool… whilst on initial visit it looks impressive with a super view of the city, I was alarmed at the lack of health and safety around the pool. Basically, it’s an infinite pool without any security barrier to prevent certain death should you fall. I definitely wouldn’t allow children to play towards the front edge. 
The limited glass balustrade fitted is woefully inadequate and on the floor below one panel was shattered. The lounging are around the pool is nice but a little cluttered. 
The rooftop bar is very nice offers a great view over the city. Food was very good. 
Breakfast was ok but could be hotter in temp, typically, everything was only aired. Staff were lovely. 
The lifts can be frustrating at busy times.

In all our stay was ok, plenty of room for improvement in areas mentioned.
title: Room for improvement but ok

Thank you for your personal and detailed review of your stay experience with us..

At the onset, I regret that your experience has not been up to your liking. We are committed in delivering an unparalleled hospitality experience with the primary objective of our organization which is to provide you uncomplicated services. However, sometimes in spite of best of our intentions, things go wrong. 

We are happy to know that your overall experience with our rooms, food, service associates was satisfactory.  With regard to the sunbeds, we have made a note of your feedback and apologize that we did not meet your expectations this time. However we will strive to do better on your next stay.

placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Beware of the 75 dollars early check-in charge
text:
Disclaimer: This is a subjective review and did only reflect our experience.

We initiated out holiday in Sri Lanka, with a two day stay on the Jetwing. Lets start with the good things:
Hotel is more or less as advertised, rooftop infinity pool is nice, food is quite okay despite a bit of a shaky wine menu, rooms are clean and modern looking, and staff was generally helpful.

We saw quite a few drawbacks about the hotel we would like to highlight though to future customers: 
Our impression was that it was all about money. We paid 75 dollars (110% of our room rate) for early check-in at 5AM, instead of the usual 2PM. The hotel argued it was because of a fully booked hotel, with only the handicap room available, but to me it doesn't seem like it would make a difference. This unnaturally high early checkin fee, took us by surprise. Then trying to get local resturant tips from non other than the general manager was useless and annoying. No matter how much we tried to insinuate, we wanted to go out, her only obsession was go to the hotel resturant, matching the first impression of trying to get us to use as much money as possible at the hotel.

Rooftop and resturant is nice, but also a few drawbacks here. For a pretty big hotel the total of 4 sunbeds (even though very cormfortable) is too little, and made this, otherwise nice pool deck, a pain to wait for to get sun. Also in the evening the resturant extends out to the pool deck, meaning if the resturant has a good night, you can forget about a relaxing night by the pool with the skyline in sight. Also only the nice directions are shown, and not the huge building next to the pool, making constant noise during the day (Feb 2020) 

So when should you choose this hotel? If it is the cheapest option of hotels with a decent standard (It does have a good standard, especially in the room), however if you want to relax by the pool more than once, you may not like it, and if you wan't to be close to the coast and tourist areas, I would recommend a hotel in that area instead. It was fine for us on this two day, not much pool action sightseeing days, but we were not impressed.
title: Hotel is nice enough, but with quite a few drawbacks

text:
We as a family of 6 visited Srilanka on a 8 day trip where we were throughly impressed with the country and the hospitality 

This property was our last day of the tour and finishing touch hasn't been great

Rooms and views were lovely,  rooms and bathroom were spotless. Toiletries were aromatic and I personally loved it.

Issue was with Dinner - we were on half board basis and were offered options to choose from set menu. The staff was not at all equipped to understand the order and deliver it right. There were only 1 soup, 1 main course and 1 dessert offered for dinner - too less for a 5 star. The order took forever to arrive with even some items being missed making us wait in the middle of the dinner. 

Desserts that was only icecream took another era to arrive and it was delivered to our room only when senior management intervened after my complained. The icecreams were melted - check the pic. I am sure it doesn't melt in 2 min lift to 10th floor.

I had ordered cake for my hubby's birthday and when I checked in I told them to deliver it in dinner time.  Before I went for dinner I made a reminder and cake was still not there. Post dinner we again sent reminder and were told it's on the way! 30 mins later I raised a complaint to the management and they got it delivered to our room after our entire mood was spoilt!
I wanted to have a black coffee after waking up next day but there were no sachets the staff arrived but did not have only coffee sachets..it was with cream. Staff could provide no help then 

Breakfast was alright with taste the next day.
title: Totally disappointed

text:
The rooms are modern and nicely styled. The hotel reception could be a little friendlier but were professional. 

The pool area is the big selling point of this hotel and it does not disappoint but must say it is a little short on sun loungers especially when big groups arrive. 

Unfortunately there was a large group of Chinese travellers on our floor and they did not seem to have much regard for making too much noise. We moved room to try and get away from this. 

The main reason I am not giving this place more then 3 stars is that in my opinion the breakfast and rooms were not up to standard. The bathroom we had smelled really bad from the drainage pipes and even after the staff cleaning it the smell came back shortly afterwards. 

The gym was not as good as I had hoped but I guess that was because I had high expectations 

Overall a nice pool and location but feel only worth it if there is a good deal going.

text:
We stayed here late December over new years in a studio room.

Service over the stay wasn't great unfortunately. While the staff opening the door of the car were welcoming, on check in the reception was slow and unwelcoming.  We requested a cot on check-in, however, we had to call again as they had forgotten. The cot itself was great. Staff at the breakfast buffet seemed a bit disinterested. On check-out we had called the reception for the bell boy but they had forgotten, we had to tell them again.

The actual property was good, the studio had a washer/dryer which helped us with laundry, and the room had international sockets built it. Location wise, it was a good point to visit the city attractions from and, if you are up to it, in walking distance to many things.

On a side-note, the new years eve rate was incredibly hiked, we'd assumed this paid for a dinner or something like in other parts of the world but we didn't find anything extra to justify the hike.

Overall, we would stay again but would adjust our expectations accordingly.
title: Great location, great facilities, service left wanting.

text:
My family and with our 2 kids came to this hotel without booking on 31st and while traveling and low on fuel. Couple of weeks back our friends stayed at this hotel with their 2 kids and they recommended because they were looked after nicely.

 However the lady who met us greeted with a doubt (maybe because they don't get guests who don't come without a booking), we requested some more details, what there is to do around and to see a room before making a choice, they didn't refuse but it seemed that she was irritated. They didn't give us information and we were straight seated, served a nice drink, and kept waiting. Few issue took place

1. While we're waiting I approached the reception staff and started to ask details to purchase some fuel if the hotel had (initially the lady said they didn't have fuel in the hotel) I asked for assistance to go to town to refuel. The answers I got was a flat out No! even the guy at the reception cut into the conversation and gave me an answer saying we don't have drivers at the hotel (first time I heard this). No! No! No! Was the only answer I got and it was frustrating, My patience ran out and I directly asked for the manager, who apparently was the guy in the reception. I called him to my side and told him I was a diplomat in the Indian embassy. I wanted my vehicle to be refueled and repeated my request for help.

2 It was surprising to see how they changed, the guy even said he would check the stores and see how much fuel the have (minutes before they said they didn't have any) it was after I said I was a diplomat that this guy offered help. 

3. we decided to see the lunch menu before seeing the room and the lobby manager took the order. 

But Over all the good triumphs. 
The area is peaceful The room was comfortable and value for what we paid, it was nice to sit in the pool in the evening with the wind and drinking cocktails. Some staff were friendly and professional. The reception was also more friendlier. food was tasty, lunch Fish and chips were good. Dinner We chose Naan, chicken. Breakfast was also good. 
l. 
The next day we visited the park which was also good. I requested the reception guy to assist me to the town for fuel, it seemed he didn't want to but in the end he did accompany me around town. 

Few things I Want to say that the hotel should have 
1. I don't know any names of staff because they don't have name tags. Every hotels have staff wittheir name tags. 
2. Their is no feedback form to fill out. Normally there is a book or a card or even a email. I didn't receive or see any thing. Making me wonder if this is not there to avoid such feedback as mine. 

There are good in the hotel. The hotel is a bit far. Helping matters from the start.
title: New year ups and downs.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We just got back from a great road trip from the south to the east coast, where we stayed at The Calm Bay Resorts in Passikudah.  The journey itself was scenic and exciting, especially for the kids who enjoyed every bit of the ride.  When we got there, we were cordially welcomed in a way that was typical of Tamil culture. This was something we really liked.

 The Passi Bay Suite was very big and great for a family.  The kids adored that the suite had its own sauna and hot tub.  The hotel has a really serene ambiance. It really is a calm bay, which is great for families who want to relax and spend time together.

 The cuisine, on the other hand, wasn't quite what we expected.  The buffet was okay, but it didn't have enough choices and the food didn't taste as good as we had hoped.  The à la carte menu was again okay but taste could have improved more. We think it might have been because it was the off-season, so we know that dispersion is limited.

 Even so, the personnel were kind and helpful, which made our stay more comfortable.  The people in the area were really friendly and welcoming, and we departed with great recollections of the Tamil culture.

 Overall, it was an okay experience, taking into account the distance we went and how much the suite cost.  We still think this resort is worth a visit, especially for people who want peace and quiet on Sri Lanka's east coast.

 — Kushan Amarasinghe, Family Traveler and Suites / Chalet Reviewer
title: A Serene Family Escape in Passikudah – Spacious Suite, Peaceful Vibes, Average Dining

Прекрасный вход в море, чудесная ланкийская кухня, приятные номера с выходом к морю. Все в номерах удобно, функционально
Из минусов: 
- отвратительное покрытие пола (очень скользко), 
- ужасающе грязный спорт зал (ком земли лежит с начала отпуска),  осколки разбитого зеркала валялись два дня, потом их сгреб веником сотрудник ресепшн (обычно стекло пылесосят. Спорт зал всё-таки)
-жуткая жара в ресторане, жарче чем на улице, кондиционеры совершенно не работают. Сотрудники открывают двери, но это мало помогает, после приема пищи выходишь мокрый до нитки. 
- очень скудные завтраки. Каждый день рыбный/куриный карри, яйца, сыр лежит почти расплавленный из за жары, страшная колбаса, кофе растворимый. Варёный за деньги. Из фруктов папая, арбуз. Есть крупная надпись "ваша оплата не включает еду на вынос". Любопытно, что там можно вынести.... Наверно карри в карман перелить
- банные принадлежности кладут не каждый день, однако приносят, если попросить. Зубные счетки, пасту не дают, пришлось ехать за этим в магазин
- слабая уборка номеров. Песок в душевой остаётся лежать после уборки
- отсутствие устройств для мытья ног на выходе с пляжа

В целом отель мог бы быть очень неплох, т к имеет прекрасный выход к океану и большую территорию и уютные номера с высоким потолком. Однако менеджмент приложил все усилия, чтобы отель был не выше трёх звезд

roomTip:
First floor rooms are nicer, because the second floor balconies have rather ugly nets

Reportedly, the driver accommodation is not good.
text:
The calm resort and spa is located on the gorgeous and immaculately clean Kalkudah beach. One of the big benefits is that the sea is very calm in this bay and it’s possible to swim, without being knocked about by the waves. 

The grounds are lush and the rooms are extremely spacious and absolutely spotless, but unfortunately the mattresses are soft and appear fairly worn. Staff are very friendly and accommodating as well. Overall, this hotel has the potential to offer a perfect holiday, but sadly there are some deficiencies that spoil the experience somewhat. 

I had reserved a room with twin beds, but they gave us a double bed instead and while they immediately sought to
rectify the situation, it took a good 25 minutes to do so. Really nothing to complain about, but it was only
one of several small incidents. The service in the restaurant was not particularly great, the wine list was terribly uninspiring and the only white wine available by the glass was virtually undrinkable. The food was tasty overall and the breakfast spread rather impressive and the mainly Russian patrons certainly made the most of it.  They also had a rather good Sri Lankan filter coffee and they kindly made us a coffee at 6 pm, while we were waiting for our room to be prepared.

But the really big issue was the treatment of our lovely driver. He had to wait almost 5 hours for his room (which apparently was sub-standard, when he finally had it)  and didn’t receive his dinner, so that he had to seek sustenance elsewhere. The drivers work so hard, especially these days, where they have to waste so much time and energy securing fuel for their vehicles and are exhausted after a day’s driving. As this is really unacceptable,  I can recommend this hotel only to guests, who are not coming with a driver.
title: Calm and comfortable

Reservation Desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. You have to walk a long distance if you get a corner room. Some areas of the corridor and walking paths do not have proper lighting at night.
Buffet has a limited spread but tasty. However 90% of the items in the lunch buffet were seen in the dinner buffet also. Service at the main restaurant was very poor. We had to wait about 10 minutes to get water. 
There was a private function in the main restaurant in the night we stayed at the hotel. Therefore the Auditorium had been arranged for dining for hotel guests but there were not enough tables and chairs. We had wait about 10 minutes to get a table. 
We were asked to leave the pool area by 6.30 p.m. due to the firework display which was a part of the private function. They should have arranged that in a different location without disturbing the in house guests. 
Baby cot they provided was broken which could have caused injuries to the baby. When we informed that, hotel staff started to repair that inside the room without caring the privacy and disturbance. They should have checked this before placing that in the room.
Ground was neglected. Grass were not properly trimmed.
This hotel has a good potential but currently it has been neglected.
title: Hotel with a Good Potential but Poor Management

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Warmest Greetings from THE Calm Resort & Spa!

Thank you for stayed with us and chosen THE Calm Resort & Spa as your Home away from home. Thank you for sharing your review on the resort facilities, services and the staffs. It is our pleasure to exceed our Guest's expectations together with our rest of the team, However it was sad to hear the challenges you experienced during your stay and upon. kindly accept our sincere apologies for inconvenience caused. Thank you for sharing your concern over improving for better services. We earnestly look forward to welcoming you back in near future.

Kind regards.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Garden Room gives good access to beach and pool
text:
After touring around Sri Lanka we were looking forward to a relaxing beach stay at The Calm. This is a simple (rather soulless) hotel with few facilities (small pool, gym and a spa) but located on a great beach.
We were upgraded to a Garden Room which was spacious and modern although not without faults - broken plug in the bathroom sink, broken fridge and broken TV (fridge repaired and TV changed quickly though). Frustratingly nesting pigeons in the roof space made for an unwelcome alarm call every morning and none of the wardrobe doors or drawers would close properly (drawers would automatically extend when clothes were placed in them). Rainfall shower was good!
Another positive is the food provided at the evening buffet - good quality with a range of Sri Lankan and western choices, although did get a little monotonous after a week. We noticed that the standard of food and service dropped when staff were pandering to corporate guests that were staying at the hotel. Drinks service provided in restaurant and bar was patchy at best with most wines on the wine list being out of stock. Sometimes you had finished your meal before drinks arrived. Breakfast buffet was OK but there is no fresh coffee - just self serve sachets of Nescafe and a hot water urn.
Evenings were strange as every one seemed to disappear after dinner - entertainment was limited to a singing guitarist (with limited repatoire) although a big screen was set up for a couple of the world cup matches. More effort was made for corporate group bookings.
During the day, the biggest frustration was trying to secure towels and cushions for sunbeds. Whilst there were plenty of sunbeds, we often had to wait for laundered towels to arrive and the hotel only has 30 cushions to cater for all guests! During out 8 day stay a drinks service around pool/beach was only offered once and even then the barman returned after 45 minutes to confirm items out of stock.
To break up the monotony of the lunchtime food offering we decided to order a 'promotional Thali' for the last day - to be ordered a day in advance. Unfortunately when we arrived for lunch we were informed that due to a group arriving at the hotel, a Thali couldn't be provided so ended up spending 6,000 rupees on yet another buffet.
This hotel has potential with a few small improvements - provide a drinks service around the pool/beach (rather than staff members sitting around in groups watching tv and playing on their phones), provide a tea/coffee service at breakfast, spend a little money on snagging in the rooms and injecting some character in the communal areas and providing enough towels and cushions for the sunloungers.
title: Disappointing but has potential

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Warmest Greetings from THE Calm Resort & Spa!

Thank you for stayed with us and chosen THE Calm Resort & Spa as your Home away from home. We highly appreciate for sharing your review on the resort's facilities, the services and the staffs. We always strive to exceed our Guest's expectations, together with our rest of the team. We do provide Cold towels and Welcome drinks upon Arrivals and issue copy of Invoice upon Guest's request. kindly accept our sincere apologies for shortcoming in service. We look forward to welcoming you back in near future.

Kind regards.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Calm suit is better option .
text:
Hotel environment is absolutely calm. Nicely located without rush and hustle bustle. Hotel has a its own beach area  and can access safely.  Room was cleaned and staff was friendly.  Food (buffet) was satisfactory but if we consider the rate for a stay they could have improved it in to better level.
However I have noticed two things. we didn't had welcome and refreshment like other hotels do at the time of arrival. I don't know whether they missed it or the hotel is not considering it.  Another thing is we did not received proper  hotel payment slip (bill) other than the credit card payment slip (the small one) Though these issues are not important to us there may have some guests who consider above facts. 
For us overall stay was great and happy to visit again.
title: Absolutely Calm...

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Angelacullen,

Thank you very much for the detailed comment here on Trip Advisor. 
However, please allow me to extend my sincerest apologies as we have failed to meet your expectations on certain facets during your stay. We highly value our guests’ feedback and your review about your experience with us is greatly appreciated. I am a firm believer that these comments are helpful motivators to continuously improve our ways of enhancing our guests' experience. 

We have well noted the points you have raised for future improvement and consideration as we are always looking for ways to develop and strive for perfection.

Warmest Regards,
placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We were so glad we opted for a beach stay at the end of our tour and we received a wonderful welcome. We decided to upgrade to all inclusive from half board as we knew we wouldn't be leaving the grounds. There are no shops/bars/restaurants within walking distance and to be honest we just wanted to relax & do nothing. We were advised that as we were now all inclusive our minibar would be stocked with beer and soft drinks-this never materialised despite asking daily until we left. It would have been better to say nothing as we would have been none the wiser. 

We were shown to our bungalow which was stunning-fabulous aircon and a sitting are with the pool literally 10 steps from our patio! The room was kept spotlessly clean although when we left empty bottles/glasses outside the door for collection they were left there for over 24 hours. Also there was no consistency to the toiletries that were left each day. 1 day it was shower gel & shampoo, the next day shampoo & body lotion (even though we'd used the previous days) so we had to ask for more. 

The food was amazing and the executive chef spoke to us at every meal ensuring that we were happy with selection. 2 things however let the breakfast buffet down I believe- there was only 1 brand of milk (Unsure of fat content) and 1day there was cereal and orange juice and the next day none. I did question this and was told they liked to vary the menu. I pointed out that they had toast/croissant/cheese etc every morning but not this. I was also told Sri Lankan's don't usually eat cereal so I suggested that they begin to include it every day for non-Sri lankans. You can ask for it, which I did so watch this space......

The second complaint I had, which I also discussed with the food & beverage manager was a complete absence of diet soft drinks. Not everyone wants to drink alcohol (or water) all day and when my husband asked for a cola light was told they didn't have any? 

I am diabetic which I pointed out so couldn't drink normal or full sugar equivalent. The beverages manager came to see me and said that they would try to get some by that evening or early the next day. Within an hour he came to tell me that they now had a stock of Pepsi max for me (? Just me). Over the course of the next few days almost every waiter asked me if I wanted a Pepsi max which left me a bit paranoid to be honest. They didn't seem to understand the importance of having low sugar alternatives of ALL their soft drinks, not just one variety and not just for me. 
However I was impressed with the speed my raised concern was dealt with so I would like to thank you for that. 

There was one restaurant manager (small, slim with dark hair-no name badge) who seemed to take offence at my complaint and didn't make eye contact with us for the remainder of our stay-I would suggest some customer service training! 

It sounds like I've been having a good rant but these are very minor details that could be rectified so easily and would ensure an much improved stay. 

The resort & grounds were one of the best we have ever stayed at and we left feeling completely re-charged so I would like to thank you so much. It just seems that service needs a little more tweaking to bring it up to the standard of the other 2 hotels we stayed at. 5 star surroundings with 3 star service.
title: Last leg of tour

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Warmest Greetings from THE Calm Resort & Spa!

Thank you for stayed with us and chosen THE Calm Resort & Spa as your Home away from home. Thank you for sharing your review on the resort facilities, services and the staffs. It is our pleasure to exceed our Guest's expectations together with our rest of the team, However it was sad to hear the challenges you experienced during your stay and upon departure. kindly accept our sincere apologies for inconvenience caused. We earnestly look forward to welcoming you back in near future.

Kind regards.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Start with the hotel. Nice enough, the stretch of beach around the bay is quite wide and very exposed in the hot sun. No beach chairs or sun shades are provided here so prepare to roast. There are a number of hotels along the bay. 
You walk out of the hotel to the pool which is fine.  Again, insufficient poolside loungers and shades. The poolside is surrounded by grass, beware if you have kids. Some kind of weed has taken over and it's like walking on thistles. I walked 10 feet on bare feet and then hopped back quickly to remove a load of fine needles. It's quite bizarre.  They had a bunch of local women who toiled for hours in baking heat to pull this stuff out but it was akin to painting the forth bridge. I don't really get why this is not a priority to sort.
Rooms are nice, comfortable, nice bedding. Our room had a TV which you could only watch by sitting on a small and not particularly comfortable 2 seater sofa. I think you should always be able to watch a TV from the bed if you are going to use it, which we didn't.  The shame about the rooms were the pigeons and there are a lot of them. They fly up under the eaves and crap all over the balcony and rail. I had to ask to get it cleared up but it doesn't last long as you can imagine. Stay on the ground floor. Wouldn't be so bad if the native bird song was a bit more tropical but a bunch of Pigeons cooing and defecating outside the window I can live without.
Food was far from spectacular and overpriced in comparison and for the quality.  Buffet is the standard offering and just not that great. Beef was on the menu one night and it was just inedible. What you could chew was like an old boot but mainly it was gristle and fatty. I don't get why you would serve it at all because people just bin it and try and find a plate of something else so it wastes everyone's time. Dessert bar was horrible, a symphony of overused gelatin, quite vile.  Rice and curry had chunks of chicken bone I didn't know existed.   So to get a decent nosh at a reasonable price we had the fruit platter for breakfast which is great and the burger off the menu is ok. This is not to say you can't eat anything from the buffet, you can, but not that much is nice for the price of it. 
There is a gym with one of everything and some decent weights. It all worked.
There are a couple of tourist shops which were never open in the few days we were there.

Issues started with my bill.  A long and laborious tale. I was charged twice on different credit cards for different amounts which anywhere else would have taken 10 minutes to resolve. The Hotel failed to manage the issue which involved me having to make calls from the UK to chase. Emails were not responded to, agreements were not followed. It took a month after leaving there to finally get my money returned. 
In addition I left something personal to me in my room, only about £40 in value but it was found and the Hotel said they would return it and given the complete mess they made not much to ask.  Of course it never arrived. 

So, stay on ground floor, wear walking boots to get to the beach, skip the buffet, pay cash and it will be fine.
title: A nightmare

ownerResponse/text: Dear andyjdyer, thank you for staying at The Calm Resort and for your pleasant review. We welcome your feedback and make improvements in the future. Your next visit will be greater to this one. I hope to see you again.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel has great potential. It has a great position on a lovely beach and the rooms and pool are great. However it lacks atmosphere that you would expect because there is no indoor communal bar/lounge to relax in. This may be because visitors cannot afford the ridiculously high drinks prices which are higher than the UK. It is good for breakfast with a good buffet and there are some local restaurants for dinner to choose from.
The staff are friendly but the restaurant manager kept us asking for an excellent rating on Trip Adviser!
title: Great position on gorgeous beach but expensive for food and drink

ownerResponse/text: Dear Kerrie K, thank you for staying at The Calm Resort and for your review. We consider your comments and will make improvements in future. Your next visit will be greater than this. Do hope to see you again.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
The rooms were very nice, clean spacious and had an excellent shower. Sea view was great.

The pool was nice, not enough sun beds for the number of guests. The beach is clean and also has sun beds.

It's let down by the food which is probably the worst we've had in Sri Lanka. The buffet is £20 a meal and the a la carte menu is pretty basic. Also the the dining area feels like a school canteen or something you'd encounter in Benidorm.

The staff are lovely but need more training as we were brought warm beer and water which is pretty bonkers when it's 38 degrees.
title: Nice room and pool, very average food

ownerResponse/text: Dear Liz A, thank you for staying at The Calm Resort and for your pleasant review. We preserve our positives and we will emend our negatives in future. Looking forward for your visit again.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is very lovely. Nice pool, easy access to the beach and lovely grounds. Amazing view from the balcony. The let down is the restaurant. The food is almost always surrounded by flies, staff not attentive and food is a very limited selection. The restaurant manager needs to learn how to manage his staff. This hotel can be so much more than it is with a little training and a restaurant and kitchen staff. Front of house was very friendly and welcoming!!
title: Hmmm

ownerResponse/text: Dear cecilecrouzi, thank you for staying at The Calm Resort and for your pleasant review. We welcome your feedback and make improvements in the future. Your next visit will be greater to this one. I hope to see you again.
placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: We spent two days and night in this resort and it was enough. Clearly the resort and the location are amazing, however the prices of the food, of the activities or any services are way too expensive for Sri Lanka. Regarding the staff they are trying their best but for the price paid we expected much better quality. Cécile and Florian
title: Nice resort and beach but too expensive

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely location but meals and drinks very expensive and the restaurant menu was far too limited. Disappointed that our room did not have tea/coffee making facilities or a loo roll holder. The staff were always most helpful and the overall ambience is memorable.
title: Lovely location but meals expensive and limited

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Of all the wonderful places we stayed in Sri Lanka (Ulagalla, Amangalla, Wallawwa) this was the most disappointing. The hotel itself is a small boutique place, which was a converted mansion, with wonderfully trained staff. I had no problem with the service at all. But the facility itself was a disappointment. The room where we stayed had an outside sitting area and an outside private eating area -- which would have been fabulous except that the mosquitos were a killer. Herbal repellents do absolutely nothing for me and we had run out of DEET a few days earlier. So despite the anti-mosquito bracelets that they left, my ankles were swollen with bites the first night. Also the room, which was quite dark, had limited place to put suitcases (and we travel light) and no place to sit except the bed. There were no slippers and the shower was very slippery. The combination shower and toilet left no room for privacy if one wanted to shower and the other wanted to attend to other hygiene issues. As in all overseas hotels, the electric outlet problem is just that -- a problem and inadequate. Challenging to blow dry hair and forget about using a curling iron. The grounds were lovely, and became magical at night with the fairy lights. 
The breakfasts were fine and the lunch/dinner that we had was good. Nothing outstanding, but no complaints. My thing was avoiding the mosquitos at all costs, so we tried to spend little as possible time outside in the evening and all meals are outside.
title: Ok

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ask fo4 a room on tbe top floor
text: Room was close to the bar and vry noisy, the food was not very good, the environment and the garden were very nice, good welcome ans staff very friendly, we recommend to ask for a room upstairs, style of the house nice
title: Noisy room

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your review and the list of positives,including the quality of breakfast and lunch.With regard to your negative feedback about dinner we are deeply sorry the experience did not work for you - this does concern us,even as your review sits between one referring the the food as “delicious” and the other as “excellent”.We will explore the anomaly to check.

The price of food is not typically regarded as extremely overpriced as you have described - if you do not include government taxes over which we have no control - the dinner price is currently £26 including 10% service charge for the staff ..Kandy is 7km away so we do not consider guests having to stay for dinner ,it is entirely upto them

Thank you very much for choosing The Kandy House and we are sorry this aspect of your stay disappointed.
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Visited The Kandy House for 2 nights during travels round Sri Lanka. 

The positives: beautiful colonial property and grounds; service is faultless; fantastic breakfasts and lunches. 

The negatives: terrible dinners, which are extremely overpriced - given the location you are essentially held captive to have dinner at The Kandy House. The food on both nights we stayed was terrible, which is surprising as the lunches we had were great and reasonably priced. Also could be more transparent with pricing, everywhere we went in Sri Lanka provided prices inclusive of service and tax.
title: Enjoyable stay, but does not live up to hype.

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: There is no doubt that this is an attractive building and we had high hopes of our stay here but sadly it was disappointing not to mention expensive. We stayed in the Admiral suite which was actually a long room with a toilet and shower at one end  and a small sitting room at the other end opening on to a shared veranda overlooking the grounds .There was a bath and two washbasins in the bedroom area. Unfortunately the shower when we first arrived malfunctioned so we ran out of hot water when I was in the shower initially until it was fixed. However one tap in a wash basin was not in working order either. The big issue however was the height of the bed SO high that a padded stool was provided to clamber into bed...but why only one until we asked for another AND further more getting in and out of the bed swathed in a mosquito net was not easy or safe. Storage space was limited as was space to access suitcases. We were allocated a butler but he seemed too do little more than serve huge expensive meals we had no option but to take as we were. isolated from any other restaurants. Other boutique hotels usually do simpler meals for people with small appetites. The only redeeming features were the beautiful grounds and the swimming pool but although there were ample loungers  there was limited shades at the pool and no changing rooms. We found the staff quite glum and cheerless unlike the rest of Sri Lanka.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel was a bit disappointing. Rooms very tired. Bathrooms open plan. Separate hot and cold taps on sink so only hot or cold water. Large bath in centre of room but hot tap runs so slowly it takes over 10 mins to fill it with a small amount of water. Everyone is given a butler, who is charming but does no more than general staff in a hotel and you feel obliged to leave a large tip despite a 10% service charge on the bill. Many people bothered by morning call to prayer from 4am over Loudspeaker
Food is fabulous, grounds are lovely, delightful pool area although too cold to swim in.
title: Old colonial house

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for 2 nights of our honeymoon, it was a beautiful hotel in a beautiful setting. There are only 9 rooms and there were so many staff that we almost felt a bit smothered as everywhere we turned there was someone there watching us.  We were often the only ones eating at the restaurant for breakfast. The main disappointment was the dinner on the first night we found out that they have a set menu and a set price which was very expensive for what we got. And had no option of choosing anything else or eating anywhere else as it is 25 minutes from Kandy. The rooms were fairly small and everything creeked. An expensive couple of nights!!
title: A little disappointing

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
On the plus side, the food was fantastic, the staff were excellent and the setting delightful.  The main guest area is a fine example of colonial building.

Our stay was in the Pioneer room and it is specifically this that made our stay a problem.  The room is an annex to the main building, linked by a  building with washrooms for hotel guests to use while outside.  The room itself is quite pleasant and has a spacious toilet/shower area.  In the evenings some guests, perhaps under pressure, see the doorway as another washroom door and enter or try to enter.  We were a bit careless with locking the door - it is a luxury hotel after all - and even had someone enter while we were in the room. We did complain to the hotel but even though I’m sure other guests would have had the same issue, I suspect nothing will be done.  

So the message is avoid the Pioneer room and enjoy your stay.
title: An experience ... but mind the intruders

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
The staff were generally lovely. The first meal we had, more western style fish was moist and delicious. However, the next night we had a Sri Lankan feast and it was extremely salty. We’ve eaten lots of local Sri Lankan food for cheap and have found it delicious but this meal was inedible because of the salt content and it was our most costly meal we’ve had!! The colonial
Home and the gardens surrounding it are the highlights. We both  had a massage and did not like it at all. The movements are rapid and erratic. Be warned ladies, if you choose full massage, your boobies will Be rubbed. The beds were hard, the sheets were damp and sandy. The staff did change them so that they were only damp and not sandy, which made it more pleasant. However, overall we wouldn’t recommend it for the price.
title: Beds were wet and sandy

ownerResponse/text:
You have been kind enough to list several accolades about the property and meticulous running of the hotel.Management and staff go to significant lengths to give guests an experience which does not represent 4-star chains - I would beg to differ a stay in a 4-star chain in Colombo is replicated at The Kandy House - and which does give a sense of home in various ways.On arrival you were upgraded to a higher category room.You did not meet the manager - who was on leave - and we would never want other staff to upset a guest.We are truly sorry if any offence or misunderstanding was caused.An additional clarification,butlers are not a gimmick - we get very positive feedback for that part of a more personal boutique service and will not be changing it.WIFI is deemed strong by most guests,cutting out periodically if not used by a guest so not absorbed by one guest consistently to the detriment of others -  you sometimes need to sign in again.
We are sorry you felt we did not match your previous experiences in small hotels
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
this is our first trip to sri lanka and we only stayed in three places, cinnamon lakeside, elephant stables, kandy house. so, what we say should be tempered with our lack of experience with hotels in sri lanka but we have stayed in various boutique hotels all over the world and we have mixed feelings about Kandy House.

Architecturally, Kandy House is a jewel and definitely worth a visit. The grounds and the building are well kept and the decor is tasteful and a joy to behold. The compound is just simply gorgeous with rooms built around a central courtyard. Individual rooms are aesthetically arranged and very comfortable. As indicated in other reviews, it is an oasis of calm after the mayhem of Kandy central. I strongly recommend checking Kandy House out to have a sense of gracious living in Sri Lanka. 

 I always maintain that a place is ever going to be as good as its management. Kandy House is run meticulously, rooms are orderly, clean and the food is good. However, everything seems mechanical and one gets the sense that the workers are just employees - not something one would expect in a boutique hotel. There are no personal touches in Kandy House - you might as well be staying in a 4 star chain.

The manager sanjaya has a lot to learn about the hospitality industry. He is still young and will have time to learn that one trait you don't want to communicate in hospitality is cockiness. However, the place is efficiently run but we get that in other 5 star joints.

In a boutique hotel, we are looking for a sense of home - and this we didn't find in Kandy House and this is one reason why we will not be returning  - pity - as the compound itself is beautiful. 

as for the personal butler - it is just a gimmick. the place is so small and compact, one doesn't need a butler. Other gripes - dodgy unstable wifi and hot water that runs out after 3 minutes. The bath tubs may be the centre piece in some rooms but it wasn't comfortable as there was not enough hot water to run a warm bath. The devil is in the details - and when you look closely, Kandy House doesn't measure up,
title: a beautiful cold place

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: The property is an authentic 200 year old manor house, and is faithful to detail in most areas, including furnishings. The food was reasonably good and the staff were reasonably friendly. Reasonable is about as high a rating as I feel able to provide.
title: Enjoyable stay but not outstanding

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in The Kandy House for two nights during our honneymoon. The hotel is beatiful, it has a fantastic swimmingpool and a gorgeous garden. The service and the food is also really good. 
The main problem that we had is that nearby there is a Budist temple. Budists pray in the morning, from 04:00 to 05:30 am. They pray singing really loud which woke us up during the two nights that we stayed. In my opinion such a good hotel cannot have this disadvantage. Whenever I go to a hotel I expect to sleep well, I couldn't do it in this hotel.
title: Couldn't sleep well

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: The good: beautiful historic mansion set in a tropical garden. The bad: 1) open toilet with no door, 2) If you are taller than 1,80 m / 6 feet you risk hitting your head in the door jams, 3) overpriced average food. Another problem is the location: it is at least a half hour drive from downtown Kandy and you can get stuck in traffic.
title: Mixed impression

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: This was easily the least impressive hotel overall that I stayed in during a 15 day tour of Sri Lanka.  Its stengths are well reported here - a beautiful building and lovely rooms.  Some food is outstanding - the curry night on my first evening - and some distinctly mediocre - the short set menu on my second.  But i never quite shook off the feeling that the ownership thought it was doing me a favour by letting me stay there.  A very abrupt introductory tour really failed to explain very much about how the butler service works - and in my case it didn't very well when my nominated butler was off duty.  This diffident attitude towards guests is nowhere better illustrated that by the management's response to numerous Trip Adviser complaints over the years that there is only one sun umbrella by the pool - ignore the problem altogether and carry on as usual
title: Not half as good as it thinks it is

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Set several km out of town,it has a wonderful setting,very well kept grounds and gardens but.........
The rooms can be dark,there are uneven floors,no mini bar and we were badly bitten by the local mosquito population,no matter what remedies we tried.Privacy is at a premium as the terrace or verandah with the rooms are not private or particularly secluded.There are no insect repellent devices in the rooms,astonishingly,given that the grounds adjoin paddy fields.There is limited choice of menu if you dine in and no in room tea or coffee.
That having been said,the staff are very polite,willing and always smilimg.Service is prompt and each room has an assigned butler.The home made cakes are wonderful,the wine list reasonable and the curry evenings not to be missed but if you don't like curry,they wii try to meet any reasonable request
Light switches can be extraordinarily difficult to locate.Be warned!
Staff will take you on a trek through the paddy fields to a local temple which is off the beaten track but worth the trek
title: Quirky

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Kandy House has some real strengths.  But it also has a few weaknesses.

We were in the 'Black Rajah' room, which is full of colonial charm on first inspection but it has a few issues which I imagine extend to other lower floor rooms.  

Firstly, the bathroom design is quirky but impractical.  If you're traveling as a couple, make sure you're comfortable in eachother's skin because in the absence of a door and with the toilet about 5 metres from the bed ... Nothing is left to the imagination.  Oh, and remember the concrete bath in the centre of the room if you have to get up in the middle of the night to use that toilet.

If you're tall, like me at 6ft2, make sure you wear a hat everywhere, because you're going to be banging your head.  A lot.  

And if you're a light sleeper, bring ear plugs.  The design is such that only a very thin, wooden door with lots of cracks separates you from the courtyard where staff run around after the dinner service so if you're looking for an early night, that's probably not going to work out for you.

The setting though is gorgeous - a peaceful manor in the Kandy hillside suburbs that feels like something out of the Jungle Book complete with superb infinity pool.

The staff are friendly but often you have to search around to find someone if you need something.  We saw the manager on check-in but not again during our two day stay.

And the food in the restaurant is inconsistent.  On one day we were the only couple around but it took 40 minutes for the kitchen to deliver two simple cocktails.  That night the food was very forgettable - including a dessert where the milk had been heated too much and it had curdled.  But on the next night the food was superb and the following morning's breakfast could not have been delivered more promptly.

All in all, a character-filled manor in a beautiful jungle setting but some quirks that won't suit everyone and inconsistent food mean we'd rate it 3.5 if we had that option.
title: Patchy

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: But nothing exceptional. The house is rather small. Being old, the noise insulation is very poor. The food was good, very good chef, creative. The staff was helpful and kind. The room on the ground floor was too humid, not ventilated enough and smelled a bit the humidity, but the size was decent.
title: Nice looking place but...

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
First some positives and there definitely were several.  We had one of the so-called ultra rooms on the main floor.  Our suite was quite charming with a stone tub in the bedroom and candles placed on it each evening.  We had two dinners at Kandy House.  The first was satisfactory but not noteworthy.  The second, a curry dinner with about 9-10 dishes, was excellent.  I have no idea why the hotel seems to offer a very limited menu though.  It is possible they will prepare other dishes if you ask but that is not mentioned as you check-in or come to dinner.

We had what they call a private butler.  He did serve our meals and fetch a few things for us but appeared poorly suited for his job.  We would have preferred simply having other staff serving us as in other upscale boutique hotels in Sri Lanka.  Perhaps some guests are impressed having a private butler but for us this young fellow was below the service standards at other Sri Lankan hotels.

On checkout, we found a few "errors" on our bill.  The literature in our room indicated tea and cake in the afternoon are complimentary.  Yet it was included in a general expense line which one could only understand by asking a fellow I presume might be the manager to explain.  One morning we had tea in a sitting area about five meters from where we then had our breakfast (we were on their B&B plan so breakfast was included).  We were charged for tea in the sitting area also until we objected.  Last while we enjoyed cocktails in the garden my wife asked our butler if they had some nuts.  He brought some out and we were shocked to find the nuts also included in our bill.  The fellow told us they always charge for nuts - I guess ordering two cocktails does not warrant even nuts at Kandy House.  After our bill was corrected (yes the charge for the nuts was also removed with the fellow repeating several times that they always charge for nuts), we got up to leave.  The fellow did not even wish us a good journey or say he hoped we enjoyed our stay.  As this review shows, this episode left a bad impression.  The extra charges did not amount to much money but the attitude exhibited was poor.
title: Has Potential If Better Managed

ownerResponse/text:
Many thanks for your review and comments.It's not often we experience a report on the weather - even the power of Tripadvisor cannot control the rain,but we are obviously sympathetic for guests who may occasionally experience unseasonal poor weather.As you say,it does seem the tone of your comments has been rather influenced by the rain...as would have been the periodic poor performance of WIFI in that weather,it can weaken it occasionally.

You relate how we would not let you cancel one night.It's probably worth mentioning that one week before your 3-night stay,although booked through an agent,you approached the hotel directly to cancel one of the nights.We have a clear cancellation policy and it's typically well understood especially in a key booking period for a small hotel,so we become very compromised if somebody cancels at very short notice.We hope you understand in the same way as a few previous guests in similar circumstances,and it has not coloured other parts of your review as well.

We are also sorry you were disappointed with the room.There's little we can do about that,as you saw many of the rooms are different and individually styled,as well as differently priced - for your stay of 3 nights with dinner on one of them,your billed average price was no more 240 pounds per night.We heard from your wife that you were happy with the room,but you were clearly less impressed with the food.Hopefully other reviews can be a broader reflection.

One further clarification is required as you mention it.We close down for the night as late as required,not any specific time.I understand the staff may have begun that process prematurely as all others had gone to bed and you were returning from dinner outside - that is our mistake for which we apologise,it should not usually happen.However,all spaces should have been made available to you on your return.I gather you went on to enjoy the remainder of the complimentary bottle of wine we had given to you on your first night,on the veranda of your room.

I have no problem you recommending a different hotel in your review even if rather a sting in the tail of your comments,and really regret that your stay at The Kandy House was so underwhelming for you.We hope you went on to enjoy your visit to Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Maybe the incessant rain didn't help but we left feeling very underwhelmed and somewhat fleeced .We booked 3 nights but due to family problem explained in advance that we could only stay 2 ..they refused to let us cancel one night . It cost us almost £300 per night ( including one meal for two ) . For that you would expect an amazing room . There are beautifully appointed rooms there ..our wasn't one of those ..don't book into the Cornelian room..its a bit pokey , with a shared veranda (so you have to keep your shutters  closed )  . 
Dinner OK..but only OK . Breakfast ..warm curd , warm milk ..not ideal .  It is a lovely looking place though , wonderfully scenic pool , free bikes to explore the lung busting hills .

Oh yes they turn out all the common area lights at 10.30 and you can't get any drinks or food after that ..and there is no mini bar 

Wi Fi was very frustrating , especially as I had work to do ..it kept cutting out and I had to work in the common areas to get decent reception 

Its clean , and service came with a smile 

If in Kandy ..stay at the very quirky Helga's Folly instead .at least you will leave with a smile on your face
title: We were really looking forward to this

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your comments,and we note that you enjoyed the property and the food,but it's clear a few things were not to your particular liking.As the owner,I am concerned about your comments about the staff and "servitude".This is strong language and has caused offence,not least to the staff themselves.The hotel has operated for 10 years,and the staff are much cherished and support the hotel and hopefully give their best to our guests,taking great pride in the process.
We appreciate you used The Kandy House for your honeymoon,and wish you a happy life together.
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We had a room towards the back on the corner with a private balcony.  It's probably the most removed from activity, so if you want more privacy it's the one to go for.
text: This was one of the hotels my husband and I stayed at during our honeymoon.  Luckily, we were only there 2 days, so it was actually pretty nice.  The rooms are pretty, though a bit awkward it set-up.  The AC unit is EXTREMELY loud, but very necessary at night.  The floors are pretty creaky, so you can hear everyone moving around.  We didn't get a chance to use the pool, as we were really only there for 2 days and were sightseeing for the majority of those 2 days.  The menu was pretty limited, but luckily it was limited to things my husband and I both liked, so it worked out well for us, and again, it was only two days.  I will say it sometimes felt...less like service and more like servitude with our butler and some other staff members.  I don't think it's intentional and it's just a pretty awkward situation.  But the greeting was warm, no one was obtrusive, and the property itself was lovely.  As far as the pricing....there are better hotels for a better price in Sri Lanka, but it's in Kandy and that is a pretty big place of interest in Sri Lanka with a lot to do.  So overall, our stay was nice, but if had been anything longer than 2 days, we might have had to revise things.
title: Good for a short stay

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback and for highlighting both the positives and areas where we can improve. We’re happy to hear that you had a great experience with the tent accommodation, delicious food, and attentive staff, as well as enjoying the safari with Mr. Solomon. We truly appreciate your kind words.

We also take your feedback seriously regarding the distance from the park entrance, the wifi, and power issues, and will work on improving these aspects to enhance our guests’ experience. We apologize for the discrepancy in pricing and will ensure that our website and communication are clearer for future guests.

We value your recommendation and hope to welcome you back for an even better stay next time! Thank you again for your input.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
An authentic wildlife experience in Udawalawe.
The positives: The tent accommodation was adequate and the food was very good - generous servings and everything was delicious - an impressive feat given the camp’s remoteness and total reliance on solar power. The staff are attentive and helpful, and the safari experience was all we could have hoped for. Special mention to Mr Solomon, the safari guide, for his excellent knowledge. Also to Roger for helping us with transportation. 

The negatives: The camp is situated a long way from the national park entrance (approx 40 minute drive).
Despite what the website says the wifi does not work. There was no hot water for a shower and the power frequently cut out for lengthy periods leaving the tent without a fan or light. 
The website is a little difficult to follow in relation to prices for safaris, jeep, guide and what is actually included with these listings. We did 2 half-day safaris (1 would have been enough ) and Mahoora told us the park entrance for 2 people would be US$50 but we were charged US$72. 

Recommendations: 1 half-day safari and 1 night stay is plenty. You will see everything worth seeing in this time.
title: An authentic wildlife experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Alex,

Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback about your recent stay with us. We genuinely appreciate your honesty and insights into your experience.

We're truly sorry to hear that your stay was affected by the unseasonably wet weather, leading to the closure of Yala National Park. We understand the challenges this presented, especially with dampness in the tents. Your understanding regarding the refund for the downgrade is appreciated, and we apologize for any inconvenience caused. 

It's delightful to hear that despite the weather challenges, you were able to enjoy the safari in Udawalawe and witness lots of elephants. We appreciate your recommendation regarding the seatbelts in the safari vehicles, and we assure you that safety is a top priority for us. We will address this concern promptly to ensure compliance with legal requirements.

We're glad you found the food quite good, although we apologize for any discomfort caused by the inquiry about the number of drinks during your meals. Your feedback is valuable, and we will review our communication processes to ensure a more seamless and guest-friendly experience.

Once again, thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. We hope you will visit us again to provide you with a more positive and seamless experience in the future.

With kind regards,
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay was unfortunately tainted by the unseasonably wet weather that Sri Lanka was experiencing at the time. The Yala national park was actually closed for flooding so we were lucky that Udawalawe was still open. 
The wet weather was no one’s fault but it made the tents very damp - the beds were damp and all our belongings became damp. We were refunded for a downgrade because one of the luxury tents was damaged, and we had no problem with that but it took a long while to dry out afterwards.
The food was quite good considering we were in a camp but we had all inclusive drinks and it was disturbing to be asked half way through the meal EXACTLY how many drinks we’d had! We didn’t drink much - 2 glasses of wine each and the measures were such that they wouldn’t have equated to 1 glass! It didn’t seem generous. Our consumption was then double checked in the morning - what was that all about?
On the plus side, we saw lots of elephants in the park and the drive was unhurried and enjoyable (as the rain stopped briefly!) I f we had one recommendation for the management it would be that the safari vehicles absolutely must have working seatbelts - simply because they are open vehicles and we hurtled along the main road for 30 mins to get to the national park. I think this should be addressed as a priority as it would be a legal requirement in many countries.
title: Mixed experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear David,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We appreciate your kind words about our facility and are pleased to hear that the accommodation met your expectations for a night of fun.

We apologize for any disappointment you experienced with the alfresco evening meal. Your comments regarding the meal options are valuable to us, and we will certainly take them into consideration for future improvements. 

We understand your concern about the value of the meals, and we'll revisit our pricing and offerings to ensure our guests receive the best value for their money.

We genuinely value your input, and your feedback will contribute to our ongoing efforts to enhance the overall guest experience. Thank you for choosing us, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an improved stay in the future.

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
The accommodation was fun for a night and as expected.
With the tents being in a super rural location, we requested the alfresco evening meal which was disappointing.  Technically there were 5 courses: an amuse-bouche,  carrot soup,  salad comprising cucumber and apple; the main course comprised meat and 2 vegetables and the desert was ice cream.  An exceedingly dull meal with modest portions.  For US$20 per head management could put substantially more value into the ingredients/product and give their guests a truly memorable meal (for the right reasons).
AT US$10 per head the breakfast was equally poor value.  Buy locally.
The location of this resort was not convenient for early morning access to Uda Walawe national park.
title: Great facility, pass on the meal options

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for taking the time to share details of your experience with us. We are glad that you loved the accommodation and had an overall enjoyable experience with us. We have noted your comments on the safari and the vehicle transfer. As for the vehicle transfer, we have taken the issue very seriously. We arrange transfers with an outside company and we have already taken serious action on your case with them as we do not tolerate such inconveniences to our clients. We are also sorry that your expectations on the guide were not met. Though the guide allocated to you had been released last minute due to an emergency, it is not an excuse to justify your disappointment. We have taken immediate action to expand our pool of naturalists further and have a standby person all the time. Thank you very much for bringing these issues into our attention and taking the time to write the review. We hope you visit us again!
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
A generally good experience (Jan 17-19, 2019) but with significant and notable deficiencies.

We paid for Elite and were promised the services of an experienced naturalist, but that did not happen. Instead we only had the guide from the park and  they were not
anywhere close to the level of  Mahoora’s one available naturalist (who was given to another couple!)

It is never good to be charged for something and not have it provided.  Its hard to say what the $ value of that is, but Mahoora is one of the most expensive 
safaris, so we did not expect this type of deficiency, and if it was to occur they perhaps could have found a way to compensate for it, but they did not.

The Safaris were hit and miss, and when they were successful it was more often because of the Mahoora jeep driver who was excellent, and not usually the 
guide supplied by the park (as I mentioned, the experienced naturalist was not offered to us.) The park guides often have a poor command of english and we usually could not understand their explanations so generally we didn’t converse much.  The 4x4 vehicle provided by Mahoora is very good. The meals on safari were not, I think, what one would expect for the price of a 1st class safari, especially the lunches, which we found quite meagre and spartan.  Dinner around the campfire was very atmospheric, and enjoyable, and well prepared, however no choices were offered (what you see is what you get!).

We paid in advance for Mahoora to provide a driver to bring us from Ella to their campsite. Their fee was considerably higher that market rates,
but we didn’t mind since we assumed they would provide a high calibre driver and vehicle for this long distance transfer. Well the driver was fine, but the car was
a jalopy, without any seatbelts in the back. When I pointed this out to the driver, he said, “don’t worry, I’m a good driver”. I found that to be unacceptable especially for the high fee we paid.  If Mahoora is not making any effort to verify the safety of their guests when arranging a transfer then it borders on negligence.  Once I pointed this out on arrival I believe they took it seriously, but for a supposedly first rate safari company, this should not have happened in the first place.

The accommodations are very good, (for a tented experience) and the staff at Mahoora are very friendly and helpful. 

Overall it was an enjoyable experience, but overpriced I think for the actual product that was provided in our case.
title: A generally good experience

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your feedback. It is most valuable to us. We are glad you enjoyed yourselves and made memories and had a lovely overall experience with us. Thank you for your suggestions on the improvements. It is much appreciated. However, we are concerned that you weren't happy about the level of English of the team at our campsite. Empowering underprivileged local communities is one of our values and some of the staff you have encountered have gained employment under this policy. English is not their mother tongue and they are a work in progress. We are really sorry that we did not meet your expectations in this area. Your naturalist and the manager on duty also had been Sri Lankans but with good English skills. In certain situations, when the accent is not clear, they would have made clarifications. We are sorry that this was perceived negatively.  
We take your comments on communication issues at the camp very seriously. The Camp Manager and Guest Relations Manager are strictly advised to do a detailed briefing about the camp and about the day's programme to our clients. Upon investigation it was identified that the Guest Questionaire has reached the campsite, however there was a miscommunication and we are deeply sorry, the pre-obtained guest questionnaire should have been followed. 
In terms of the location, we have located our camp at the very less populated eastern boundary of the park. It's an exclusive mini nature reserve. Most of our clients appreciate our location though it's a 30 minute drive away to the park entrance. As for the non-availability of a sign to the camp, it is because we have a designated meeting point from where we pick up our clients and bring them to the campsite. We advise all our clients to arrive at the meeting point and not the campsite as the road leading to the campsite is pretty rough and can be comfortably traveled in our 4x4 jeeps.  
Nevertheless, we are very sorry for the inconveniences caused during your stay. We will take your comments for further enhancement and improve ourselves in order to provide a better experience for our clients. Thank you for taking the time to write and thank you for staying with us!
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
It’s a shame they don’t make a few improvements that could make this a 10/10.

1.) English was a serious issue at the camp, throughout all employees, manager, and naturalist. I felt like I was rarely understood and typically had to repeat myself. I was very very surprised to stay at a place that cost this much and find this.

2) poor management. We never really had anything explained to us so found ourselves confused often and having to proactively track down management to ask questions.

3)  they don’t communicate with the corporate office. We spent months Dialoging with the corporate office (who speak great English) and they had us fill out a guest intake form of preferences. But none of those preferences or dietary restrictions were taken into account . Highly doubt they were ever received.

4) food was meh. Please let your cooks make us real Sri Lankan food on our Sri Lankan safari...

5) location is a bit far from the entrance in our thought.

6) there is no sign. Literally no sign and it’s on a back tiny road that you will never find. Add 45-60 min to your already long car ride trying to find it. This just bamboozles me. Please help me understand. 

Since the staff tried to please (when you approached them proactively) I feel like if the right manager was brought in these issues could be cleaned up. As it is, this felt like a really nice tent (hard product) with sloppy soft product. Still enjoyed ourselves and have great memories because the concept is still good. If I had the chance again I’d try to find a new camp though.
title: Great experience, improvements please

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. We value feedback from our guests very much and very happy to hear that you greatly appreciate the stay in our tent next to the park. However, with regard to the concerns you have about “hearing of footsteps” please note that, upon investigations staff have found that the area has been absolutely secured. As other tents were also occupied that night, it could have possibly been another guest/ an employee (security guard) of ours. Nevertheless, we have increased our security patrolling and we keep clients informed about possible hearing of footsteps in order to ensure such concerns do not repeat. Further, we are sorry that you felt our staff was not taking your concerns seriously.  We are a smiling nation by nature, perhaps it was misunderstood as mockery. We are also alarmed that you got sick from our food and this is first time we are hearing of such an incident. We can assure you that our food is of very high quality as we service high profile clients at Mahoora. We did not hear of any issue on the food from other clients from the same night. Nonetheless, we are really sorry for the inconveniences caused and that your experience with us did not go entirely as expected.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed here for one night. While staying near the park is a great experience in a tent, it is way too much money for what it is. 

There was a security issue in the evening and I heard strangers walking around my tent, even though I was assured the area was secure. The staff laughed at me and thought I was crazy. 

I got sick from the food and an extra safari tour cost double what local guides sell it for, further evidence that this accomodation is a rip off.
title: Not worth the money

ownerResponse/text:
We are happy to see the details of your review and to know that you had a great stay. 
In fact the little tips that you have shared are wonderful for other travelers.
We are truly appreciative for taking time to write and share the details.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed for one night in a Classic Plus tent. The tent was clean and comfortable but not exactly luxury.  Our naturalist was very knowledgeable and a friendly fellow.  Staff were great.  The food served was very good and in particular, the Sri Lankan curry lunch.  We appreciate the efforts in conservation of companies like Mahoora.  If you are doing an early morning safari just be aware that the camp location is a very far 30 minutes from the entrance to the park for safari which can make a difference when you have to be up so early in the morning.  The safari was fun and we enjoyed spotting the birds and other animals with our trusty guide.  Mahoora really need to sort something out with regards to payments and being able to pay with credit card onsite as not everyone will have so much cash on hand (or would like to be travelling around with the cash) and not all will have pre-paid.  It was extremely expensive and hard to justify the luxury label when one can't make a payment with ease.  Overall, great guys and safari.
title: Great Staff and Safari

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your comments on our staff and service. They are glad to see their efforts being appreciated and equally that you had a great stay with us . As you may have experienced we are bordering the national park by a few feet,  Our camp is situated in the eastern border. however travelling to the entrance does take time. There are many village settlements along the border of the park, this is so in most national parks in the island.
Part of your experience is also to see how such villages  exist which most our clients enjoy.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
I spent two nights here during a month long visit to Sri Lanka. My guide, Sangar, was excellent. He was knowledgable, passionate about the animals, spoke English well, and had uncanny critter finding abilities. The safaris in Uda Walawe were everything I could have hoped.

The other staff were very attentive and the food was decent.
