My main complaint is the location. I thought that I would actually be staying IN the park. The camp is a 40 minute drive from the entrance, especially annoying when getting up in time for a dawn game drive. It is located in a scrubby field behind a village, hardly a wilderness experience. 

My tent could also have been in better repair. Some comforts had to be sacrificed by "camping," but there was no need for a tent in that area.There were MANY buildings in which to stay much closer to the action.

Given the bizarre location, I consider it a bit overpriced.
title: Great safari, but way far from the park

ownerResponse/text: Thank you very much for your review and  detailed feedback.We are happy to see your appreciation of the setting and the food. however the comments on improvement is taken note of as keep working towards enhancing our standards.Due to the fact that we have tented camping, our definition of luxury may vary. For tented camping providing running water , for instance flush-able toilet themselves are considered as luxury. Nevertheless your feedback is valuable for our future development.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Staying at Mahoora was a novelty experience which was enjoyable. The service and food was great and the outdoor seating was fantastic. Although the tent was nice, I would not classify it as 'glamping' as there was no amenities such as shampoo etc and the bathroom definitely has room for improvement. This camp is only about 100m off the road, and can hear traffic, however the setting is still lovely. Overall a good place to stay but not if you are after the true luxury glamping experience.
title: Ok but not as good as expected

ownerResponse/text: We thank you for sharing your experience. We are certainly glad to hear that you have enjoyed the service, food and your overall stay with us. We noted the comments about the safari and it seems that what you have anticipated in seeing on the game drive fell short of your expectations, perhaps what you anticipated and what the national park offers is different. Udawalawe national park is more for viewing elephants and birds and not so much for leopard as with other parks. Our campsite is actually located on the border of the park allowing visitors to view many birds that are rare within the premises. We are concerned that you were not completely satisfied with the value proposition, and your comments are taken as feedback for improvements.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you'
text:
We booked one night with two safaris. The tents were very well accommodated but the National Park fell short. A safari is just not a must see when going to Sri Lanka. 
We also found the stay on the expensive side mostly because we were under the impression we would be staying inside of the park or at its borders but not on a random field 40 minutes away. 
The reception and food was nice what is to be expected for the price but they charged us heavily for an Arrack taster. One other thing that bothered us was that the called so many times to confirm the meeting point even a couple hours in advance to make sure we would arrive in time. Even though we were more then punctual.
title: Expensive but nice

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. We are sorry that you felt intruded by our service. We truly apologize. However, we are glad that you enjoyed the accommodation and the safaris. Amindu was thrilled to see your comments. We hope you visit us again!
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed two nights here and were not aware that the site was "off the park". However, facilities on site more than adequate but not luxury ( although we were well warned of this before by our travel agent). Night one bbq excellent but too many staff waiting on meant we felt pressurised to eat. Second night even worse as we were the only people staying and were delivered a seven course meal within forty minutes!! Suggest bbq each night and less "fawning" by staff - it is not needed. Striving for excellence does not mean harrasssing your clients.

However - bring on the safari. Four trips were all excellent and our guide had amazing knowldege of animal and birdlife. Well done Amedu!!!
title: Not quite luxury camping but GREAT safari

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. We are glad that you enjoyed our food, safari and the service. We are sorry for the inconveniences caused by the accommodation. We have taken your feedback into account and improved our services as you can say by the positive reviews.We hope you visit us again!
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent one night here. We enjoyed our stay but were glad that we were only staying one night. The safari was excellent (although the manager of the camp, who was in the same jeep as us, insisted on speaking loudly on his mobile phone while we were watching the elephants). Our naturist was a Spanish intern who was enthusiastic and knowledgeable. 

The camp itself was a disappointment.  We have done luxury camping in Africa and this is nowhere near the same standard. However, I appreciate that if you are used to standard camping this is a definite step up.  More irritating is that the camp is positioned very close to a mosque which ensures a broken night's sleep (and does not tie in with the location we were expecting).

As set out in the previous review (which we wish we'd read before staying) the camp is in a field some distance from the park. The tents are fairly small and the curtains dividing the 'bathroom' from the main tent did not close properly. However,  the beds are comfortable. 

We were told that there was hot water, although this did not appear to be working when we were there.  

On the plus side, the staff were all very friendly and enthusiastic. The bbq in the evening was also very tasty. 

If you are looking for luxury camping near to wildlife, this camp is not for you. However, if you enjoy camping generally this is a step up and the staff will ensure you enjoy your stay.
title: More camping with creature comforts than luxury

ownerResponse/text: We are sorry that you did not like the place. It is a truly a unique place and most of our guest cherish the place so much. We wish you a pleasant holiday in Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Si vous avez des difficultés pour marcher, signalez que vous voulez un bungalow au niveau du restaurant.
text: Nous n’avons pas aimé cet hôtel, trop « tape à l’œil » à notre goût et avec une mentalité coloniale qui nous a fortement déplu lorsque notre chauffeur a dû rester debout et n’a pas reçu le rafraîchissement offert à chaque arrivée.  De plus, comme nous avons écourté notre séjour (déjà payé ), ils n’ont pas voulu déduire le petit déjeuner (que nous ne consommerions pas) du dîner pris la veille. J’ai trouvé cela mesquin et cadrait  bien avec la mentalité vis à vis de notre chauffeur. Salle de restaurant en plein air, donc nous avons eu froid car il pleuvait et il y avait du vent, poutres en ciment imitation bois, petit déjeuner très basique, bref plutôt « esbroufe » que charme. Le personnel est aimable et n’est pas mis en cause, la chambre était propre et la literie confortable.
title: Déçus…..

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Buscar otro hotel en la zona hay mucho
text:
Ubicación única con una vista impresionante, y nada más.
En su pagina web se oto proclama : diseño,  boutique hotel  y lujoso...
Nada de eso
Viejuno, sucio y mal equipado.
Air condicionado sin funcionar, colchón sucio, sin wifi en nuestra habitación, el soporte del televisor no soportaba su propio peso, alfombras de baño con manchas de lejía, accesorios de baño oxidado, teléfono sin funcionar.
Nos cambiaron de habitación y fue más o menos igual.
Comida poca variada.
Nos quedaremos con las vistas.
title: No merece parar se

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
L’hotel comme son nom l’indique est niché sur une coline, et surplombe une sublime vallée. La vue est vraiment époustoufflante. Les chambres, petites maisonettes-ruches, sont jolies (attention pas de séparation reelle entre les WC et la chambre puisque le plafond est commun…).
Le personnel est d’une infinie gentillesse, serviable, assez efficace, aux petits soins. 
Malheureusement le restaurant est vraiment infect. Seuls quelques curry locaux sont mangeables. C’est tellement dommage : cela gache litteralement le sejour.
Les photos du site sont tres trompeuses également : elles donnent une impression d’hotel de luxe alors qu’il s’agit en realite d’un joli lodge sans pretention. 
Le rapport qualite prix n’y est pas.
title: Pas à la hauteur du prix

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your feedback.
We have looked into your concerns. Kindly note that as you are Russian all Russian credit cards are not working in Sri Lanka due to the US sanctions in place. We tried and it failed to go through. This is why we request you to pay in cash. 

On the day you were at the resort there was a major power outage in the area due to heavy rain and extra ordinary heavy wind for more than 24 hours. The resort was running on the backup generator for more than a day continously. The hot water delay issue is caused due to the power outage and the hot water was running on Solar Power. On this particular day it was windly and rainy therefore the delay in the hot water coming to the toilets as they have to come from the solar panels which is also close by. Further the telecom towers that belong to telecommunication companies in the area run out of their backup batteries after 6 hours of continous power failure the wi fi signal also does not work. As the office internet which is connected to a fibre line was working and thats what we provided you. With regards to food we had no traces of food poisoning or compaints from anyone on that particular day. 
We are a resort operating at full capacity on a daily basis and you can see from other reviews that our customers like our food very much just like the resort.

In all the rooms we have kept 2 quilts and as you have requested we have also provided you an additional one.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
Расположение конечно - вау!! Шикарные виды на горы и джунгли. Номер симпатичный, размера на одну ночь хватило. Ужин и завтрак по заказу. Персонал услужливый. На этом хорошее закончилось.
Интернет есть только на ресепшен, в номере даже сеть не показывает
В горах всегда свежо, а одеял в номере нет, мы попросили - нам принесли пледы.
Горячая вода - надо пропускать минут 20, чтобы пошла горячая
И самое огорчительное- на ужин отравилась , с ночи и желудок болел и сопутствующее.
При выезде попросили рассчитаться наличными, при отказе, разные карты и наша Юнион пэй и карта мастер иностранного банка - почему то не прошла! Не так , так эдак получили свои наличные.
Не соответствует цене и качеству
title: Отель в джунглях

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your feedback. We will take some of your points and improve on them.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you have mobility issues I suggest you stay elsewhere
text: When we arrived at this hotel, it was raining heavily and extremely windy. The staff member who greeted us insisted on doing a traditional greeting outside in the weather and made 4 attempts at lighting a match before giving up. We would have preferred to just escape the bad weather by moving inside. This hotel offers beehive shaped cabins which have a nice valley view. The cabin's decor was very garish - black and white fake marble floor, black light fittings and black furniture with navy blue curtains. The room was very dark and gloomy. The bathroom was a good size. It was a long steep walk to the restaurant, which had a single open air sink for the toilets right next to the restaurant tables. The food was only so-so and there wasn't a lot of other eating options in the vicinity. I don't recommend this hotel.
title: This hotel has difficult terrain if you are elderly

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for recommending our resort and great to know that you had a wonderful stay at the resort.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
I bookiied this place after waiting several months due to covid restrictions and lack of vacancies. When i called the place in March 2022, they said no rooms are available. But then i saw a room is available through agoda.com but the room was $202 for bed and breakfast. Even though it seemed like a steep price for just an BnB, i booked the room anyway hoping it will be a beautiful experience. 

Let me tell you, location wise, view wise, i was not dissapointed. It was a marvellous view. The feeling of seeing the great mountains in the lush green and the cool mist when you open your eyes is incomparable. The seclusion, the privacy it provides is beautiful. Service was 
very good, they accomadated to our every need. 

We stayed at the ruby chalet, one of the cheaper options chalet wise. (I was not offered options since i had to grab the last one remaining).  It offers a space for the bed, a bathroom and a patio overlooking the beautiful mountains. If you need a bigger space, you need to book chalets that will be a bit more pricier.

However, i was dissapointed with the breakfast. A very minimal breakfast was offered with a very bland taste pallete. We as Srilankans do expect a better taste and better portions. For the price that was paid, it was not at all meeting expectations. 

Book directly with the hotel. Do not book with the travel sites, as they demand crazy rates and honestly, its not worth the price. The fullboard package if we would have booked directly with the hotel was actually half what we paid for BnB, and a decent price for what is offered. 

I do recommend the place highly though. Especially for honeymoon couples.
title: Beautiful views

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
The views here are absolutely stunning, the owner is clearly very proud of his beehives! When we checked in and were shown to where we were staying he clearly enjoyed pointing out everything to us and loved our reactions to the bathroom especially. 
There are lots of steps (it’s on a mountainside) so not convenient for anybody with mobility issues. The guard assisted us back to our room the first night by torchlight and I’m glad he did as I was almost caught out by a sneaky step up when we reached our hut!
Personally I thought the food could have been better, more options would have been helpful certainly. Service at mealtimes is good, I didn’t enjoy breakfast (sorry) we travelled throughout Sri Lanka during our stay and the food here ranked bottom for both of us. 
The pool was freezing and small and we seemed to be the only guests who used it during our stay. It was also the only place I felt uncomfortable lying in a swimsuit as when the majority (not all) of the male staff passed by they would openly look. I wish I didn’t have to say this but it was how I was made to feel. 
The room itself was very comfortable, I loved our deck at the front and the views as I’ve already said are absolutely breath taking. The shower was amazing, we both loved the rain head. 
We stayed here for 3 nights but I think 2 would have been enough.
title: 3 nights is too long

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
Nice atmosphere, unique design in the rooms (beehives)
Room was small but had all the modern amenities required 
Loved the architectural design of the bathroom 

Food average

Didn't like the concept of  collecting the full payment at the check-in even before stepping into the beehive
title: Unique design of rooms (beehive)

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
Review:

1. Drive to the place- good. Follow the signs not the map 

2. They will take the payment upfront. We asked why.. there has been cases of fraudulent cards and people not paying it seems- weird. New police as per mgt. Never paid ahead in any hotels we stayed during these vacation- The Palmstone Retreat, the Farm Resorts, Queenswood cottage, The Golden Ridge, and even at Cinnamon Wild Yala after Drean Cliff. 

3. Room is so tiny and bed is small for 3 of us. They wana charge 1k for the extra bed. First time that my daughter of 4 yrs old was asked to pay for her extra bed. When we raised it.. theu said they will not charge. But come on.. if we didn't  raise? .. 

4. When u enter the door.. foor or five steps then it is ur bed. Behind the wall is the washroom

5. I didn't like the echo inside the room. Guess it was built like due to it's dome-like design.

6. Water- they have their own spring water as per the pic. But u might not like the taste. Might as well buy one from outside 

7. The scene is great if u r lying down on ur bed and looking outside. But if ur on the veranda.. u will see another hotel. Expectations vs reality. See pic attached

8. We stayed in a cliff like this at Madulkelle eco longer. Their concept is glamping. It was raining and thundering too at the same time.. but I feel like the room had more space to move than this. if it is raining, THEY will call you and ask you to turn off the TV and unplug it.. leaving u with nothing to do but watch the rain. Haha. 

9. Inside the room is warm though it keeps raining. Place is ok for couples who like to stay in the room for themselves. Definitely not for longer stay. One night should be enough, otherwise one might get bored. 🤭

10. Valentines day event was nicely organized and well decorated

11. Furnitures r tastefully designed

12. Food was ok- don't know why some claims it'sgreat?! The steak served to us was burnt. I've tasted better. Farm Resorts food are simply delish!
title: Didn't meet our expectations

ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for your recommendation and review. We hope to see you again at Chaarya resorts!
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived to our accommodation and we were met with lack lustre unfriendly staff 

Then the service was amazing 
Dinner food amazing and the staff were super friendly 
Had a great chat to Mr Operations Manager such a nice guy and so informative 
We had drinks by the pool and the staff fantastic 

This morning Buffett breakfast was an amazing range of food 
And the staff were most from last night and treated us so well 

Come for the food and wine and F and B staff amazing 

Our safari was amazing
title: Sri Lankan Safari

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valuable Guest, 

Thank you for taking the time to express your experience. We are glad that you find our hotel a nice base to explore Yala National Park, with spacious rooms, bar area and massage services to your satisfaction. We are sorry to hear that the dining did not fulfill your expectations, and we have taken note of your remarks on food. Furthermore, we're saddened by the fact that the way we collected feedback during meals interrupted the flow of your experience. Your observations are very important to us, and we will review the way we collect feedback so it can be done in a more considerate and convenient way. Thank you again for your comments, and may we look forward to another occasion to welcome you back to a much seamless stay.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is a good base for exploring Yala National Park. The rooms are spacious, but no frills, and the bathroom could benefit from better lighting. Nice bar area for lounging but pool area was a bit small. I had a massage which was nice and reasonably priced. Breakfast and dinner were not great (desserts were tasty though). 

My one complaint is that during dining service, you are hassled to fill out a survey for feedback. I can appreciate that they want to receive feedback for improvement, but forcing you to fill out the survey while trying to enjoy breakfast or dinner is not the way. I was asked to fill it out during dinner (as I was trying to leave) and then the next morning during breakfast. Overkill.
title: Decent Stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Rachael,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We’re glad you found our staff accommodating and that you enjoyed the bar, pool, and your room’s balcony. It’s great to hear our dinner options met your expectations as well.

We are sorry that some features of your stay, like the bathroom lighting, breakfast offerings, and no umbrellas when it rained, weren't up to your expectations. We'll take note of your feedback on the packed breakfast to help improve the quality for future guests.

Thanks for your feedback! We're going to work on making things better for all our guests. We can't wait to see you again for a much better stay!
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
This was your average typical hotel nothing overly special except for the staff who were very obliging and accommodating. Our room was at the very back of the hotel and there were no umbrellas in our room to walk through the pouring rain to get to the main building. Our room was standard but the bathroom was very gloomy and needed more sufficient lighting. There was a small balcony which was nice to sit out in.
There was a nice bar and a pool room area as well as a pool area. The breakfast food was very average and catered mostly for western tourists. The dinner options were better and the food was good. We took a breakfast box with us when we went on safari and safe to say it was the most awful packed breakfast I’ve ever had.
A good base for Yala but nothing overly special.
title: Suitable for a base to Yala National Park

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
The food for breakfast and dinner was amazing 
The F&B manager took good care of us as we were the only indian family and food were mainly western 
Cant recall his name 
The rooms were so so ...were abit unkempt and smelly 
One of the rooms had coackroach ,the service was good they changed another room for us 
We had 4 rooms in total ,all the rooms had same issue 
The staffs were friendly ,however we didnt have much communication as we had in other hotels
title: Reasonable Stay

ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for your recommendation and review. We hope to see you again at Chaarya resorts!
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book a massage
text: Fabulous massage - best thing about this property. Food variety ok. Rooms tired & need maintenance i.e. ceiling fan & air conditioner rattlers. Couldn’t open the doors that led outside to a small seat area. Pool cloudy & limited sun lounges that are quickly snapped up & reserved. Lovely staff who try their hardest to make a good impression.
title: Great SPA - massage the best

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed 2 nights as part of a Sri Lanka tour.
The hotel is convenient to the game park. The rooms are quite large and well equiped but beginning to show their age. 
When we checked in we found the toilet was broken and asked for it to be repaired. 2 days later nothing had been done. So service is not so good.
We stayed here instead of Jetwing which we had been told would be our hotel. So this is disappointing as Jetwing is on the beach whereas the Chaarya is inland. There are a couple of restaurants nearby but not much else in the local vicinity.
Our booking was for 5 star hotels but unfortunately this place is probably 3 star.
title: Disappointing stay

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Maybe do not order the tuna or chicken sandwiches if getting breakfast to go.
text: It’s a nice enough hotel. A little disappointed with the buffet dinner and take away breakfast. Tuna and chicken sandwiches were not great. The restaurant staff would not let you in after the safari to grab a coffee or get some fresh fruit.  Prices are expensive and i hoped customer service would be a little better for that price.  It was ok. Pool was nice and pool staff lovely. Room was fine, lots of birds singing outside.
title: Expensive for what you get

ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for your recommendation and review. We hope to see you again at Chaarya resorts!
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Su ubicación es ideal para aquellos que planean visitar el Safari Yala. El personal es muy amabilidad y siempre muestran disposición para ayudar.

La comida es variada con platos locales e internacionales.

Las habitaciones son espaciosas y cómodas. 

El hotel tiene piscina aunque nosotros no la utilizamos parecía estar muy bien cuidada.

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Certes les jardins sont beaux.La chambre est correcte, pas de bruit
Par contre la salle de prise du dîner et du petit déjeuner est petite. Nous sommes tombés avec deux grands groupes. C’était très bruyant. Le repas est varié mais pas de grande qualité.

ownerResponse/text: We are sorry to hear about your unpleasant experience and want to thank you for bringing this to our attention. At Chaarya Resort & Spa, we take pride in providing a safe and comfortable atmosphere for all our guests. We are glad that management was able to address your concern promptly and ensure appropriate actions were taken. Your feedback is invaluable to us and we will continue striving towards creating a better experience for all our guests.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed one night at Chaarya Resort and spa. The room was spacious, clean, and tastefully decorated with a private balcony that overlooked the other hotel buildings. Chaarya had a pool you can take refreshing dips in, a spa facility to treat yourself, a bar to grab drinks, and a restaurant with delicious food. 

I did encounter an issue with one of the staff members at the spa during my stay. While most of the team members were friendly and accommodating, there was a man who was extremely inappropriate during my treatment that made me unbelievably upset. Management of Chaarya Resort & Spa addressed my concern and ensured that actions were taken. Ladies, if you’re going to get a spa treatment, request a woman in case Dulop is still working there. 

Despite what happened to me, it is important to mention that this hotel is overall good offering a relaxing ambiance and well-appointed accommodations.
title: Scenic escape with one setback

ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for your  review. We hope to see you again at Chaarya resorts!
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try to Stay Closer to Yala
text: We stayed for 1 Nights, as were keen to experience the Yala Safari, The Rooms were quite hot and there is a menace of mosquitos throughout the hotel, swimming pool and rooms, as there were less number of people in the hotel we were served Ala carte food, it was decent.
title: For 1 Night its a decent accommodation

Thank you so much for the great review and it really motivates us and all the areas you have mentioned to improve. We will take it to our serious attention and will do the needful to rectify the issues.

Chaarya Team.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We went as a family. The location was just good and it is adjourning to the main road. Overall experience was average but it has some potential.

Specially the staff was really helpful and friendly. Hotel has arrange small animator program for kids even during heavy rains and it was appreciated. 

During our stay it had a rain and found some areas were full of water but no harm to guests. 

Deluxe Rooms were bit smaller but nice and clean. Hotel has a nice greenery Garden  and well maintained. Swimming Pool was really small. 

The Food was average specially no major variety for Lunch and Breakfast buffet. Dinner buffet was little bit ok. Mostly focused on Srilankan style of dishes and no western dishes.
E.g. Salad corner was just a couple of dishes not cold meat etc.. Breakfast doesn't contain Cheese omelet, Quality sausages , Bacon etc...
title: Convenient Hotel in Tissamaharama

Dear Madam, 

Thank you for your review and it motivates our staff. 

As you have mentioned the hotel is rundown we will take it to our serious consideration since we are practicing on restoring and repairing the hotel on daily basis. 

Thank you once again for your kind review and it really helps us to improve our services. 

Thanking you, 

Team Chaarya
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel staff are very polite and gave a warm welcome. The hotel itself is run down, our shower leaked and the bed was uncomfortable. The restaurant buffet was crammed with people and very little tables. This hotel is about a 30 minute drive from Yala National Park.

We stayed here for 1 night as part of a tour around Sri Lanka, we would not have wanted to stay anymore nights. The hotel also feels very small which is not my preference. 

Air con worked well in the room. Note that the plug sockets are the Sri Lankan sockets so you need an adapter. Our safe worked eventually but for a while we could not get it to open again. 

There is a hairdryer in the room also.
title: Trip to Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here after travelling a number of hours from Kandy..
We were going to visit YALA wildlife park thatvis aprox 30mins away from the establishment..
On arrival the reception staff were polite and curtious..
Check in was smooth..

Room was on 2nd floor ( 154) of one of the dwellings..
So in the heat , the steps up was hard work..
The room was clean and spacious. 
Plenty of space for luggage and clothes if staying for a few days..

Asked for drinks menu when we were in the restaurant, and staff member stated I can tell you what we have..
And he gave a list of drinks available..?
But for me, the way this was conveyed to us was very unprofessional and borderline rude to be honest..
So we then asked" do you have
 wine..?"
Reply was " glass ir bottle?. "
No sir or madam ..
Never experienced this mannerism before in all our years of travelling..
My wife asked for some soda water, which turned uo with top off, generally restaurant staff in other establishments open a bottle infront of you..
Well..that bottle of soda was totally flat..and bottle top , bad a chip in the glass...
Seriously not good in my opinion..
Now, we go to get some food, that was a buffet style offering, and staff member stands there with 3 bottles of wine to choose from will trying to decide on what food to eat...
Staff really do require training in restaurant etiquette in my opinion..

The swimming pool is a nice size and very clean..

Now, here's one truly genuine good point..
We absolutely enjoyed our spa treatment while staying here...
Can't fault the staff in this part of the hotel.
The Barman in the area just down from pool area was also very good at his job.
And very attentive..
Perhaps these members of staff have had previous experience in customer service..
So a very well done too them..

Breakfast..
No orange juice was available..
And no infused water..
Which is generally normally a must in any hotel in my opinion. 
Never experienced this before on.our travels around the world...
Breakfast itself was a basic buffet type..

During Breakfast we were handed a customer feedback form..
Why then?
Why not leave form in room so you can chat about your experience together and leave form at reception when leaving..?

Because of the spa staff and the barman I have mentioned, this is why I have given a 3..
Otherwise it would have been a 2..

The downstair rooms had water ponds infront of them, this water was stagnant and flies / mosquitos were many..
Why not change or filter this water..?

So for the reasons I have written here, I'm sorry, not only would I NOT stay here again , I couldn't recommend it..
This is my personal experience..
title: Staff require training..

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
For positives;

Nice location to stay while visiting the national parks. 
Beautiful, modern decorated villas set in garden of palm trees. 
Housekeeping stuff are doing an amazing job. Our room was very clean and had a small outdoor patio area which was amazing to chill out there with the bird voices at night.
There’s a heated pool, gym, spa facilities, games room, a nice bar as well. (As a short info; when it’s full moon they don’t serve alcoholic beverages according to the tradition.)

For negatives;

A large resort with poor food. Dried up steak, cold fries and breakfast wasn’t the best either. We recommend to eat at the restaurants next to the resort. 
I’d recommend to make an advanced payment for the safari tours at the front desk before it starts. Otherwise tour guys will ask for more money then what was quoted originally which was the thing that we’ve experienced. We’ve been told that we didn’t pay it at all even though we paid for it with a tip as well. It was the most uncomfortable experience! Trying to communicate with front desk with a language barrier is another challenge if you have an issue. 
Also reception staff had some attitude regarding our requests which wasn’t courteous! 

Nevertheless it was a good stay while visiting Tissamaharama. 

Here’s a couple of recommended places;
*Kirinda beach
*Elephant transit home
*Udawalawe national park safari 
*Yala national park (recommend a half day tour) it’s about half hour drive away.
title: It was a nice stay while traveling to Kataragama.

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Chalets are good and spacious
text:
We stayed in this resort on the Poya day in July...Constantly kept in touch with Mr Susantha who handled our booking well.Got a bit late to give our rooms but it was crowded the previous day so not a huge issue.
The resort is well Maintained and has some open spaces to walk around with a spacious pool.
Meals were decent apart from the breakfast buffet which was very disappointing.When it's a 4 star resort,you'd expect a bit more than bread,String hoppers and Kiribath with accompaniments, which we usually have at home too. No continental/Western Options,which was a major Failure and I spoke to the staff about it to convey my displeasure. 
The restaurant was very warm during the lunch service as only 1 out of the 4 AC's were switched on.Made our kids very uncomfortable.

All in all it was a decent stay with a few downfalls
title: Good Place to stay...Disappointing breakfast

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text: We had two nights here as we wanted to be relatively close by to Yala National park (which I think most of the guests who stay here are doing), it’s about half hour drive away. We only had lunch here, we grabbed a tuk tuk (that the hotel arranged for us) to go out for dinner just up the road, there isn’t many places to eat and no bars (much like the rest of Sri Lanka really in terms of no bars). Our room was spacious, clean and did the job as it was only somewhere to rest our head! Drinks here were more on the ‘pricier’ side compared to the rest of Sri Lanka but then again it is hotel prices! Good base for Yala.
title: Not AS good as the photos!

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Nice villas in a lush vegetation, spacious rooms and bathrooms. Hotel has come into his years. Dinner was nothing special. Staff was nice and friendly but you can see the lack of good organization and a good management. I want recommend my friends.
title: It could be better

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel looks beautiful but it has some major problems. I was travelling with my parents on a tour of Sri Lanka to go to Yala National Park which is only ~30 minutes away. 
We arrived at ~17:00 to find the room not ready which isn't unusual and we were offered a free drink in compensation. However when we were in the ar different people where told different things were available. A later event for the group was also badly handled with people being told different times. Multiple times during the stay too many problems were created by lousy commication. 
The local food was cooked well and often excellent (Live stations) but softened for Western tastes which isn't unusual. However the Western options had some major problems as they had a habit of undercooking pasta and using cheese slices for lasagne or moussaka. 
The rooms were good with air conditioning in the bedroom but not the bathroom. An interesting quirk was that there was a step in the bedroom and bathroom. So getting to the toilet in the middle of the night could be interesting.
I wouldn't stay here again
title: Communication!!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: King Coco has a sea view
text:
Coco Tangalla is a 5 minute walk from the fairly shabby centre of Tangalle.  It's located on a busy road, but once inside the grounds are nice and the sound of wind and waves masks much of the road noise.  Fairly often sounds of barking dogs from the neighbours and strays on the street.  There's a pool and pleasant sea view.

We stayed in King Coco which I understand to be their best room, with a sea view.  It's a big room, beach feel- bit shabby style.  There's Air Con, although it dripped onto the floor and wet our cases.  The bathroom has a palm tree growing through it and as part of the design, has an open roof above the shower.  This means that insects can get into the room and makes the bathroom fairly hot.  There's no tea or coffee in the room.  Free WiFi.

The breakfast was very good, and the staff friendly.
title: Beach feel - shabby style

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: My fellow reviewers are very positive about cocotangalle. I can understand why. Staff is very nice. Food is fine. Views are nice and the hotel is clean. But then again. Most 4 or 5 star hotels have excellent staff and superb views. At cocotangalla the rooms (we had) where small and dark. The showerhead to low to stand beneath. The mirror at belly hight. The pool is tiny. Small inconvenciences i must admit, but Sri Lanka offers better places.
title: Nice but nothing special

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid Palmyrah, trey to get King Coco.
text:
First off, let me say that we enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and forthcoming, the location including the pool and the terrace were amazing and the food was excellent. Although it is quite a walk until you reach a beach near which you can swim, the pool with the beautiful ocean view compensates for that.

However, in contrast to the high praises on tripadvisor which I have based my reservation upon, the room did not at all live up to my expectations. The "Palmyrah Room" we had booked was very small (almost completely taken up by the bed) and greatly overpriced over the Christmas break. There was one meager chair in the room, nothing to put your bags on, and truthfully, there would not have been enough space for it either...

In the end, we had a good time - however, travelers should not expect luxurious rooms, unless they book "King Coco".
title: Brilliant settings, tiny room...

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your review,staying at Coco Tangalla and your positive comments.We are sorry you could not get totally comfortable.

It may be worth pointing out the showers are open to give a feeling of space,and with regard to your comment about one of the bathrooms being outdoors - yes,although partially covered,it's intentionally designed outside as is quite common in warm counties in Asia and elsewhere,and many people have enjoyed that experience.We are sorry one of your party tripped,and it should be explained that all but one of the rooms have no steps between the bathroom and bedroom,the house is built on the same level but there are steps to the verandah,and down to the pool area and garden but it's never been a complaint before...nor have mosquitoes to the degree you explain,as long as taken in the context that there will always be some in tropical countries - there are mosquito nets in all bedrooms,and as you say we do take as many further precautions as we can.For vegetarians,we are used to offering various options beyond sri lankan food,but most of our guests choose to have local dishes.

Again thank you for staying and hope you at least enjoyed the ambience of outdoor spaces,staff service and style of the property
placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Ask for one of the bigger rooms facing the ocean. All of the other rooms are small and quite dark. 
I would not recommend this hotel for older people with vision/mobility limitations - lots of steps and uneven floors that can make it difficult to move around the hotel.
text:
The house and the setting are just lovely. The rooms are beautifully appointed, and the breezy outdoor dining and lounging areas really quite inviting. It's the perfect place for a relaxing getaway from Colombo. The staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful. There is nothing they cannot do for you!

We did not find the rooms comfortable, however. Except for the two biggest rooms, all of the others are a bit dingy and dark. The beds are okay, but not terribly comfortable. One of the rooms has a bathroom that is completely outdoors. There are a lot of steps here and there, which make it a nightmare when it's dark and/or you cannot see very well. An older person in our party actually had a fall going to the bathroom in the night! Mosquitos are a major problem at this hotel. The staff light citronella lamps in the nights and put out mosquito nets. But, during the day, you're constantly swatting mosquitos all around you in the rooms. The bathrooms all have baths fitted with showers, but no shower curtains. So, when our showers were done, the bathroom floor was completely wet and slippery. 

The food options are a little limited - for instance, if you're vegetarian, you're pretty much stuck with curries with rice or string hoppers.
title: Has style, but could be improved

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We always stay in villas in Sri Lanka as we like our privacy - mainly at Taru Villas when managed by herself as the standard were very high - the best. 

We have just left Taru Villas , Mawella (Karumba) , after a three night stay . We have  been there few times before . It is sad to see standards drop in so many areas but specifically maintenance of the place and it is less clean , eg furniture and walls marked . One side of the bed had no electrical power , one safe didn’t work , no fan in the gazebo so hot to use . Cockroaches in the bedroom .  Staff needs more training. 

The service from our butler (Ruwan) was excellent, and the cuisine was well presented and enjoyable . 

Cant see us returning unless standards  get back to where they used to be .
title: Standard dropped

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Please ensure that all the faciliies are avaialble before you check-in
text:
Hunas Falls Hotel definitely has seen better times since the good old days when this hotel was much sort after. The hotel seems not to have upgraded itself to suit the present times. What a pity that the past hotel mangement of repute had given this hotel stepmotherly treatment. Ofcourse, it goes without saying thatt there is tremnedous potentila to build this hotel into one of the best of its kind and we were informed that a new management is all set to refurbish the hotel to bring back its appeal. The setting is still fabulous and the Kasturi suite we got was very comfortable and spacious. However, there was a shortage of hot water in the hotel and we had to make a special requet whenever we nedded hot water in the bathroom. This was the biggest drawback for a hotel of this calibre.

However, we enjoyed the stay, the food and the fabulous environment surrounding the hotel. I hope that this hotel will be refurbished soon and brought back to its past glory very soon!
title: Badly needs a facelift

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text: We have been to the place years back and not much difference made. It was a nice and comfy experience. Beautiful place and environment just to relax and unwind. Though the rate is very costly buffet was not worth it. Very limited number of food offered. It was not fair by the customer as we pay a lot to stay there. Staff was quite friendly. Lovely experience.
title: Beautiful nature and peacefulness

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text: The Hotel is situated in such a beautiful location. The staff were very good with Wasantha, Disna, Goonesekera and Sathsara being exceptional. The new GM Mr. Haleem Lye seems a very dynamic and energetic person. However much needs to be done to improve its facilities. The Shaheen trail is now overgrown .Worn out carpets, threadbare towels, minimum garden lights, hotwater at selected times and even though the ala carte menu was good ,the buffet (when provided) lacked variety making the hotel falling far short of its former splendour which we have enjoyed for the last 30 years. There is talk of a major refurbishment. Whatever the refurbishment one can only hope that there would be continuous investment in the hotel and staff to maintain high quality. This hotel has so much Potential. We wish the Hotel management well in its future endavours.
title: Excellent Staff but......

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Hunnas Falls

Location: Beautiful, absolutely stunning view from the room, the pool feel like you are on top of the world. The room layout is nice, you do get the feeling that this is an older hotel but that adds to the class.

Service: The servers, bellmen were very friendly and helpful. The management, not so much, they seemed rude at times and too hung-up on the hotel polices on minor issues instead of keeping the customer happy. When asked if buy-3 beers get a pool game free (Rs200 value) can be started at bar and transferred to the pub they made a big fuss about it. Was finally allowed when I said I will not be getting any beers if not.
On second day of stay room was not made and supplies (tea/coffee) were not restocked. The fruits in the room were old and stale.

Food: Not good, seemed like they were always serving left over food from the previous day. The selection of food was limited and was not very well made, I usually like soups but 3 of 4 times I send back the soup I severed. The action station was was good but overcrowded most of the time.

Actives: They have a fair selection
Swimming pool : Good, nice location but closes at 6pm
Biking: (additional cost) Bikes not maintained, only allowed within hotel premises which is only about a 500m stretch. It made me laugh when I was planning on a adventurous bike ride but was tuned back at front gate.
Boat ride (additional cost) again its like riding a boat in a puddle of water.
Hike:

Upper Hunnas falls: nice 15 walk up to the falls, where you can take a dip at the base of the falls. *there are leaches

Hunnas peak: A good 1:15Hr hike to the peak of the mountain, bit steep at some places but quite manageable. the view from the top is fabulous. The only suggestion the trail should be marked by the hotel as they promote it as one of their activities, there weer no signs at all and we made many wrong turns on the way there and back.

All in all its and nice old hotel, we enjoyed our stay. The food and the services could definitely improve and not at the level of the value of money. I will probably go again if I get a discount rate.
title: Beautiful location average service and food

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed a night at Hunas falls hotel on the 6th of Sept.  Check in and check out was very fast.  Friendly staff especially the guy who handled our luggage.  Sorry couldn't get his name.  Spectacular views with a perfectly maintained garden.
I felt that something was missing for the price we paid.  When compared with the hotels of the same price range, the rooms and the washrooms aren't up to that standard.
Food was good but not exceptional. The recipe of the tempura batter needs to be changed ASAP. It wasn't tempura.  Had a good spread for breakfast.
title: Perfectly maintained gardens

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you get a room in level 1 you can walk on to the garden
text:
This is our 2nd visit and with a good stay the last time around, we had higher expectations after getting to know about the upgrade the property has done (a few years back) and was expecting a total 5 star experience. This stay taught me a few lessons about the hotel industry and about Amaya chain in particular. Rule No1: Hotel website may not give you the cheapest rate and their "best available rate" is not their best available rate. I was confused to a point that I thought that Amaya marketing was cheating, but it seems I am not able to use that term technically. Even when you call, you do not get the "best available rate" but rather the highest rate they can charge :D. We have not faced this kind of situations with other hotel chains and so we were upset (from a locals point of view) and they still have this old process of booking (card offers for locals) where they tell you to send photo copies of your ID and Credit Card over email - rather than providing us with a custom booking link to book over the internet using their reservations engine.

When we checked in there was a mistake done by Amaya corporate and it had been 2 doubles rather than the triple and double we required. The front desk tried to trick us by giving a double with an extra bed rather than a triple room (triple is twice the size of a double). Had to talk a couple of times before they realized we knew what a triple room is and got us shifted to one. I did not get my welcome drink as well, I am not fuzzy but when you call yourself a luxury hotel, you cannot miss something like that (i came a bit later than the other as I went to park the vehicle and my told them I did not get the drink but still they did not take note).

Then entire hotel is in a somewhat a dilapidated state. We could not understand what upgrade this property has gone through as it seems to have rather got downgraded. Things were imperfect everywhere (I am not trying to be a perfectionist,client but when a hotel charges you at a 5 star rate and is labelled as a luxury hotel, how can one be happy when you are presented with a 3 star quality?). However looking at the endless positive feedback on trip advisor and the great positive comments on the guest book, I am now wondering whether I am in fact fuzzy guest or if the majority of the visitors had been very easy to please.

There was a spelling mistakes in the key card (shorts were shots) & a grammatical mistake (photo uploaded). If they do not proof read the key card and if none of the officers in that hotel picks that up, you can imagine what sort of sloppy quality management the hotel goes through.

Food is quite average, range is not much and the deserts are a few. I suppose since there are not many guests the hotel can accommodate thus we can justify the lack in the range but they need to make it up with quality. Fruits did not look fresh and I saw bananas which had black patches.

Most people visit a hotel in a secluded place like this is to relax and stay in the hotel. So it is important that they have some activities available. Strangely they charge for using the tennis court from full board guests. Charging for mini-golf is acceptable. The games room is in bad shape as well. Did not see a Spa or Gym (maybe they have but we did not come across). There was a good large flat TV but unfortunately just 10 channels and most of them were not clear.

We were on a triple room but everything was in twos (towels, glasses etc). I am not sure if this is the norm but thinking logically it does not seem correct.

The shower handle in our room did not work properly. The lever returns normal after some time cutting off the water to the shower. So had to hold on to the lever whilst bathing.. Some luxury experience we were having :D.

Did not find the pool very clean either and they close it early around 6). The unisex pool changing room is like a public toilet. Shocking.!!!

This hotel is one of a kind. I doubt if there is another one similar to this in Sri Lanka and which is the reason we want to come back and show it off to our family who did not come last time However we could see that it was not so from the road itself before entering the property. It is understandable the grass may not be so green with the high heat these days but still badly trimmed plants and gardening cannot be excused as this is the key marketing point of the hotel.

The questions I have after visiting Hunnas
1. Is this an actual Small Luxury hotel or are they using an old expired title to market the place.
2. If this is in fact a SLH, is this a title that a hotel can buy without meeting standards?
3. How come this property is so highly recommended by visitors? I too will highly recommend this if this was a 3 star hotel.

I got to know that Amaya is going to be change management. Perhaps this is the reason for the lack of motivation of the staff to excel. Lets hope things will improve with the new management.

Notes to Management:
If you want to be a SLH you need to do the following:
- Greet the guests at the entrance (you can easily do that as your security at the gate checks guests in) and provide a scented tissue and not forgetting to give a welcome drink to everyone.
- Get valet parking
- Get New carpeting / curtains / bed linen (some were torn)
- Make sure the showers / toilets work
- Get some good cable channels (which shows clearly)
- Break down  the pool changing room, it’s a disgrace
- Spell check your literature 
- Train your staff and you can stand out if your staff at the reception and head at the reception knows the clients by name (since it’s a small place)
- Make sure someone is always there to answer when a guest dials the reception.
- Implement a key card system (doors)
- Do not try to cheat the guests
- Keep a guest feedback survey brochure in the room or get the front desk to check on guest experience and mitigate any negativity before it goes out of hand. That way you may be able to avoid this type of embarrassing reviews going up on trip advisor as well.
title: 3 Star Luxury Hotel at a 5 star Price

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
The road leading the hotel is small and is in terrible condition, since the hotel is located at a high position it is quite hazardous and frightening. The hotel has been around for a long time and I wish they would have given an effort to repair the roads or maybe even inform the road authorities about it.
I must say the location is fantastic, no other place I’ve been has been this stunning and relaxing. It seems the hotel has ben refurbished couple of years ago and is maintained well especially the outside surroundings considering the harsh climate conditions.
We booked 2 rooms about 3 months ago and they managed to give 2 rooms further away when we requested 2 rooms next to each other. It’s a busy hotel, it can be excused I guess.
Our room smelled bad when we went in and it seemed it was coming from the chairs. I understand that it rains a lot in that area and guests may leave wet jackets and clothes on the chairs, but the hotel must make sure extra care is taken to make sure the accommodation is comforting. 
Dinner was exceptional, lots of variety and the food was tasty however I which I could say the same about the breakfast. The chef kept getting my food orders wrong and food would almost never arrive to my table when they said they would deliver to my table.
It is hotel standard to be able to call from one room to another, we tried to do that, but it keeps going to the receptionist, who might I say picked up the calls rarely.
I sense the problem is the staff is too less for a hotel which is very busy.
Overall Hunas is a very reputed hotel and may be overrated sometimes, nevertheless it is a must visit since there lots of activities to do and i recommend staying at least 2 nights to fully enjoy the surrounding nature (also since it rains a lot so you may need 2 nights to do that.
title: Expected more

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Firstly, the hotel is set HIGH up a very long mountain road (142 bends....!) and although the views would have been wonderful, it rained solidly for 2 days, so we really couldn't see them, which was very disappointing. Secondly, the rain brought out LEECHES - everywhere you went- be aware.....they don't tell you that on the website!
The hotel itself whilst looking dated from the outside is well furnished (though dark) and the standard of food & service was high. Our biggest disappointment was that when it rained there was nothing to do, and any excursion involved a very long reverse trek down the windy road. 
That said, the Hunas Falls themselves were stunning - and I guess when the sun shines you would have a very different appreciation of the place.
title: Disappointed

Hunas Falls by Amaya is the perfect getaway for a tired traveler for a relaxing experience in serene and tranquil surroundings and we are delighted that you enjoyed a comfortable and pleasant stay.  Your comment regarding the breakfast and dinner buffets is duly noted and has been brought to the notice of the relevant managers who are taking necessary steps to address your concerns.

Thank you for your valued patronage. We look forward to welcoming you back to Amaya Resorts and Spas!

Warmest Regards,

Sheahana Wickramasinghe
Customer Relationship Manager
Amaya Resorts and Spas
placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is beautiful and peaceful but very remote and not convenient for sightseeing.  If you are travelling to Sri Lanka to get away from the world, this is the place.  The service was pleasant and attentive.  The breakfast and dinner buffets were extensive although only of average quality.
title: Beautiful but isolated

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Best view and double bed rooms than two single bed rooms
text: It is a nice palce to visit and food was good with less guests. Room cleanliness and quality is good. TOOTHBRUSHES and SHAVING KIT was not provided, I had to ask it.I feel they have to think more to improve the quality and create more friendly and supportive environment to give best than on request ot the guest. With their experience they should know what are customer expectations.
title: Below the value for money with current rate

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The higher floors have better views
text: Firstly, a note of caution. This hotel is above in the hills close to Kandy and it takes a minimum of an hour to reach the main town. If, you want to get away from the daily grind and want to be one with nature, this is the hotel you should go to. The trails in and around the hotel will make you feel as if you have no contact with civilization and it is very peaceful. The views from the hotel are just too beautiful to be true. The hotel also has people who can take you to the Upper Hunas falls and the Hunas falls. They also have a naturalist (very interesting) who can take you bird watching or trekking to the highest hill close to the hotel. However, this requires advance trekking and climbing skills. Be prepared. That said, there is a decent running trail (about 600 mts) all around the lake and a small well-maintained golf course. The hotel interiors need to be modernized. The wifi sucks. We felt that the hotel should have a shop selling basic amenities, since it is so far away from town. The breakfasts are very enjoyable, even though the staff is very proprietary about the tables on the verandah outside and keep them reserved for honeymooners only. We felt this was absurd. We enjoyed the lovely freshly cut fruit, hoppers and the other breakfast buffet items. The other meals we had were ok. We weren't impressed overly and the structure of the menu was focused around middle eastern guests. So, be prepared for a very small a la carte dinner and lunch menu. This said, it is a great getaway.
title: Location is beautiful but ONLY if you want to get away from it all

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Andrea,

We're sorry that it didn't live up to expectation for you, and that the cocktails perhaps weren't what you anticipated; we do try hard to incorporate local flavours and local ingredients, which may not have been what you were expecting.  Live entertainment is on Saturday evenings, rather than a daily event, as we don't want to overwhelm those who come in.  Our food menu is a modern take on traditional Sri Lankan dishes, and we think delicious, but everyone is free to choose what suits them best.  Perhaps on a return visit to Sri Lanka and to Galle, you will honour us by tucking into one of them?

The lobby looks interesting and they have a pool inside.

ownerResponse/text:
Warmest greetings from Galle Fort Hotel.Thank You very much for your stay with us and we are especially grateful to you for having taken the time to send us your feedback. 

I am sorry that your stay was not as you expected it to be, but I must assure you that we take all feedback positively and have taken steps to remedy all the areas of complaint in the Suite you stayed in. The creaking floorboards especially will be given priority.

I can also assure you that we have taken measures to ensure that there will be no lapses in service and we do hope you will consider staying with us again on your next visit to Galle.

Yours Sincerely,

Dasun Gunawardhana,
Resident Manager.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay next door
text:
We had booked the Terrace Suite at Galle Fort Hotel as part of our trip around Sri Lanka in June and unfortunately it was one of the most disappointing parts of our trip.

On a positive note, the hotel is in a great location in the centre of Galle Fort meaning that pretty much everything in Galle Fort is a few minutes walk away.

Upon arrival, we were ushered into the entrance lounge area of the hotel when we arrived to check-in and were then shown to our room which was on the ground floor near the main restaurant area.  The room is split over 2 levels with downstairs being the lounge area and bathroom a mezzanine floor to the upstairs bedroom.

While I understand the charm of this being an old hotel, it is on desperate need of some modernisation to make it liveable.  Every movement that ANY GUEST in our side of the hotel made resulted in floor boards squeaking (and every floorboard squeaks) which resulted in very little sleep over our 3 night stay.  The furniture in the rooms is perfectly in-keeping with the look and style but is not functional with no real wardrobe space, barely a sofa etc. and possibly the flattest pillows I have ever seen. There are no curtains in the room (and neither the doors nor windows shut properly) resulting in being woken up at sunrise and the added 'delight' of an extra dining table being positioned right outside our room door meant we were awoken each morning with the chaos of the team cleaning the dining and pool area and setting up for breakfast.

We went for breakfast on our first morning however were really disappointed with the temperature of the food we were served so didn't have breakfast in the hotel again.  The bar in the hotel is very impressive however service was slow (we gave up on our 2nd night even trying to find a staff member for a drink!)  

I'm not sure I would return to Galle as there really isn't a lot to see or do, but if I did I would probably stay next door at Fort Bazaar instead!
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr.Guilford,

Ayubowan!

Thank you for your review and observations about the hotel. I am confident going forward the hotel will improve greatly in mentioned areas. The hotel is committed to improving skills training and job knowledge which will address any service efficiencies. We will value your comment about the live music and we will take the necessary steps to select suitable entertainment for the hotel. 

We will look forward to welcoming you.

Regards,

Chamara Dedduwage  

Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel lives up to its reputation as a stylish colonial-style building in an historical setting, but the service does not always match the high price of the rooms. Staff were always friendly, if a little obsequious at times, but not very organised or joined up. The restaurant dinners and breakfasts were fine and the atmosphere pleasant by and large, although the live music was a definite negative.
title: Galle Fort Hotel

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Expect slow service when you have 8 or more guests at the table.  We had Sri Lankan food which was fairly good.  We had asked for a baked crab appetizer and this seemed beyond the kitchen’s capabilities — they served it after we had finished our meal.  The lady manager was very helpful, recommending a hotel nearby which is more accessible for elderly visitors.  Still I wonder at the US$600 per night price.  The location is good, the premises well maintained, the service is slow, the food is average.  This seems to be the story of Galle Fort hotels now, overpriced compared to excellent hotels at a similar price point in the rest of Sri Lanka and even globally.
title: Average service

,

text: We have stayed on multiple occasions at this hotel, and sadly i have noticed standards slipping every time. This last visit we stayed in the library suite, which is great for a small family. The food we also noticed was disappointing, and breakfast quite average. fortunately we were only staying one night, but i feel that management is not on top of things. It is a pleasure to hear from you again and your feedback and comments are most welcome. As you pointed out we are most fortunate to be located in the middle of the Fort , it is a great place to spend your stay.too

The Grand Apartment occupies the entire top floor of the old wing and has two king-sized bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms and a private veranda. I do apologies for that but am also pleased to report it has been rectified and the Point you have brought out is which we have been working on already ,  to get the carpet and the sofa covers to be replaced i will personally  assure and guarantee by January all of this will be change and i will for sure will keep in touch with you by email. placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
According to locals, before it was sold to the current owners, this was a first class hotel. There is no doubt it could be again. However, in spite of some of the surprisingly positive reviews here on Trip Advisor, it most certainly isn’t now. 
The raw material is there. Excellent location, lovely historic building, impressive common areas, lovely courtyard for meals and, last but not least, excellent friendly service. BUT....
...as several reviewers have mentioned, the rooms desperately need some TLC and money spending on them and the kitchen needs an overhaul. 
First the room. Again the raw material is there in terms of construct, but badly stained chair covers, frayed and dirty carpet, slightly leaking roof, smell of drains,  rickety cupboards, dimmer not working, etc, all demand renovations, which the helpful manager admitted were being undertaken in the next few months. Too late for me! 
Now to the food. As has also been mentioned elsewhere, and on the basis of one meal only (stayed for 5 nights but only ate there on the first), the dinner standard is well below other restaurants in Galle (eg curry served cold is not an appetising prospect), for example the excellent Fort Printers down the road. Breakfasts are below average compared to the 4 other hotels of similar rating that I stayed in. As an example, a tiny bowl of what they called muesli contained mainly bran and corn flakes. However, these are minor matters compared to the rooms. 
Such a pity. Galling in fact...
title: Galling....

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Stuart G

Thank you for bringing these problems forward. I do apologies that you had to wait for your dessert for so long, and that your food was cold when delivered to your table. We have no excuse for either incident however, and I do apologize for this once again. We have in fact taken steps to re look at our processes to ensure consistency along with making sure the Kitchen sends out all food at the correct temperature.

With regard to the cocktails that the "staff did not know", I'd like to place on record that the Food and Beverage manager personally took charge of the order given that there seemed to be some confusion as to the name of cocktail you wanted. Nevertheless I believe all was sorted soon after, when the Manager explained the situation to you and offered you alternative drinks, which you had two rounds of before dinner. 

With regard to the lighting in the room, please be assured that we will be looking to refurbish our rooms in the near future, which will cover all aspects of guest convenience and comfort.

Thank you once again for sharing your experience with us, and we look forward to welcoming you back to The Galle Fort Hotel.

Best regards 
Dennam Spittel
Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel claims to be five-star but on our one-night stay experience (we paid for two but left mid-afternoon day two to go to the airport) it certainly is not.  We had stayed in some genuine top-class places by international standards during our time in Sri Lanka and it paled in comparison to them.  
True, the building, a former merchant’s house, is a bit of Galle history and its public rooms have a colonial style but our ground-floor poolside room needed a bit of tlc, particularly the bathroom.  
•	The bathroom was ill-lit, making a wet shave a hazardous experience.
•	The bed-sitting room was a decent size but there was no bedside light on one side of the bed so I could not read in bed without using my cell phone’s flashlight.
•	No one thought to tell us there were outside shutters on the upper part of the large windows, nor close them for us, so people on the upper floor opposite could see into our bathroom when we were getting ready for dinner.
•	Dinner itself, enjoyed overlooking the pool, has had criticism in the past and we had the same issues – food arrived lukewarm and our dessert (a simple plate of tropical fruit) was forgotten altogether. We had to go in search of a waiter to get it.
•	The barman did not seem to have heard of a gin martini (or they didn’t have vermouth, I am not sure which) so we had to settle for something else pre-dinner.
•	The hotel has a terrace open to the road at the front and a happy hour. We had arrived early afternoon and there was what appeared a back-packer group having a lovely, and noisy, time over a few beers as we walked in. Galle Fort town has a definite back-packer feel to it generally.
All in all a disappointingly average experience for our last night in the country.
title: A disappointing end to a wonderful visit to Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Booked the hotel through Trivago, via Booking dot com. Was recommended this hotel as the best hotel in Galle. Booked the Grand Apartment 1. Which is the highest catagory the hotel offers. Checked in and all went well. Then I went to our room only to explain that whilst I had booked a suite, the sitting room of the suite is shared with other guests using the other half of the suite - totally bizarre and mind blowing. Of course no privercy.  Bitterly disappointed by the way the hotel thought this to be quite normal. 

Massive bathroom but no bathtub - this is supposed to be a luxury suite. 

Food is good at the hotel but the service dreadfully slow. Maybe Sri Lanka moves at a slow pace, and maybe I should be more tolerant. I was on vacation after all. Nice to relax and common areas are well kept. 

Avoid booking the Grand Apartment unless your seriously into making friends with your neighbours.
title: Avoid the Grand Apartment

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Bang in the middle of Galle Fort, this is a beautiful old building with a delightful internal courtyard with swimming pool.  The public rooms, verandas etc are perfection and the rooms could be too if a little more care was taken with them.  The lighting, for example, in our garden room was appalling, not helped by some of them just not working.  The shower and WC areas were showing signs of mould and the WC itself didn't work.  Three visits from the maintenance guy didn't solve the problem (the whole internal mechanism needed replacing) and I didn't call housekeeping again as we could make it work by leaving the lid off the cistern.  Every day  housekeeping duly put the lid back on, (Instead of bothering to replenish the tea, coffee etc)!
The wifi was infuriating until one of our party, who had to deal with some business problems, went to the office and suggested that they contact their server.  It improved after that. 
We ate in the hotel on our first night and the food was pretty average.  The service, however, was dreadful.  E.g. We'd ordered wine which didn't turn up till we'd finished eating.  Breakfast service was equally bad.  The staff were all exceptionally pleasant, but ineffectual but I suppose the waiter can't help it if the kitchen is going at a snail's pace.

One of our group had stayed here about 7-8 years previously and said it had gone downhill.  An intensive staff training programme and a refurb of the bedrooms would make all the difference.
title: Lovely hotel.  But.....

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Slipped in for a couple of quick (or slow) beers with the Minister for Fun and somehow got waylaid into missing the sunset. 

Initially couldn’t get onto the veranda so sat in the bar looking out the ample windows at what I think is a cemetery across the road. After a short while and the arrival of two couples and what seemed like 8 kids between 1 and 10 - I took advantage of some one leaving and moved out onto the verandah, there to watch the world go by and marvel at some of the design features AND some of the other touristes. 

It is a nice spot to sit, think and drink, of course you pay for the privilege, it was marred somewhat by the lack of frigidity of the beer - maybe they thought I was English.
title: Beers on the Verandah

text: Lots of promise and a lovely setting. Colonial style and pleasant enough room on ground floor alongside the pool. Heard of Elephants resident above us on floor above spoilt the ambiance of our huge room. Food varied from splendid to mediocre. placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We were staying in the Fort Bazaar next door which does not have an alcohol licence so we sat on the terrace of The Galle Fort Hotel for evening drinks on both nights we were in Galle. The first night was great - service was friendly and professional. The second night the service was less friendly and more grudging. But the surprise came at the end of the evening when we asked for the bill and the waiter (didn't get his name unfortunately) just said the bill would be LKR2000 or thereabouts and just took the cash without a copy of the bill or a receipt. We knew that was about the correct amount but question management supervision that this is able to occur. 
There is no doubt in our minds that pocketing cash goes on amongst the staff. This is the only time this happened to us in Sri Lanka and places that turn a blind eye to it will damage their reputation with tourists very quickly. Management be warned.
title: Similar Experience to other reviewer - cash payments requested with no bill provided

The management did not appear to be around most of the time so it was difficult to discuss our opinions or requirements. The food was quite good but quite expensive & slow to be served we enjoyed our stay in Galle but would choose another hotel if we visit again.

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is a gorgeous 400 year old house that has been converted into a hotel.  The building, rooms and location are superb. The staff are lovely but nothing happens fast, if at all. Three phone calls to get laundry collected, no clean towels at the pool. Then guests towels and glasses left overnight by the pool, watching the wild cats poop while having dinner and having received the laundry back to find each item of clothing has been written on (on the inside) are all little things that left us curious about the training of the staff and the quality of the hotel. On the plus side, the food at breakfast and dinner was lovely and the location allows for a gentle stroll around Galle Fort.
title: Great Property, Pity about the service

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is in an old Dutch colonial house restored by an Australian 12 years ago. 
We stayed in the Admiral Chen Ho suite which had a four poster bed on the ground floor and a double up stairs. An amazing suite. Shower is indoors outdoors and pretty cool.
The pool is in a pretty courtyard, lovely, but smaller than the photos. 
Breakfast and dinner overlook the pool. There were stray cats but they didn't really bother us. The food was yummy - the fish and chicken curries a winner.
The bar was a bit chaotic and we waited a while for some less then chilled wine. But it was great people watching spot
A note - the rooms groan and squeak with the weight of the ages - so don't expect a quiet slumber - although it added to the charm of the place for us.
title: Lovely idea of a hotel
