placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is nice…however we didn’t like how they had used images of their sister hotel for Ubuntu beach villas. The pool area for Ubuntu is not as nice as Lantern which is pictured on the adverts and the restaurant is also located at Lantern. 

Secondly, we booked the whale watching for early morning to leave at 6.20 however they woke us up at 5.30 when we hadn’t asked for any sort of wake up call. 

Having said that, the staff were lovely and very helpful but we didn’t want to be woken up at 5.30am. 

Apart from this, the stay was fine.
title: Average

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text: My husband and I finished our 2 week trip here and it was bit disappointing. The room was lovely, as was the setting however the breakfast was the worst we had had by a country mile; they didnt have a lot of the options available that were on the menu and didnt tell you this until you had ordered. The bread was very stale and the presentation of the jams etc was really poor. What we were really disappointed with was the lack of staff anywhere, it was honestly ghost town. There was a really noisy family with kids screaming for hours on end in the small pool outside which meant from 4 until 8 you couldn't relax at all and there was no one around to either complain too or ask them to please reduce the sound. We were really shocked when we left to go out for dinner that the family's belonging including shoes, trunks, old food on plates were spread everywhere and nothing had been cleared away until early hours the next morning. The family really did treat it like it was their own villa which was a real shame. If there had been staff around maybe they could have cleared the plates or asked the family to move their stuff. I did complain to a member of staff when we checked out but nothing was said. Such a shame as the hotel itself is lovely, as is the beach and pool area.
title: Potential to be amazing

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text:
The room we had was absolutely amazing, great shower, great sea view, clean and comfortable. There's nothing quite like falling asleep to the sound of waves. 

Check in was a little distorted as there are three lantern hotels within 600 m of each other on this road. The location we stayed in had no reception and the check in was in our room and the information on the hotel was given to us hurriedly by a member of staff. When we came down from our room and needed to speak to staff it was hit or miss if they were there or not and sometimes we would wander round trying to find someone.

The location of the hotel was around 2.5km from the center of town and tuk tuks are always available however it's not really walkable especially after sunset. We arranged pick up one morning for a whale watching tour and the staff tried to get us to ride in the wrong tuk tuk and wouldn't really listen to our protests, eventually they realised their mistake and apologised however if we hadn't been so sure of ourselves they could have hampered the plans we had!

While waiting for our tuk tuk one evening waiting in the dining area we did sight a rat in the kitchen area, but I'm willing to accept it as a one off as the entire hotel was very clean. I did mention it to staff and they assured me they would sort it.

Otherwise the hotel was, as previously mentioned, beautifully decorated and very relaxing. The breakfast was plentiful and tasty and the food is the nearby "main hotel" was absolutely delicious, a little more expensive than in the town but you'd expect this from a hotel.
title: Great Room, beautiful location

ownerResponse/text:
Hi swoods101 , 

Thank you for choosing our hotel and taking time to review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your accommodation.
We look forward to welcome you back at Lantern Beach Collection in the future.
placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Ubuntu by Lantern for 2 nights at the very end of our vacation in Sri Lanka. The view from the pools and the ocean view rooms is incredible (it feels like you're about 10 feet from the ocean) and everything is clean and modern. The beach was basically deserted while we were there which was great though you did feel a bit limited for eating options (you could walk a couple hundred feet down the beach to the sister hotel for meals or take a tuk tuk into town but you can't just walk along the beach and see dozens of restaurants). 

The food at the hotel was good though a bit pricey compared to local options (everything is listed in USD). The staff was very helpful and friendly.

The location is probably the only drawback - if you want to spend all day on the beach or in the pool and are happy just eating at the hotel restaurant then this place is absolutely perfect. But if you want to eat an local places it's a little inconvenient - not because of distance but because you have to go through the process of changing out of your swimsuit, getting a tuk tuk, finding a place, etc. rather than just throwing on a sarong and walking along the beach. It's also slightly too far from Mirissa proper to just walk along the road.

One note - some of the pictures make it seem like you have a private plunge pool attached to your room (or maybe that's just my mistake). The pools are actually outside the lobby. They're great but I had made the mistake of thinking they were outside our room so that was a little disappointing.

The ocean was a little rough (strong waves/current) which might not be good for kids. One of our drivers said that further into Mirissa is a lot calmer than Galle where the hotel is.

Overall the hotel is really, really nice but the price and slightly inconvenient location make it only 3 stars in my mind.
title: Nice views, bit pricy

placeInfo/address: No 36-38 Clifford Place, Colombo 00400 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed here for two nights, it’s not the easiest located hotel but there is a view over the ocean and upon check in we were offered a city and ocean view which was nice.

The room rate was fair, but the hotel is quite small, small reception area is small. Breakfast was bedlam. 
Far too many people descended at once.

They were desperately trying to put everything out but it wasn’t working well. They don’t chill their juices so they pop a few ice cubes in the top. If you catch it first you’re lucky, you’ll get cold juice. If you miss that then you’re in for a mouthful of warm juice.

Bread was stale on the second day, just cutting corners and it was also busy… I think they offer breakfast to everyone hence the issues with quality, margarine not butter, warm juice and stale bread…

I probably wouldn’t return, service at the bar wasn’t great and the pool was tiny. The hotel pictures make you think it’s swimmable but realistically it’s not even 10 metres long!
title: A basic offering, chaotic breakfast

placeInfo/address: No 36-38 Clifford Place, Colombo 00400 Sri Lanka
text:
I took my mom on a surprise birthday visit to this place and I reserved a sea view superior room for both of us. When I requested for a surprise cake for my mom to our room on a payable basis they gracefully accepted to deliver a surprise cake without any added charges as a compliment! It’s so nice of them to do such complimentary surprises to the room on guest’s requests! My mom was super surprised, job well done by their staff members 🤗

Our room was all well furnished and all up to standards! But we had a very nice room with no balcony available for us to get any fresh air or admire the view of the sea by feeling that salty wind on our face! I don’t know why but they must be having their reasons for that! 

We stayed their for 2days and one night on a bed and breakfast basis where I felt it’s a little expensive but still completely compromised by their cozy room and that beautiful view from my room! How can I forget to mention their infinity pool on the rooftop, had a great time in the pool again with that sea view! They also have a bar right next to the pool where not only the residents but also the common people pay random visits anytime during the day! that might put you in little uncomfortable place if you are also a shy person like me, when you are already in the pool and surrounded by many people! 

They have a restaurant called “EAT AT OZO” where they do buffets which is situated in widely spaced area with very good furnitures and interior designs which I thoroughly admired! They do have a great sea view from the dining area which was great! Their food range was good but not that great also not that much of staff attention, for example on their buffet table if any dish was over they don’t pay attention to refill it soon, so you had to give up trying that dish instead of just trying that dish if they refill it on time!

Overall we had a great time staying at Ozo Colombo and my mom enjoyed staying here!
title: View was great

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest, Greetings from Sentido Heritance Negombo, Sri Lanka! We value your time and effort in sharing your feedback with us. Thank you for bringing your experiences to our notice. We will definitely conduct a peer review and make necessary improvements. Every feedback of our guests is invaluable to us as we are passionate about ameliorating the guests experience in the future. placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Не стоит выбирать всё включено.
text:
Отель абсолютно не стоит своих денег и не предоставляет заявленного уровня комфорта. Начать стоит с особенностей планировки номера типа deluxe, планировка "открытая", из кабинки с унитазом резкий запах канализации, душевая кабина свободно сообщается с комнатой и входом. Вторая проблема - питания, дело вовсе не в качестве питания, а в системе всё включено. Мы приобрели тур с системой всё включено и пожалели. К примеру, в стоимость AI не входит чай в ресторане и баре, его предлагают пить в номере!! Кофе только в основном ресторане Blue tan. Почти каждый день обеды по меню!!!, 23.01.2025 и ужин был по меню, поскольку проводилась свадьба. Свадьба - отдельная головная боль. Шатёр и прочие сооружения возвели близко от номеров. Мы проживали на 1 этаже и гости свадьбы находили возможным сидеть на нашем балконе. Разумеется, свадьба была шумной,что мешало отдыху. Бассейн неглубокий, в самой глубокой зоне достигает 1,2 метра.  Бассейн закрывается в 19:00. Проход к океану так же закрывается в 19:00. Да, он тут по разрешению охраны. Никаких прочих активностей нет. В первые два дня постоянно приходилось решать проблемы с тем что, что-либо не работает. Не открывалась дверь на балкон, затем не работал потолочный вентилятор. 
В целом, отель отличный, но при покупке тура необходимо понимать все особенности. Это не резорт, не пляжный отель, а городской отель хорошего уровня.
К сожалению, нам, как и многим прочим туристам из России позиционировали этот отель как пляжный с хорошей системой всё включено.
title: Разочарование

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest Hans, Greetings from Sentido Heritance Negombo, Sri Lanka! We value your time and effort in sharing your experience and feedback with us. placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Sentido Heritance Negombo

Upon arrival it feels like we have arrived at a ministry or something. Bare cold entrance.
The staff behave like some kind of government employees. No hospitality feeling at all and somewhat bureaucratic. I understand that hotels at this level are a bit more formal, but still.
The room itself is nice, fairly new and comfortable, nice view. Bluetan the restaurant where we decide to have lunch is empty and feels a bit soulless, actually the whole hotel feels soulless. Staff is correct and in large numbers, therefore somewhat inefficient. The pool man and bar man are a lot more personal and efficient. The beach is also cold, furniture is without atmosphere and covered in bird droppings. Half the swimming pool is without water. The entire building looks like a prison from the outside.  An question about an excursion on their own website, 4 people have to consult, as if we are asking for something very special. No Sentido, there is work to be done.
title: SOULLES

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a one night stay before exploring other places in Sri Lanka.

Pros:
Close to the airport (30 mins in a car)
Spacious room & extremely comfortable bed
Balcony overlooking the beach
Excellent gym 
Well located & close to good bars & restaurants. 
Pool looked great. 
Wonderful view from room.  
Friendly, helpful staff 

Cons:
Water in shower was tepid/cold in the morning (if you increased the temperature there was such low water pressure, very little water came out).
Toilet smelt of sewage. 
Very few vegan options at breakfast & no non-dairy or plant-based milk. 
Beach right outside hotel is fine but strewn with litter a little further on.
title: A convenient & comfortable hotel for a stopover.

text: We verbleven na aankomst in Sri Lanka twee nachten in dit hotel. De ontvangst was hartelijk en de kamer die we kregen netjes. We sliepen helaas minder goed want de kamer was erg gehorig. text: This is a practical and functional hotel close to the airport, making it a good base to stop over night and explore locality. There were plenty of dining options within walking distance. The hotel was clean and staff friendly but the whole experience was functional, practical and impersonal. Our room faced the ocean and overlooked the pool, which was nice but this is NOT a 5* hotel. text:
We had a few days here after touring and for airport convenience. Large hotel with facilities. Our room facing the sea was not huge but comfortable with all the equipment you need. Clean and well serviced. Hotel overall showing some signs of wear and tear but not enough to spoil our stay. Nice pool and sunbathing area with pool bar. Nice beach view but no facilities on (public) beach and sea too rough for swimming. Convenient location for the strip of shops and restaurants.
Staff generally friendly and professional.
Downside was the shambolic breakfast buffet, food was fine but the numerous waiting staff seemed incapable of simply clearing a dirty table and resetting properly and immediately for guests waiting to eat. No organisation at all.
title: Comfortable and convenient

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We came on a business trip to Sentido Heritance. The check in staff were lovely and quick to show us to our rooms.

We had a deluxe room with direct pool access. While the room was nice and tidy, the design of the room was slightly awkward. The bathroom and shower area are separate and the closet is quite small for what you'd expect from a luxury hotel.

The room provides toiletries but falls shorts in terms of amenities. In terms of the hotel's offerings, they have a big pool, good gym, and an excellent spa that you must experience when staying. I had the balinese massage and Julie was my masseuse. She worked out my stressed muscles wonderfully!

In terms of the food, it wasn't the best. They had a good spread, but could definitely improve. Staff are friendly. One recommendation I could say is the pool needs to be regularly cleaned as it had a lot of gunk floating around.

Overall, Sentido falls short in terms of a luxury hotel.
title: A short stay

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest Michael, Greetings from Sentido Heritance Negombo, Sri Lanka! Thanks for sharing your experience during your stay. We have taken a note of your other concern as well. Hope this will not deter you to make another visit soon. Thank you.

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Wie auf den Fotos gezeigt
text:
Das Hotel liegt strategisch gut und ist nur 100 Meter vom Meer entfernt mit schönem
Sandstrand. Ein Absperrungszaun zwischen Meer und dem Hotel ist ebenfalls vorhanden, der einem jeweils von den Sicherheitsbeamten geöffnet wird, das schützt einem von streunenden Hunden und unerwünschten Händlern/Gästen. Der Pool hatte ca. 28 Grad C, was angenehm mit der Bar verbunden ist, an der man auch im Wasser die Drinks sitzend geniessen kann. Das Personal ist sehr frendlich und zuvorkommen.
Guter sympatischer Empfang.  Das Zimmer war so wie wir es bestellt hatten. Jedoch fehlte der Föhn und für 2 Personen nur 1 kleine Taube Dusch Gel, die Minibar war leer.
Die sich im Zimmer befindenen Moskitos machten es nicht besser. Wenn man um den Pool auf den Liegestühlen platzt nimmt bemerkt man, dass diese schon einiges auf dem Buckel hatten, Das schlimmste jedoch sind die 100 schaften von Krähen, die ununterbrochen den ganzen Tag krähen und so kommt man auf den Liegestühlen nicht zur Ruhe, schlimmer jedoch noch, dass diese ständig im Pool Wasser trinken und alles mit ihrem Kot beschmutzen. Die Beschmutzung geht bis auf die Balkone der Zimmer. Das Frühstück ist einem 5 Sterne Hotel nicht würdig, so kennen wir auf jedenfall, die von uns besuchten 5 Sterne Hotels nicht. Alles in allem ist dieses Hotel in die Jahre gekommen. Uebrigens wer einen Varan sehen will, den
title: 4 Sterne Ja aber kein 5 Sterne Hotel

After 12 hours flying to Colombo checked in to Heritance Negombo. Quick check in by Front desk and good service given by restaurant and also Sea Lounge at the top floor with the best sea view. Everything is Ok.. But a man who delivered our bags to room, Name Aruna he delivered our bags and after delivered bags he begging tips  money & waiting in the room looking at our wallet and pocket asking ''Sir / Madam,Everything is fine,Everything is ok'' like that. Normal procedure is taking the bags and check withe guest and keep on the baggage desk and leave from room.I think it's not good for a five star hotel because giving service for the guest it not depends on tips.
However all good - Staff, Foods and everything !! 
Come back to heritance for our next vacation !!
Thank you all..
title: The best service given.. But not five star..Only 4 Star..

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just avoid
text: The grounds are immaculate but the windows while eating in the restaurant have never been cleaned while we have been here so can’t see out most of them (day 5 so far). We went for full board but we only get a set menu not a cost towards the full menu so not A La Carte. The beef is so chewy it’s horrendous, the pork is just all fat and the portions are out of proportion ie lots of rice with a tiny bowl of curry on the side. The worst part is that there is no entertainment what so ever, the background music in the restaurant is the same music come breakfast, lunch or dinner with just one album of Christmas piano music. We came here to relax yes but we are bored now, bored of the food bored of the music. The only reason I’ve given a higher score than this place deserves is the sky bar, it’s open from 4pm and the waiter there is fantastic and attentive, the music is background but never the same. We won’t be here again
title: Boring

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed one night here on a stopover, it's pretty close to the airport and is on the whole quite a nice hotel, the room I stayed in was average, bathroom slightly tired but the bar and restaurant were both nice. What I found most off-putting was the lady at reception was quite passive aggressive 'put your bag here' 'give me your credit card' etc, but what really left a bad impression was on checkout, the same lady basically told me to sit and give a review on tripadvisor, ordering me to us my phone to follow a QR code to leave a review, if I want to leave a review I will, I really didn't appreciate the way in which she was instructing me to review them before i'd even left the building. So here it is, your review, if you weren't so passive aggressive/rude with me then maybe I'd have felt I wanted to leave a better review of my own accord.
title: Rude Reception Spoiled Otherwise OK Hotel

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Go to an other hotel.
text:
We decided to go to Heritance for our last days at Sri Lanka. The hotel appears as a luxurious resort, but there are some big bursts in this bubble.
The bookingprocess at their own website has some flaws. If you come with children you have to pay 30 dollars extra per night for a extra bed. During our booking we checked the boxes for our child and his age, so we expected the extra fee for an extra bed was already paid. But no.. so the communication can improve on their website.

A part of the pool was closed for cleaning (funny I saw no one cleaning it). The sunbeds stand in a beautiful garden with well maintained grass. Unfortunately the sunbeds can have some maintaince to. Cracked linnen, so comfort is not so high. The man who gives the beachtowels was not friendly at all. 
Upon arrival our curtains could not close the whole window. This was nicely repaired the next day.
Clean up service let our balcony door open after cleaning and they forgot to replace our towels one day. When we asked for new towels we had to wait 45 minutes to get new ones. And of course they brought two in stead of three.
Because our flight was early we were not able to have our breakfast. They provided the service of a take away box. But again, they gave us two in stead of three.
Beeakfast buffet is nice and has lots of choices.
I wouldn't reccommend this hotel. Next trip I will try Jetwing blue if i want to stay in five star hotel. This hotel needs to improve their hospitality and when they do, they can be superb.
title: Least friendly hotel during our roundtrip

ownerResponse/text:
A warm greeting to you,

Your kind review has warmed our hearts! We're overjoyed that your stay was memorable. Your compliments inspire us to continue offering excellent service. We anticipate your next visit with great enthusiasm!

Kindest Regards, Management

ownerResponse/text: Thank you very much for your review and apologized for any inconvenience
placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
We had three nights at this hotel as we wanted to see the cultural triangle
The hotel is having an extension built but there was little activity on the building while we were there 
The shame is that the existing hotel needs tender loving care as it doesn’t seem complete
Stray dogs run around the grounds and foul on the grass etc and of night fall they bark and howl non-stop
There is a temple close by that has prayers starting at 4 am ish so again adding to the cacophony of noise
We ate in Sigiriya town each night so had a taxi in and back
By the time we returned which was 10pm the bar was closing, and all the other residents were in bed!!
Breakfast is buffet style and good
The pool area is nice, but the stray dogs can access the area and drink from the pool 
The staff are nice and try hard to help
title: Must be better hotels in the area

text:

The rooms are clean the bathroom was modern and bright but best of all the bed was really comfortable,not that it could be really enjoyed unfortunately one of the local resident’s started reading his poems at an abnormally unusual hour not the hours which you would expect unfortunately the speaker was also exceptionally loud, which  was frustrating for most people around the area this may not always be the case but the 2 nights we stayed we had a very interrupted sleep.
The owner / manager was an excellent host and the staff were brilliant.

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a two night stay here on the basis of a friend who had stayed here three times. 

The hotel is lovely, the staff extremely welcoming and attentive but there were a few points that meant we ended up feeling a bit disappointed. 

First the location - 1km off the main road (the A6). It’s hidden away and not easy to find. Our taxi driver there said it was the first time he’s driven on that village road. It’s peaceful but you are stuck there, reliant on the Hotel calling a tuktuk orTaxi. 

Second, it’s is billed as a cultural resort. The only entertainment was one evening a chap playing Western songs on a keyboard. The rest of the time was taped music of Western hits sung locally. And apart from the lovely pool there is nothing to do. Nothing. 

Finally, after lots of lovely food on our holiday, we were really disappointed with the food - buffet at breakfast and dinner. You really don’t have much choice but to eat there; and it was a mix of Western food and Sri Lankan gloop. Not spicy and though fresh wasn’t up to the standard we’d hoped for. We did have an excellent curry and rice one lunch (having got back from Sigiriya earlier than expected) so the chef can work wonders. It’s obvious though that it’s small mass catering (but only about 20 tables). 

The costs of getting around weren’t too bad (1800Rps to get a tuktuk to the rock and back, while the driver waits. All in about a four hour round trip with a 20 minute drive there and back. And 10.000 to get to Kandy in a taxi taking about 2.5 hours. 

For a couple of days chilling away from the noise and bustle and sitting by the pool, it could suit you. You can do trips from the hotel - it’s easy to reach Sigiriya and Dambulla and you can also get a safari from there. It just wasn’t right for us.
title: Quiet, relaxing place to stay.

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
we stay at this hotel for several days in april.
that is new hotel in forest with good restaurant, spa and pool.
room was large and comfortable.
The breakfast were poor, untasty and served partially.
next day they serve buffe breakfast from the remains of yesterday dinner.
as minus there're no elivator to get upstairs.
title: good, not best

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is very new and has spacious rooms with great facilities. The rooms also have gorgeous views of Sigiriya and Piddurangula Rocks. Location wise it is quiet and not near restaurants etc so you need transport - but it is in the same road as Elephas Resort, Aliya, and Sigiriya Jungles. 
We tried the breakfast which had numerous choices on offer. 
We stayed 3 nights - the first two nights were fine, the beds are really comfortable and we had an awesome sleep but on our last night there were several families with kids staying and partying. The kids were slamming doors and running and shouting in the corridors and woke us up several times. The hotel is all tiles, concrete and hard surfaces so the noise carried. After asking the kids twice to be quiet I had to ask the management to help but they weren't interested.
title: Great new hotel - but noisy if there are partying kids

placeInfo/address: 10 Galle Road Moragalla, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Plus's roof top restaurant, nice setting, staff were pleasant, the menu for dinner had a good choice of dishes.
Minus's my menu had the steak price increased from 2000 to 3000 rupees in biro, I queried this and was informed that it was Australian steak. There were 4 of us dining, but only 3 of us had starters, 2 soups, which were very nice, and 1 mixed salad that didn't have the dressing that was described on the menu. 1 main course which was jumbo prawns arrived before we had finished our starters, which we sent back. When the mains arrived, I had ordered the steak,to be cooked medium rare,bit came medium raw, it was returned, on the menu it stated in a red wine sauce, no sauce, but the biggest problem was that it wasn't Australian steak, just local steak, I have lived in Sri Lanka for many years and know local steak. 
This to me is a complete and utter con job.to be fair the other 3 meals were acceptable but over priced for what you got, when they got them right, the prawnsh have had no salad, but french fries and rice, but came with salad, the pork chop should have had vegetables, but none arrived, until I commented.so all in all not the best experience. 
So unfortunately we will not be returning.
title: Only dined in the restaurant.

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring your bed socks! Avoid rooms on level 1 (basement level)
text: The gardens and public areas of this hotel are delightful. Manicured English gardens, charming sitting areas with comfy old world furnishings and open fires, walls covered in interesting photos and memorabilia from a bygone era, billiards room with full sized table, quiet nooks to relax and read a book and a lovely restaurant serving a great buffet breakfast not to mention the congenial, English pub style atmosphere of the bar. It’s the rest of the hotel that lets it down. The corridors are dark and smell musty, the rooms tired and in serious need of updating. Of the three windows in my room, only one could be opened without an effort, there was no fridge in the room, the TV didn’t work (no biggie for me as I was too busy to want to watch, but this shouldn’t happen) . The hot water bottles delivered to the room every evening were a nice touch but necessary as the rooms had no heating or cooling and Nuwara Eliya gets quite cold at night. Despite this, only once thin bedcover was provided, necessitating the donning of extra clothes once the hot water bottles cooled down. The staff were very accommodating and if people complained, issues were fixed. For example, a fridge was delivered to a room when asked for, however, in a 5* hotel this amenities should be standard. While I enjoyed my stay at St Andrew’s, I certainly wouldn’t rate it as 5 star.
title: A disappointing experience.

ownerResponse/text:

text: Nice stay, would be a parfect place in summertime - not in the monsun. It’s in the mountains så here is pretty cold when rain starts in may-September. A bit to cold in the room. Hot water not working great in bath. But they are trying their best in every way and the building and sourrodings and service-personal are top of the class.

We did enjoy our room, the gardens, lounge rooms. Staff kind. Building is historically interesting. We had a lunch in the garden which was charming. No pool is a tragedy (I understand there are future plans).

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid big rooms on 3rd floor
text:
On arrival we were warmly welcomed.  We were told we had been upgraded and the room was beautiful.  A birthday cake had been arranged for me which was really thoughtful and kind. Unfortunately the toilet and shower room was covered in mould which did create a smell of damp.  The sink had massive cracks in it.  It is a real shame as it really detracted from a beautiful room.  We were moved to a less grand but lovely garden room with a newly renovated bathroom the next morning. Lovely room but had constant buzz from electricity box. 😡
The staff are really lovely and friendly.  The bar area with log fires are so inviting and really good cocktails. The breakfast is good but could be improved, cannot comment on the evening meals as never ate at hotel.
The gardens are really spectacular.  
The hotel has so much to offer and it could be really good with some renovation which I know they are currently undertaking. Disappointingly I’m not sure I would stay here again.
title: Mixed experience.

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Evitad la habitación 111...
text: Hotel 100% victoriano. No es lo que esperas si haces un tour por Sri Lanka. El estilo no es de mi gusto aunque lo respeto. Poco iluminado, todas las salas muy oscuras,creo que las instalaciones necesitan una buena renovacion y alguna otra ammenitie aparte de sentarte en un sofá. Los jardines muy bonitos y cuidados. La comida la típica que encuentras en todo el pais. El wifi es bastante deficiente en comparación con otros hoteles del pais. En principio nos dieron una habitación horrible,pero hicimos una reclamación y nos cambiaron a una suite. Quiero destacar el comportamiento totalmente profesional, atento,amable y efectivo de Mr. Kavish. En todo momento se preocupó del problema y lo solucionó con excelente profesionalidad. Para esta persona y el resto de personal SÍ que doy una puntuación de cinco estrellas.
title: 100% victoriano. Poco entretenimiento. Trato personal exquisito

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
L’hotel est une belle batisse ancienne de style anglais, a l’ambiance Agatha Christie sympathique qui donne l’impression de voyager dans le temps.
Le personnel est gentil mais plutot moins qu ailleurs notamment les grooms. 
Les chambres sont jolies avec leur charme suranné. 
Malheureusement le restaurant est vraiment infect. Le buffet est effrayant : produits secs qui attendent visiblement plusieurs jours sur les plateaux, curry avec des morceaux ou il y a plus d os que de viande, peu de diversité, le tout à un prix tres élevé.
Pas de piscine. 
Des jardiniers qui creusent sous vos fenetres…
Au final on paye cher pour un emplacement mais le reste ne suit pas.
L’arret à Nuwara Eliya ne sert à rien en réalité. Allez plutot directement à Kandy.
title: Nourriture infecte et prix trop élevé

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Hoe komt een hotel aan 5 sterren? Zeker niet waard. kamers zijn gedateerd, sanitaire voorzieningen ooit goed geweest. Dat in Sri Lanka achter loopt met investeren wordt in andere hotels goed gemaakt door prijs, vriendelijkheid of andere leuke dingen. Hier niet aan de orde. Jammer, maar en volgende keer slaan we dit hotel over
title: Een teleurstelling

text: This is an old hotel from days gone by so is interesting and a bit special because of that. From the outside the setting and grounds are quite beautiful. But no modernising has happened. The rooms are very dated. Not even a fridge in the room. The hotel is very cold. Dining room is freezing. There were people wearing their coats to dinner! Rooms a bit warmer and heaters provided. You can ask for extra blankets which we did. Dinner food only average. Very well presented but not fab. Breakfast was good though. There’s even a billiards Room in the hotel but we were too cold to use it. Walking distance from the town area.

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for one night on our honeymoon. They pit flowers on the bed and surprised us with a chocolate cake at our arrival. The room was for 4, with a second floor that we didn’t used of course. The bed was very big and linen was clean. The decoration was colonial style, a bit old and too flowery for our taste. There was no evening cleaning or water refill during the evening (2 small bottles is not enough for 2 people). The bathroom was the worst, bad lightning, super old shower and very basic in towels and amenities. It was difficult to put our stuff somewhere rather than on top of the toilet. For a good hotel, they should reconsider some bathroom refurbishment at the very least.
The bar and the snacks were great. All workers were very helpful and nice with us. You can enjoy a cold beer with a burger or sandwich.
Breakfast was buffet, with a lot of options, western and local.
title: Noisy, No elevator, old interior

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Consiglio di prenotare una camera al piano superiore o comunque verificare che la camera assegnata sia stata ristrutturata.
text: La struttura è magnifica, stile British, Reception, sala lettura giardini e sale comuni super curati, personale gentilissimo e super efficiente tuttavia la camera che mi è stata assegnata, sebbene superior, non era da hotel quattro stelle in quanto presentava parecchie pecche. Ho fatto presente il tutto al personale che, laddove è stato possibile, ha posto rimedio. Ho avuto modo di parlare anche con il direttore, anch’egli molto gentile e dispiaciuto, gli ho spiegato che questo potrebbe benissimo essere un hotel cinque stelle ma che devono prendersene più cura e prestare più attenzione anche alle piccole cose perché sono anche quelle che contribuiscono all’immagine.
title: Potrebbe benissimo essere un hotel 5 stelle ma…

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for one night in early September. The staff was quite helpful and very accommodating. We tried the high tea option which was exactly how high tea should be served on a 3-tier stand full of savory and sweet delights -- it was excellent! The beds in the room were generally comfortable. The access to the attic is a bit treacherous as it required going up some steep steps barely large enough for a foothold. The bathroom requires some major renovation. The grout lines around the tiles were disgusting with dirt lodged inside. The workmanship of the tile work and grout were subpar as if it had been done by a child. The property itself has the old English charm and it is beautiful, but Jetwing needs to seriously put in some TLC to make it worthwhile starting with the bathrooms.
title: Beautiful Location -- Needs Improvement

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t expect anything like the stately homes in the U.K.
text: Called in on recommendation and being British hoped it reminisced a bygone era of colonial rule.We were met by a goofy guy on entering who advised the requirement to purchase a day pass for a tour around,not on our own but by a guy who was as dull as ditch water.Anyway,off we went accompanied closely by our guide who took us on a short tour pointing out different items of memorabilia from a past era which was more like a museum to British artefacts than anything else.The whole house stunk of mould/damp,I can only assume that they need the money from tours for it’s upkeep.I’m glad we weren’t staying here as it lacked elegance and charm which is sad as I can imagine it was a hive of activity in days gone by!
title: Living off past grandeur!

Once again, we appreciate your valuable feedback and hope to welcome you back in the future for a better experience.

The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: On a positive note the gardens and entrance to the hotel are divine. The waiting staff are very kind and work very hard to ensure a good experience. Breakfast was really excellent and we had formal dinner for 14 in members dining room which was great. Some of our guests borrowed jackets which added to the fun of the evening. Negative side the decor really lets the hotel down. The bedroom furnishings are so dated and everything would benefit from a fresh coat of paint. The women’s bathroom near the dining room has been renovated and it’s gorgeous. The rest of the hotel needs to follow suit and quickly. There is a quaint component to the current decor but it’s hard to see it. Hot waters bags cute touch in evening. It should be fabulous!
title: Glory days well past

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We appreciate your feedback regarding our property and the dining experience. While we strive to maintain the classic charm of our historic structure, we understand that some aspects may feel dated for certain guests. We also acknowledge your comments about the dress code, and we apologize if this caused any inconvenience. Our intention is to offer a unique experience that reflects the traditions of the past.
We are glad you enjoyed the food, and we value your insights as we continually work to improve our services and guest experiences.
Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope to welcome you back in the future.

Best regards,
The Hill Club Team

text:
Struttura datata e dal tono presuntuoso. Il cibo è buono ma tornando alla struttura la moquette si trova quasi dappertutto (eccetto nel ristorante principale) e obbligo di indossare l’avito a cena…forse per qualcuno potrebbe essere un gioco divertente.
Nel paesino c’è poco da vedere
title: Struttura un po’ datata dal tono presuntuoso
